And he called to her and said, “Please bring me a little water in a cup, that I may drink.” </dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And as she was going to get it, he called to her and said, “Please bring me a morsel of bread in your hand.” </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So she said, “As the Lord your God lives, I do not have bread, only a handful of flour in a bin, and a little oil in a jar; and see, I am gathering a couple of sticks that I may go in and prepare it for myself and my son, that we may eat it, and die.” </dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And Elijah said to her, “Do not fear; go and do as you have said, but make me a small cake from it first, and bring it to me; and afterward make some for yourself and your son. </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For thus says the Lord God of Israel: ‘The bin of flour shall not be used up, nor shall the jar of oil run dry, until the day the Lord sends rain on the earth.’ “ </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So she went away and did according to the word of Elijah; and she and he and her household ate for many days. </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>The bin of flour was not used up, nor did the jar of oil run dry, according to the word of the Lord which He spoke by Elijah. </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Now it happened after these things that the son of the woman who owned the house became sick. And his sickness was so serious that there was no breath left in him. </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>So she said to Elijah, “What have I to do with you, O man of God? Have you come to me to bring my sin to remembrance, and to kill my son?” </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And he said to her, “Give me your son.” So he took him out of her arms and carried him to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed. </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then he cried out to the Lord and said, “O Lord my God, have You also brought tragedy on the widow with whom I lodge, by killing her son?” </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And he stretched himself out on the child three times, and cried out to the Lord and said, “O Lord my God, I pray, let this child’s soul come back to him.” </dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then the Lord heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came back to him, and he revived. </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And Elijah took the child and brought him down from the upper room into the house, and gave him to his mother. And Elijah said, “See, your son lives!” </dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then the woman said to Elijah, “Now by this I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of the Lord in your mouth is the truth.” </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 61:10-62:5  (Vespers 9th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation, He has covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decks himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For as the earth brings forth its bud, as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth, so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>For Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness goes forth as brightness, and her salvation as a lamp that burns. </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>The Gentiles shall see your righteousness, and all kings your glory. You shall be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord will name.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>You shall also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of your God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You shall no longer be termed Forsaken, nor shall your land any more be termed Desolate; but you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for the Lord delights in you, and your land shall be married.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For as a young man marries a virgin, so shall your sons marry you; and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so shall your God rejoice over you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Genesis 22:1-18  (Vespers 10th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it came to pass after these things that God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then He said, “Take now your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>So Abraham rose early in the morning and saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son; and he split the wood for the burnt offering, and arose and went to the place of which God had told him.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Then on the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and saw the place afar off.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; the lad and I will go yonder and worship, and we will come back to you.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>So Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife, and the two of them went together.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But Isaac spoke to Abraham his father and said, “My father!” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” Then he said, “Look, the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And Abraham said, “My son, God will provide for Himself the lamb for a burnt offering.” So the two of them went together.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then they came to the place of which God had told him. And Abraham built an altar there and placed the wood in order; and he bound Isaac his son and laid him on the altar, upon the wood.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slay his son.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But the Angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham, Abraham!” So he said, “Here I am.”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And He said, “Do not lay your hand on the lad, or do anything to him; for now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from Me.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then Abraham lifted his eyes and looked, and there behind him was a ram caught in a thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram, and offered it up for a burnt offering instead of his son.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And Abraham called the name of the place, The-Lord-Will-Provide; as it is said to this day, “In the Mount of the Lord it shall be provided.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Then the Angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time out of heaven,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>and said: “By Myself I have sworn, says the Lord, because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son – </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>“blessing I will bless you, and multiplying I will multiply your descendants as the stars of the heaven and as the sand which is on the seashore; and your descendants shall possess the gate of their enemies.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>“In your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed, because you have obeyed My voice.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 61:1-9  (Vespers 11th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>“The Spirit of the Lord God is upon Me, because the Lord has anointed Me to preach good tidings to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to those who are bound;</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord, and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all who mourn, </dd><dt>3</dt><dd>to console those who mourn in Zion, to give them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they may be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that He may be glorified.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And they shall rebuild the old ruins, they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the ruined cities, the desolations of many generations.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the foreigner shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers. </dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But you shall be named the priests of the Lord, they shall call you the servants of our God. You shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and in their glory you shall boast.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Instead of your shame you shall have double honor, and instead of confusion they shall rejoice in their portion. Therefore in their land they shall possess double; everlasting joy shall be theirs.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>“For I, the Lord, love justice; I hate robbery for burnt offering; I will direct their work in truth, and will make with them an everlasting covenant.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Their descendants shall be known among the Gentiles, and their offspring among the people. All who see them shall acknowledge them, that they are the posterity whom the Lord has blessed.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 4[2] Kings 4:8-37  (Vespers 12th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>Now it happened one day that Elisha went to Shunem, where there was a notable woman, and she persuaded him to eat some food. So it was, as often as he passed by, he would turn in there to eat some food. </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And she said to her husband, “Look now, I know that this is a holy man of God, who passes by us regularly. </dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Please, let us make a small upper room on the wall; and let us put a bed for him there, and a table and a chair and a lampstand; so it will be, whenever he comes to us, he can turn in there.” </dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And it happened one day that he came there, and he turned in to the upper room and lay down there. </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then he said to Gehazi his servant, “Call this Shunammite woman.” When he had called her, she stood before him. </dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And he said to him, “Say now to her, ‘Look, you have been concerned for us with all this care. What can I do for you? Do you want me to speak on your behalf to the king or to the commander of the army?’ “ She answered, “I dwell among my own people.” </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>So he said, “What then is to be done for her?” And Gehazi answered, “Actually, she has no son, and her husband is old.” </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So he said, “Call her.” When he had called her, she stood in the doorway. </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then he said, “About this time next year you shall embrace a son.” And she said, “No, my lord. Man of God, do not lie to your maidservant!” </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But the woman conceived, and bore a son when the appointed time had come, of which Elisha had told her. </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And the child grew. Now it happened one day that he went out to his father, to the reapers. </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And he said to his father, “My head, my head!” So he said to a servant, “Carry him to his mother.” </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>When he had taken him and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon, and then died. </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God, shut the door upon him, and went out. </dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then she called to her husband, and said, “Please send me one of the young men and one of the donkeys, that I may run to the man of God and come back.” </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>So he said, “Why are you going to him today? It is neither the New Moon nor the Sabbath.” And she said, “It is well.” </dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then she saddled a donkey, and said to her servant, “Drive, and go forward; do not slacken the pace for me unless I tell you.” </dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And so she departed, and went to the man of God at Mount Carmel. So it was, when the man of God saw her afar off, that he said to his servant Gehazi, “Look, the Shunammite woman!. </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Please run now to meet her, and say to her, ‘Is it well with you? Is it well with your husband? Is it well with the child?’ “ And she answered, “It is well.” </dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Now when she came to the man of God at the hill, she caught him by the feet, but Gehazi came near to push her away. But the man of God said, “Let her alone; for her soul is in deep distress, and the Lord has hidden it from me, and has not told me.” </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>So she said, “Did I ask a son of my lord? Did I not say, ‘Do not deceive me’?” </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Then he said to Gehazi, “Get yourself ready, and take my staff in your hand, and be on your way. If you meet anyone, do not greet him; and if anyone greets you, do not answer him; but lay my staff on the face of the child.” </dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And the mother of the child said, “As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” So he arose and followed her. </dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Now Gehazi went on ahead of them, and laid the staff on the face of the child; but there was neither voice nor hearing. Therefore he went back to meet him, and told him, saying, “The child has not awakened.” </dd><dt>32</dt><dd>When Elisha came into the house, there was the child, lying dead on his bed. </dd><dt>33</dt><dd>He went in therefore, shut the door behind the two of them, and prayed to the Lord. </dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And he went up and lay on the child, and put his mouth on his mouth, his eyes on his eyes, and his hands on his hands; and he stretched himself out on the child, and the flesh of the child became warm. </dd><dt>35</dt><dd>He returned and walked back and forth in the house, and again went up and stretched himself out on him; then the child sneezed seven times, and the child opened his eyes. </dd><dt>36</dt><dd>And he called Gehazi and said, “Call this Shunammite woman.” So he called her. And when she came in to him, he said, “Pick up your son.” </dd><dt>37</dt><dd>So she went in, fell at his feet, and bowed to the ground; then she picked up her son and went out. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 63:11-64:5  (Vespers 13th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Then he remembered the days of old, Moses and his people, saying: “Where is He who brought them up out of the sea With the shepherd of His flock? Where is He who put His Holy Spirit within them, </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Who led them by the right hand of Moses, with His glorious arm, dividing the water before them to make for Himself an everlasting name,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Who led them through the deep, as a horse in the wilderness, that they might not stumble?”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>As a beast goes down into the valley, and the Spirit of the Lord causes him to rest, so You lead Your people, to make Yourself a glorious name.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Look down from heaven, and see from Your habitation, holy and glorious. Where are Your zeal and Your strength, the yearning of Your heart and Your mercies toward me? Are they restrained?</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Doubtless You are our Father, though Abraham was ignorant of us, and Israel does not acknowledge us. You, O Lord, are our Father; our Redeemer from Everlasting is Your name.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>O Lord, why have You made us stray from Your ways, and hardened our heart from Your fear? Return for Your servants’ sake, the tribes of Your inheritance.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Your holy people have possessed it but a little while; our adversaries have trodden down Your sanctuary.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>We have become like those of old, over whom You never ruled, those who were never called by Your name.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Oh, that You would rend the heavens! That You would come down! That the mountains might shake at Your presence – </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>As fire burns brushwood, as fire causes water to boil – to make Your name known to Your adversaries, that the nations may tremble at Your presence!</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>When You did awesome things for which we did not look, You came down, the mountains shook at Your presence. </dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For since the beginning of the world men have not heard nor perceived by the ear, nor has the eye seen any God besides You, Who acts for the one who waits for Him.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>You meet him who rejoices and does righteousness, who remembers You in Your ways. You are indeed angry, for we have sinned – in these ways we continue; and we need to be saved.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Jeremiah 31:31-34  (Vespers 14th  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>Thus says the Lord: Behold, the days are when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah,</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>not like the covenant which I made with their fathers when I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt, my covenant which they broke, though I was their husband, says the Lord.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But this is the covenant which I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I will put my law within them, and I will write it upon their hearts; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And no longer shall each man teach his neighbor and each his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, says the Lord; for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Daniel 3:1-23 Song of the Three: 1-66 with verses  (Vespers 15th  reading)
readings.contents:
1
King Nebuchadnez’zar made an image of gold, whose height was sixty cubits and its breadth six cubits. He set it up on the plain of Dura, in the province of Babylon.
2
Then King Nebuchadnez’zar sent to assemble the satraps, the prefects, and the governors, the counselors, the treasurers, the justices, the magistrates, and all the officials of the provinces to come to the dedication of the image which King Nebuchadnez’zar had set up.
3
Then the satraps, the prefects, and the governors, the counselors, the treasurers, the justices, the magistrates, and all the officials of the provinces, were assembled for the dedication of the image that King Nebuchadnez’zar had set up.
4
And the herald proclaimed aloud, “You are commanded, O peoples, nations, and languages,
5
that when you hear the sound of the horn, pipe, lyre, trigon, harp, bagpipe, and every kind of music, you are to fall down and worship the golden image that King Nebuchadnez’zar has set up;
6
and whoever does not fall down and worship shall immediately be cast into a burning fiery furnace”.
7
Therefore, as soon as all the peoples heard the sound of the horn, pipe, lyre, trigon, harp, bagpipe, and every kind of music, all the peoples, nations, and languages fell down and worshiped the golden image which King Nebuchadnez’zar had set up.
8
Therefore at the time certain Chalde’ans came forward and maliciously accused the Jews.
9
They said to King Nabuchadnez’zar, “O king live for ever!
10
You, O king, have made a decree, that every man who hears the sound of the horn, pipe, lyre, trigon, harp, bagpipe, and every kind of music, shall fall down and worship the golden image;
11
and whoever does not fall down and worship shall be cast into a burning fiery furnace.
12
There are certain Jews whom you have appointed over the affairs of the province of Babylon: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed’nego. These men, O king, pay no heed to you; they do not serve your gods or worship the golden image which you have set up.”
13
Then Nebuchadnez’zar in furious rage commanded that Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed’nego brought. Then they brought these men before the king.
14
Nebuchadnez’zar said to them, “Is it true, O Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed’nego, that you do not serve my gods or worship the golden image which I have set up?
15
Now if you are ready when you hear the sound of the horn, pipe, lyre, trigon, harp, bagpipe, and every kind of music, to fall down and worship the image which I have made, well and good; but if you do not worship, you shall immediately be cast into a burning fiery furnace; and who is the god that will deliver you out of my hands?”
16
Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed’nego answered the king, “O Nebuchadnez’zar, we have no need to answer you in this matter.
17
If it be so, our God who we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace; and he will deliver us out of your hand, O king.
18
But if not, be it known to you, O king, that we will not serve your gods or worship the golden image which you have set up.”
19
Then Nebuchadnez’zar was full of fury, and the expression of his face was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed’nego. He ordered the furnace heated seven times more than it was wont to be heated.
20
And he ordered certain mighty men of his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, and to cast them into the burning fiery furnace.
21
Then these men were bound in their mantles, their tunics, their hats, and their other garments, and they were cast into the burning fiery furnace.
22
Because the king’s order was strict and the furnace very hot, the flame of the fire slew those men who took up Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego.
23
And these three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell bound into the burning fiery furnace.
24
And they walked about in the midst of the flames, singing hymns to God and blessing the Lord.
25
Then Azariah [This section is from the Greek Septuagint, which uses the names Hananiah (Shadrach), Mishael (Meshach), and Azariah (Abed’nego) in place of the Hebrew-Babylonian forms] stood and offered this prayer, in the midst of the fire he opened his mouth and said:
26
“Blessed art Thou, O Lord, God of our fathers, and worthy of praise; and Thy name is glorified for ever.
27
“For Thou art just in all that Thou has done to us, and all Thy works are true and Thy ways right, and all Thy judgments are truth.
28
“Thou has executed true judgments in all that Thou hast brought upon us and upon Jerusalem, the holy city of our fathers, for in truth and justice Thou has brought all this upon us because of our sins.
29
“For we have sinfully and lawlessly departed from Thee, and have sinned in all things and have not obeyed Thy commandments;
30
we have not observed them or done them, as Thou has commanded us that it might go well with us.
31
“So all that Thou hast brought upon us, and all that Thou hast done to us, Thou has done in true judgment.
32
“Thou hast given us into the hands of lawless enemies, most hateful rebels, and to an unjust king, the most wicked in all the world.
33
And now we cannot open our mouths; shame and disgrace have befallen Thy servants and worshipers.
34
“For Thy name’s sake do not give us up utterly, and do not break Thy covenant,
35
and do not withdraw Thy mercy from us, for the sake of Abraham Thy beloved and for the sake of Isaac Thy servant and Israel Thy holy one,
36
to whom Thou didst promise to make their descendants as many as the stars of heaven and as the sand on the shore of the sea.
37
“For we, O Lord, have become fewer than any nation, and are brought low this day in all the world because of our sins.
38
“And at this time there is no prince, or prophet, or leader, no burnt offering, or sacrifice, or oblation, or incense, no place to make an offering before Thee or to find mercy.
39
“Yet with a contrite heart and a humble spirit may we be accepted,
40
as though it were with burnt offerings of rams and bulls, and with tens of thousands of fat lambs; such may our sacrifice be in Thy sight this day, and may we wholly follow Thee, for there will be no shame for those who trust in Thee.
41
“And now with all our heart we follow Thee, we fear Thee and seek Thy face.
42
“Do not put us to shame, but deal with us in Thy forbearance and in Thy abundant mercy.
43
“Deliver us in accordance with Thy marvelous works, and give glory to Thy name, O Lord!
44
“Let all who do harm to Thy servants be put to shame; let them be disgraced and deprived of all power and dominion, and let their strength be broken.
45
“Let them know that Thou art the Lord, the only God, glorious over the whole world.”
46
Now the king’s servants who threw them in did not cease feeding the furnace fires with naptha, pitch, tow, and brush.
47
And the flame streamed out above the furnace forty-nine cubits,
48
and it broke through and burned those of the Chaldeans whom it caught about in the furnace.
49
But the angel of the Lord came down into the furnace to be with Azariah and his companions, and drove the fiery flame out of the furnace,
50
and made the midst of the furnace like a moist whistling wind, so that the fire did not touch them at all or hurt or trouble them.
51
Then the three, as with one mouth, praised and glorified and blessed God in the furnace, saying:
52
“Blessed art Thou, O Lord, God of our fathers, and to be praised and highly exalted for ever; “And blessed is Thy glorious, holy name, and to be highly praised and highly exalted for ever;
53
“Blessed art Thou in the temple of Thy holy glory, and to be extolled and highly glorified for ever.
54
“Blessed art Thou, who sittest upon cherubim and lookest upon the deeps, and to be praised and highly exalted for ever.
55
“Blessed art Thou upon the throne of Thy kingdom, and to be extolled and highly exalted for ever.
56
“Blessed art Thou in the firmament of heaven, and to be sung and glorified for ever.”
57
Bless the Lord, all works of the Lord.
58
Bless the Lord, you heavens,
59
Bless the Lord, you angels of the Lord.
60
Bless the Lord, all waters above the heaven.
61
Bless the Lord, all powers.
62
Bless the Lord, sun and moon.
63
Bless the Lord, stars of heaven.
64
Bless the Lord, all rain and dew.
65
Bless the Lord, all winds.
66
Bless the Lord, fire and heat.
67
Bless the Lord, winter cold and summer heat.
68
Bless the Lord, dews and snows.
69
Bless the Lord, nights and days.
70
Bless the Lord, light and darkness.
71
Bless the Lord, ice and cold.
72
Bless the Lord, frosts and snows.
73
Bless the Lord, lightnings and clouds.
74
Let the earth bless the Lord.
75
Bless the Lord, mountains and hills.
76
Bless the Lord, all things that grow on the earth.
77
Bless the Lord, you springs.
78
Bless the Lord, seas and rivers.
79
Bless the Lord, you whales and all creatures that move in the waters.
80
Bless the Lord, all birds of the air.
81
Bless the Lord, all beasts and cattle.
82
Bless the Lord, you sons of men.
83
Bless the Lord, O Israel.
84
Bless the Lord, you priests of the Lord.
85
Bless the Lord, you servants of the Lord.
86
Bless the Lord, spirits and souls of the righteous.
87
Bless the Lord, you are holy and humble in heart.
88
Bless the Lord, Ananiah, Azariah, and Mishael.

readings.title: Romans 6:3-11  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>3</dt><dd>Or do you not know that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into His death?</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Therefore we were buried with Him through baptism into death, that just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death, certainly we also shall be in the likeness of His resurrection,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves of sin.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For he who has died has been freed from sin.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with Him,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no longer has dominion over Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For the death that He died, He died to sin once for all; but the life that He lives, He lives to God.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Likewise you also, reckon yourselves to be dead indeed to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 28:1-20  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now after the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>His countenance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus who was crucified.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He is not here; for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and indeed He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” So they came and held Him by the feet and worshiped Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all the things that had happened.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>When they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>saying, “Tell them, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we slept.’</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And if this comes to the governor’s ears, we will appease him and make you secure.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age. Amen.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 1:1-8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The former account I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>until the day in which He was taken up, after He through the Holy Spirit had given commandments to the apostles whom He had chosen,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>to whom He also presented Himself alive after His suffering by many infallible proofs, being seen by them during forty days and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And being assembled together with them, He commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the Promise of the Father, “which,” He said, “you have heard from Me;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>for John truly baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore, when they had come together, they asked Him, saying, “Lord, will You at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And He said to them, “It is not for you to know times or seasons which the Father has put in His own authority.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be witnesses to Me in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 1:1-17  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>He was in the beginning with God.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all through him might believe.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>That was the true Light which gives light to every man coming into the world. </dd><dt>10</dt><dd>He was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name:</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>John bore witness of Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And of His fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:19-25  (Vespers Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>So Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now Thomas, called the Twin, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord.” So he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 28:1-20  (Cross Procession 1st Reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now after the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>His countenance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus who was crucified.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He is not here; for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and indeed He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” So they came and held Him by the feet and worshiped Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all the things that had happened.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>When they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>saying, “Tell them, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we slept.’</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And if this comes to the governor’s ears, we will appease him and make you secure.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age. Amen.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 16:1-8  (Cross Procession 2nd Reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And they said among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But when they looked up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away – for it was very large.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And entering the tomb, they saw a young man clothed in a long white robe sitting on the right side; and they were alarmed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But go, tell His disciples – and Peter – that He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him, as He said to you.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So they went out quickly and fled from the tomb, for they trembled and were amazed. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:1-12  (Cross Procession 3rd Reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain other women with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then they went in and did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that behold, two men stood by them in shining garments.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the earth, they said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.’”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And they remembered His words.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then they returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them, who told these things to the apostles.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And their words seemed to them like idle tales, and they did not believe them.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:1-10  (Cross Procession 4th Reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and were going to the tomb.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:36-53  (Cross Procession 5th Reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>36</dt><dd>Now as they said these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them, and said to them, “Peace to you.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>But they were terrified and frightened, and supposed they had seen a spirit.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet. </dd><dt>41</dt><dd>But while they still did not believe for joy, and marveled, He said to them, “Have you any food here?”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>So they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb. </dd><dt>43</dt><dd>And He took it and ate in their presence.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms concerning Me.”</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>And He opened their understanding, that they might comprehend the Scriptures.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>And you are witnesses of these things.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Behold, I send the Promise of My Father upon you; but tarry in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high.”</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, while He blessed them, that He was parted from them and carried up into heaven.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>And they worshiped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 1:12-17 21-26  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And when they had entered, they went up into the upper room where they were staying: Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot; and Judas the son of James.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (altogether the number of names was about a hundred and twenty), and said,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>“Men and brethren, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus;</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>for he was numbered with us and obtained a part in this ministry.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>beginning from the baptism of John to that day when He was taken up from us, one of these must become a witness with us of His resurrection.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And they proposed two: Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And they prayed and said, “You, O Lord, who know the hearts of all, show which of these two You have chosen</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And they cast their lots, and the lot fell on Matthias. And he was numbered with the eleven apostles.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 1:18-28  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He said: “I am ‘The voice of one crying in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the LORD,’ as the prophet Isaiah said.”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And they asked him, saying, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>These things were done in Bethabara beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 2:14-21  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>But Peter, standing up with the eleven, raised his voice and said to them, “Men of Judea and all who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and heed my words.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>‘And it shall come to pass in the last days, says God, that I will pour out of My Spirit on all flesh; your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your young men shall see visions, your old men shall dream dreams.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And on My menservants and on My maidservants I will pour out My Spirit in those days; and they shall prophesy.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>I will show wonders in heaven above and signs in the earth beneath: blood and fire and vapor of smoke.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the coming of the great and awesome day of the LORD.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And it shall come to pass that whoever calls on the Name of the LORD shall be saved.’ </dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:12-35  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Now behold, two of them were traveling that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was seven miles from Jerusalem.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And they talked together of all these things which had happened.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So it was, while they conversed and reasoned, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But their eyes were restrained, so that they did not know Him.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What kind of conversation is this that you have with one another as you walk and are sad?” </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You the only stranger in Jerusalem, and have You not known the things which happened there in these days?”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What things?” So they said to Him, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a Prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death, and crucified Him.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Yes, and certain women of our company, who arrived at the tomb early, astonished us.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>When they did not find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said He was alive.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but Him they did not see.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And beginning at Moses and all the Prophets, He expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then they drew near to the village where they were going, and He indicated that He would have gone farther.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But they constrained Him, saying, “Abide with us, for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.” And He went in to stay with them.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, as He sat at the table with them, that He took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And they said to one another, “Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>So they rose up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And they told about the things that had happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 2:22-36  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a Man attested by God to you by miracles, wonders, and signs which God did through Him in your midst, as you yourselves also know – </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Him, being delivered by the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by lawless hands, have crucified, and put to death;</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>whom God raised up, having loosed the pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>For David says concerning Him: ‘I foresaw the LORD always before my face, for He is at my right hand, that I may not be shaken.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Therefore my heart rejoiced, and my tongue was glad; moreover my flesh also will rest in hope.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>For You will not leave my soul in Hades, nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>You have made known to me the ways of life; You will make me full of joy in Your presence.’ </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Men and brethren, let me speak freely to you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne, </dd><dt>31</dt><dd>he, foreseeing this, spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not left in Hades, nor did His flesh see corruption.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>This Jesus God has raised up, of which we are all witnesses.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He poured out this which you now see and hear.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>For David did not ascend into the heavens, but he says himself: ‘The LORD said to my Lord, sit at My right hand,</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>till I make Your enemies Your footstool.’”  </dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 1:35-51  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>35</dt><dd>Again, the next day, John stood with two of his disciples.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>And looking at Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Then Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, “What do you seek?” They said to Him, “Rabbi,” (which is to say, when translated, Teacher) “where are You staying?”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>He said to them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (now it was about the tenth hour).</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated, the Christ).</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And he brought him to Jesus. Now when Jesus looked at him, He said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is translated, A Stone).</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, and also the prophets, wrote – Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Nathanael answered and said to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>And He said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 2:38-43  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Then Peter said to them, “Repent, and let every one of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins; and you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>For the promise is to you and to your children, and to all who are afar off, as many as the Lord our God will call.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>And with many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>Then those who gladly received his word were baptized; and that day about three thousand souls were added to them.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Then fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 3:1-15  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>There was a man of the Pharisees named Nikodemos, a ruler of the Jews.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Nikodemos said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Jesus answered, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but cannot tell where it comes from and where it goes. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Nikodemos answered and said to Him, “How can these things be?”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and do not know these things?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, We speak what We know and testify what We have seen, and you do not receive Our witness.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>No one has ascended to heaven but He who came down from heaven, that is, the Son of Man who is in heaven. </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Philippians 2:5-11  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>who, being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>but made Himself of no reputation, taking the form of a bondservant, and coming in the likeness of men.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to the point of death, even the death of the cross.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him the name which is above every name,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 3:1-8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now Peter and John went up together to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms from those who entered the temple;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>who, seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked for alms.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And fixing his eyes on him, with John, Peter said, “Look at us.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>So he gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And he took him by the right hand and lifted him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So he, leaping up, stood and walked and entered the temple with them – walking, leaping, and praising God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 2:12-22  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>After this He went down to Capernaum, He, His mother, His brothers, and His disciples; and they did not stay there many days.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And He found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers doing business.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My Father’s house a house of merchandise!”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house has eaten Me up.” </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>So the Jews answered and said to Him, “What sign do You show to us, since You do these things?”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But He was speaking of the temple of His body.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Therefore, when He had risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 3:11-16  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Now as the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch which is called Solomon’s, greatly amazed.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So when Peter saw it, he responded to the people: “Men of Israel, why do you marvel at this? Or why look so intently at us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified His Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let Him go.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But you denied the Holy One and the Just, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And His name, through faith in His name, has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which comes through Him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 3:22-33  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He remained with them and baptized.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>For John had not yet been thrown into prison.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then there arose a dispute between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about purification.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified – behold, He is baptizing, and all are coming to Him!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before Him.’</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>He must increase, but I must decrease.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 43:9-14  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled. Who among them can declare this, and show us former things? Let them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear and say, “It is truth.”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>“You are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “And My servant whom I have chosen, that you may know and believe Me, and understand that I am He. Before Me there was no God formed, nor shall there be after Me.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I, even I, am the Lord, and besides Me there is no savior. </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>I have declared and saved, I have proclaimed, and there was no foreign god among you; therefore you are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “that I am God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Indeed before the day was, I am He; and there is no one who can deliver out of My hand; I work, and who will reverse it?”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon, and bring them all down as fugitives – the Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 28:16-20  (1st  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age. Amen.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 12:1-11  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now about that time Herod the king stretched out his hand to harass some from the church.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then he killed James the brother of John with the sword.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And because he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to seize Peter also. Now it was during the Days of Unleavened Bread.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So when he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of soldiers to keep him, intending to bring him before the people after Passover.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Peter was therefore kept in prison, but constant prayer was offered to God for him by the church.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And when Herod was about to bring him out, that night Peter was sleeping, bound with two chains between two soldiers; and the guards before the door were keeping the prison.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Now behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the prison; and he struck Peter on the side and raised him up, saying, “Arise quickly!” And his chains fell off his hands.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and tie on your sandals”; and so he did. And he said to him, “Put on your garment and follow me.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>So he went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>When they were past the first and the second guard posts, they came to the iron gate that leads to the city, which opened to them of its own accord; and they went out and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent His angel, and has delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the Jewish people.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 15:17-16:2  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>These things I command you, that you love one another.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He who hates Me hates My Father also.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’ </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 5:12-20  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>And through the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. And they were all with one accord in Solomon’s Porch.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Yet none of the rest dared join them, but the people esteemed them highly.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And believers were increasingly added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>so that they brought the sick out into the streets and laid them on beds and couches, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might fall on some of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Also a multitude gathered from the surrounding cities to Jerusalem, bringing sick people and those who were tormented by unclean spirits, and they were all healed.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with indignation,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>and laid their hands on the apostles and put them in the common prison.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>But at night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and brought them out, and said,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>“Go, stand in the temple and speak to the people all the words of this life.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:19-31  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>So Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now Thomas, called the Twin, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord.” So he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And after eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, “Peace to you!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then He said to Thomas, “Reach your finger here, and look at My hands; and reach your hand here, and put it into My side. Do not be unbelieving, but believing.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>And Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book;</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 3:19-26  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Repent therefore and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and that He may send Jesus Christ, who was preached to you before, </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God has spoken by the mouth of all His holy prophets since the world began.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>For Moses truly said to the fathers, ‘The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brethren. Him you shall hear in all things, whatever He says to you.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And it shall be that every soul who will not hear that Prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.’ </dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Yes, and all the prophets, from Samuel and those who follow, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>You are sons of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.’ </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>To you first, God, having raised up His Servant Jesus, sent Him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your iniquities.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 2:1-11  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Now both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And when they ran out of wine, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does your concern have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of purification of the Jews, containing twenty or thirty gallons apiece.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Draw some out now, and take it to the master of the feast.” And they took it.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>When the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And he said to him, “Every man at the beginning sets out the good wine, and when the guests have well drunk, then the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>This beginning of signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: James 1:1-12  (Vespers 1st  reading)
