And that day was the Sabbath.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He answered them, “He who made me well said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But the one who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a multitude being in that place.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 3:21-4:6  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, we have confidence toward God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do those things that are pleasing in His sight.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as He gave us commandment.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now he who keeps His commandments abides in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God. And this is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you have heard was coming, and is now already in the world.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>They are of the world. Therefore they speak as of the world, and the world hears them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:11-16  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Beloved, if God so loved us, we also ought to love one another.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abides in us, and His love has been perfected in us.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>By this we know that we abide in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as Savior of the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And we have known and believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:20-5:5  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>If someone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And this commandment we have from Him: that he who loves God must love his brother also.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who begot also loves him who is begotten of Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep His commandments.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world – our faith.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:15-25  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 1:1-7  (Epistle St John)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, concerning the Word of life – </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>the life was manifested, and we have seen, and bear witness, and declare to you that eternal life which was with the Father and was manifested to us – </dd><dt>3</dt><dd>that which we have seen and heard we declare to you, that you also may have fellowship with us; and truly our fellowship is with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And these things we write to you that your joy may be full.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>This is the message which we have heard from Him and declare to you, that God is light and in Him is no darkness at all.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>If we say that we have fellowship with Him, and walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But if we walk in the light as He is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 19:25-27 21:24-25  (Gospel St John)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 10:1-16  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, who gave alms generously to the people, and prayed to God always.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming in and saying to him, “Cornelius!”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And when he observed him, he was afraid, and said, “What is it, lord?” So he said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have come up for a memorial before God.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now send men to Joppa, and send for Simon whose surname is Peter.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He is lodging with Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. He will tell you what you must do.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And when the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from among those who waited on him continually.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So when he had explained all these things to them, he sent them to Joppa.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>The next day, as they went on their journey and drew near the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray, about the sixth hour.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then he became very hungry and wanted to eat; but while they made ready, he fell into a trance</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and saw heaven opened and an object like a great sheet bound at the four corners, descending to him and let down to the earth.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But Peter said, “Not so, Lord! For I have never eaten anything common or unclean.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And a voice spoke to him again the second time, “What God has cleansed you must not call common.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>This was done three times. And the object was taken up into heaven again.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 6:56-69  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>56</dt><dd>He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him.</dd><dt>57</dt><dd>As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who feeds on Me will live because of Me.</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>This is the bread which came down from heaven – not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever.”</dd><dt>59</dt><dd>These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.</dd><dt>60</dt><dd>Therefore many of His disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying; who can understand it?”</dd><dt>61</dt><dd>When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples complained about this, He said to them, “Does this offend you?</dd><dt>62</dt><dd>What then if you should see the Son of Man ascend where He was before?</dd><dt>63</dt><dd>It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and they are life.</dd><dt>64</dt><dd>But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him.</dd><dt>65</dt><dd>And He said, “Therefore I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted to him by My Father.”</dd><dt>66</dt><dd>From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no more.</dd><dt>67</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”</dd><dt>68</dt><dd>But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.</dd><dt>69</dt><dd>Also we have come to believe and know that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.” </dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 10:21-33  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Then Peter went down to the men who had been sent to him from Cornelius, and said, “Yes, I am he whom you seek. For what reason have you come?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And they said, “Cornelius the centurion, a just man, one who fears God and has a good reputation among all the nation of the Jews, was divinely instructed by a holy angel to summon you to his house, and to hear words from you.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then he invited them in and lodged them. On the next day Peter went away with them, and some brethren from Joppa accompanied him.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And the following day they entered Caesarea. Now Cornelius was waiting for them, and had called together his relatives and close friends.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>As Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up; I myself am also a man.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And as he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then he said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jewish man to keep company with or go to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I should not call any man common or unclean.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Therefore I came without objection as soon as I was sent for. I ask, then, for what reason have you sent for me?”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>So Cornelius said, “Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your alms are remembered in the sight of God.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Send therefore to Joppa and call Simon here, whose surname is Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.’</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>So I sent to you immediately, and you have done well to come. Now therefore, we are all present before God, to hear all the things commanded you by God.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 7:1-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; for He did not want to walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You are doing.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For no one does anything in secret while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For even His brothers did not believe in Him.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it that its works are evil.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>You go up to this feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, for My time has not yet fully come.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>When He had said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>But when His brothers had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And there was much complaining among the people concerning Him. Some said, “He is good”; others said, “No, on the contrary, He deceives the people.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 3:21-4:6  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, we have confidence toward God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do those things that are pleasing in His sight.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as He gave us commandment.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now he who keeps His commandments abides in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God. And this is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you have heard was coming, and is now already in the world.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>They are of the world. Therefore they speak as of the world, and the world hears them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:11-16  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Beloved, if God so loved us, we also ought to love one another.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abides in us, and His love has been perfected in us.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>By this we know that we abide in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as Savior of the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And we have known and believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:20-5:5  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>If someone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And this commandment we have from Him: that he who loves God must love his brother also.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who begot also loves him who is begotten of Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep His commandments.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world – our faith.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:15-25  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:9-16  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men condemned to death; for we have been made a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to men.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are distinguished, but we are dishonored!</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and we are poorly clothed, and beaten, and homeless.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And we labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we endure;</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>being defamed, we entreat. We have been made as the filth of the world, the offscouring of all things until now.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved children I warn you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For though you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore I urge you, imitate me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:54-58  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>54</dt><dd>When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?</dd><dt>55</dt><dd>Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?”</dd><dt>57</dt><dd>So they were offended at Him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country and in his own house.”</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>Now He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 14:6-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>they became aware of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding region.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And they were preaching the gospel there.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And in Lystra a certain man without strength in his feet was sitting, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who had never walked.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>This man heard Paul speaking. Paul, observing him intently and seeing that he had faith to be healed,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>said with a loud voice, “Stand up straight on your feet!” And he leaped and walked.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now when the people saw what Paul had done, they raised their voices, saying in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then the priest of Zeus, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, intending to sacrifice with the multitudes.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their clothes and ran in among the multitude, crying out</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men with the same nature as you, and preach to you that you should turn from these useless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all things that are in them,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>who in bygone generations allowed all nations to walk in their own ways.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Nevertheless He did not leave Himself without witness, in that He did good, gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And with these sayings they could scarcely restrain the multitudes from sacrificing to them.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 7:14-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And the Jews marveled, saying, “How does this Man know letters, having never studied?”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Jesus answered them and said, “My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>If anyone wills to do His will, he shall know concerning the doctrine, whether it is from God or whether I speak on My own authority.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Did not Moses give you the law, yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Moses therefore gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath, so that the law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But look! He speaks boldly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is truly the Christ?</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then Jesus cried out, as He taught in the temple, saying, “You both know Me, and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Therefore they sought to take Him; but no one laid a hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 2:11-18  (Epistle Blessing of Waters)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>For both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one, for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brethren,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>saying: “I will declare Your name to My brethren; in the midst of the assembly I will sing praise to You.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And again: “I will put My trust in Him.” And again: “Here am I and the children whom God has given Me.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Inasmuch then as the children have partaken of flesh and blood, He Himself likewise shared in the same, that through death He might destroy him who had the power of death, that is, the devil,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>and release those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For indeed He does not give aid to angels, but He does give aid to the seed of Abraham.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Therefore, in all things He had to be made like His brethren, that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For in that He Himself has suffered, being tempted, He is able to aid those who are tempted.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 5:1-4  (Gospel Blessing of Waters)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 2 - Proverbs 10 3 8  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The memory of the righteous is with praise and the blessing of the Lord is upon his head. Blessed is the man who has found wisdom and the mortal who has understanding. For it is better to purchase her than treasuries of gold and silver. She is more precious than precious stones and all that is precious is unworthy of her. For length of days and years of life are in her right hand; and in her left hand are riches and glory. Out of her mouth proceeds righteousness and she bears law and mercy upon her tongue.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Hear me, O child, for I will speak noble things. Blessed is the man who keeps my ways, for my ways are the ways of life, and in them is prepared favor from the Lord. Therefore, I pray thee, and utter my voice to the sons of men: For I, wisdom, have dwelt with counsel and knowledge and I have called upon understanding. Counsel and safety are mine, understanding and strength are mine. I love those who love me and those seeking me shall find grace.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Understand craftiness, O you who are simple, and imbibe knowledge, you who are untaught. Hear me again, for I will speak noble things: I will open my mouth and from my lips shall come what is right. For my throat shall meditate truth; false lips are an abomination before me. All the words of my mouth are righteous; there is nothing in them that is twisted or perverse. They are all straight to him who understands and right to those who find knowledge.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I shall instruct you in truth, so that your hope will be in the Lord and you shall be filled with the Spirit.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 10:31-11:12  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut out.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Dishonest scales are an abomination to the Lord, but a just weight is His delight.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>When pride comes, then comes shame; but with the humble is wisdom.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>The integrity of the upright will guide them, but the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, but the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish, and the hope of the unjust perishes.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>The righteous is delivered from trouble, and it comes to the wicked instead.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices; and when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, but a man of understanding holds his peace.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:1-9  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 7:26-8:2  (Epistle Saints)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>26</dt><dd>For such a High Priest was fitting for us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and has become higher than the heavens;</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>who does not need daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for his own sins and then for the people’s, for this He did once for all when He offered up Himself.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For the law appoints as high priests men who have weakness, but the word of the oath, which came after the law, appoints the Son who has been perfected forever.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now this is the main point of the things we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord erected, and not man.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 5:14-19  (Gospel Saints)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Nor do they light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Do not think that I came to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I did not come to destroy but to fulfill.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For assuredly, I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle will by no means pass from the law till all is fulfilled.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Whoever therefore breaks one of the least of these commandments, and teaches men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does and teaches them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 10:34-43  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>34</dt><dd>Then Peter opened his mouth and said: “In truth I perceive that God shows no partiality.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>But in every nation whoever fears Him and works righteousness is accepted by Him.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>The word which God sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ – He is Lord of all – </dd><dt>37</dt><dd>that word you know, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, and began from Galilee after the baptism which John preached:</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And we are witnesses of all things which He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom they killed by hanging on a tree.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Him God raised up on the third day, and showed Him openly,</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>not to all the people, but to witnesses chosen before by God, even to us who ate and drank with Him after He arose from the dead.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And He commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be Judge of the living and the dead.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>To Him all the prophets witness that, through His name, whoever believes in Him will receive remission of sins.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:12-20  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows Me shall not walk in darkness, but have the light of life.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself; Your witness is not true.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I bear witness of Myself, My witness is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from and where I am going.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>You judge according to the flesh; I judge no one.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And yet if I do judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent Me.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness of Me.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, for His hour had not yet come.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 10:44-11:10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>44</dt><dd>While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who heard the word.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>And those of the circumcision who believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the Gentiles also.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>For they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God. Then Peter answered,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>“Can anyone forbid water, that these should not be baptized who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have?”</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked him to stay a few days.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now the apostles and brethren who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those of the circumcision contended with him,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>saying, “You went in to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But Peter explained it to them in order from the beginning, saying:</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>“I was in the city of Joppa praying; and in a trance I saw a vision, an object descending like a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came to me.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>When I observed it intently and considered, I saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter; kill and eat.’</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But I said, ‘Not so, Lord! For nothing common or unclean has at any time entered my mouth.’</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But the voice answered me again from heaven, ‘What God has cleansed you must not call common.’</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Now this was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:21-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sin. Where I go you cannot come.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself, because He says, ‘Where I go you cannot come’?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And He said to them, “You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then they said to Him, “Who are You?” And Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father taught Me, I speak these things.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 12:1-11  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now about that time Herod the king stretched out his hand to harass some from the church.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then he killed James the brother of John with the sword.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And because he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to seize Peter also. Now it was during the Days of Unleavened Bread.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So when he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of soldiers to keep him, intending to bring him before the people after Passover.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Peter was therefore kept in prison, but constant prayer was offered to God for him by the church.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And when Herod was about to bring him out, that night Peter was sleeping, bound with two chains between two soldiers; and the guards before the door were keeping the prison.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Now behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the prison; and he struck Peter on the side and raised him up, saying, “Arise quickly!” And his chains fell off his hands.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and tie on your sandals”; and so he did. And he said to him, “Put on your garment and follow me.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>So he went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>When they were past the first and the second guard posts, they came to the iron gate that leads to the city, which opened to them of its own accord; and they went out and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent His angel, and has delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the Jewish people.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:31-42  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him, “If you abide in My word, you are My disciples indeed.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How can You say, ‘You will be made free’?”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Jesus answered them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, whoever commits sin is a slave of sin.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And a slave does not abide in the house forever, but a son abides forever.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Therefore if the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>I know that you are Abraham’s descendants, but you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>I speak what I have seen with My Father, and you do what you have seen with your father.”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>You do the deeds of your father.” Then they said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father – God.”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:1-10  (7th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and were going to the tomb.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 11:19-26 29-30  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Now those who were scattered after the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to no one but the Jews only.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But some of them were men from Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then news of these things came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>When he came and had seen the grace of God, he was glad, and encouraged them all that with purpose of heart they should continue with the Lord.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>For he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were added to the Lord.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then Barnabas departed for Tarsus to seek Saul.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. So it was that for a whole year they assembled with the church and taught a great many people. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Then the disciples, each according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brethren dwelling in Judea.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>This they also did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 4:5-42  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>The woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his sons and his livestock?”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to her, “Whoever drinks of this water will thirst again,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>but whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him will never thirst. But the water that I shall give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up into everlasting life.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have well said, ‘I have no husband,’</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; in that you spoke truly.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And at this point His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with a woman; yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>The woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then they went out of the city and came to Him.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>In the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>But He said to them, “I have food to eat of which you do not know.”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Therefore the disciples said to one another, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Do you not say, ‘There are still four months and then comes the harvest’? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, for they are already white for harvest!</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>And he who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit for eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>For in this the saying is true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have entered into their labors.”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever did.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And many more believed because of His own word.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Then they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we ourselves have heard Him and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 12:12-17  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>So, when he had considered this, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a girl named Rhoda came to answer.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>When she recognized Peter’s voice, because of her gladness she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter stood before the gate.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But they said to her, “You are beside yourself!” Yet she kept insisting that it was so. So they said, “It is his angel.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Now Peter continued knocking; and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But motioning to them with his hand to keep silent, he declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Go, tell these things to James and to the brethren.” And he departed and went to another place.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:42-51  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>42</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Why do you not understand My speech? Because you are not able to listen to My word.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of lies.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>But because I tell the truth, you do not believe Me.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me?</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>He who is of God hears God’s words; therefore you do not hear, because you are not of God.”</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>Then the Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>And I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges.</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he shall never see death.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 12:25-13:12  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their ministry, and they also took with them John whose surname was Mark.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now in the church that was at Antioch there were certain prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>As they ministered to the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, “Now separate to Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then, having fasted and prayed, and laid hands on them, they sent them away.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And when they arrived in Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. They also had John as their assistant.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now when they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But Elymas the sorcerer (for so his name is translated) withstood them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then Saul, who also is called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>and said, “O full of all deceit and all fraud, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease perverting the straight ways of the Lord?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And now, indeed, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you shall be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.” And immediately a dark mist fell on him, and he went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had been done, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:51-59  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>51</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he shall never see death.”</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word he shall never taste death.’</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?”</dd><dt>54</dt><dd>Jesus answered, “If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father who honors Me, of whom you say that He is your God.</dd><dt>55</dt><dd>Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I say, ‘I do not know Him,’ I shall be a liar like you; but I do know Him and keep His word.</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad.”</dd><dt>57</dt><dd>Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I AM.”</dd><dt>59</dt><dd>Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 13:13-24  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>Now when Paul and his party set sail from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia; and John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And after the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, “Men and brethren, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said, “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen:</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He brought them out of it.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Now for a time of about forty years He put up with their ways in the wilderness.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And when He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He distributed their land to them by allotment.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>After that He gave them judges for about four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And afterward they asked for a king; so God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And when He had removed him, He raised up for them David as king, to whom also He gave testimony and said, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My own heart, who will do all My will.’ </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>From this man’s seed, according to the promise, God raised up for Israel a Savior – Jesus – </dd><dt>24</dt><dd>after John had first preached, before His coming, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 6:5-14  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>Then Jesus lifted up His eyes, and seeing a great multitude coming toward Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But this He said to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may have a little.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two small fish, but what are they among so many?</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those sitting down; and likewise of the fish, as much as they wanted.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So when they were filled, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the fragments that remain, so that nothing is lost.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Then those men, when they had seen the sign that Jesus did, said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 14:20-27  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>However, when the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. And the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And when they had preached the gospel to that city and made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and saying, “We must through many tribulations enter the kingdom of God.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>So when they had appointed elders in every church, and prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And after they had passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>From there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Now when they had come and gathered the church together, they reported all that God had done with them, and that He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 9:39-10:9  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>39</dt><dd>And Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may be made blind.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we blind also?”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 15:5-34  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now the apostles and elders came together to consider this matter.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And when there had been much dispute, Peter rose up and said to them: “Men and brethren, you know that a good while ago God chose among us, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So God, who knows the heart, acknowledged them by giving them the Holy Spirit, just as He did to us,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and made no distinction between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Now therefore, why do you test God by putting a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved in the same manner as they.”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then all the multitude kept silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul declaring how many miracles and wonders God had worked through them among the Gentiles.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And after they had become silent, James answered, saying, “Men and brethren, listen to me:</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Simon has declared how God at the first visited the Gentiles to take out of them a people for His name.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And with this the words of the prophets agree, just as it is written:</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>‘After this I will return and will rebuild the tabernacle of David, which has fallen down; I will rebuild its ruins, and I will set it up;</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>so that the rest of mankind may seek the LORD, even all the Gentiles who are called by My name, says the LORD who does all these things.’ </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Known to God from eternity are all His works. </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Therefore I judge that we should not trouble those from among the Gentiles who are turning to God,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>but that we write to them to abstain from things polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from things strangled, and from blood.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For Moses has had throughout many generations those who preach him in every city, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then it pleased the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely, Judas who was also named Barsabas, and Silas, leading men among the brethren.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>They wrote this letter by them: ”The apostles, the elders, and the brethren, to the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: Greetings.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Since we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, ‘You must be circumcised and keep the law’ – to whom we gave no such commandment – </dd><dt>25</dt><dd>it seemed good to us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, who will also report the same things by word of mouth.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things:</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>that you abstain from things offered to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. Farewell.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>So when they were sent off, they came to Antioch; and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>When they had read it, they rejoiced over its encouragement.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Now Judas and Silas, themselves being prophets also, exhorted and strengthened the brethren with many words.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>And after they had stayed there for a time, they were sent back with greetings from the brethren to the apostles. </dd><dt>34</dt><dd>However, it seemed good to Silas to remain there. </dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:17-28  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it again.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This command I have received from My Father.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And many of them said, “He has a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to Him?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem, and it was winter.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him, “How long do You keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in My Father’s name, they bear witness of Me.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you. </dd><dt>27</dt><dd>My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>And I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; neither shall anyone snatch them out of My hand.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Acts 15:35-41  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>35</dt><dd>Paul and Barnabas also remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Then after some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us now go back and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they are doing.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Now Barnabas was determined to take with them John called Mark.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>But Paul insisted that they should not take with them the one who had departed from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone with them to the work.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Then the contention became so sharp that they parted from one another. And so Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus;</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>but Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended by the brethren to the grace of God.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And he went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:27-38  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>And I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; neither shall anyone snatch them out of My hand.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father’s hand.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>I and My Father are one.”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Jesus answered them, “Many good works I have shown you from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>The Jews answered Him, saying, “For a good work we do not stone You, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, make Yourself God.”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods”’’? </dd><dt>35</dt><dd>If He called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture cannot be broken),</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>do you say of Him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me;</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>but if I do, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 3[1] Kings 8:22-23 27-30  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven; </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>and he said: “Lord God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You, who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts. </dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built! </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O Lord my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today: </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place. </dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 61:10-62:5  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation, He has covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decks himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For as the earth brings forth its bud, as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth, so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>For Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness goes forth as brightness, and her salvation as a lamp that burns. </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>The Gentiles shall see your righteousness, and all kings your glory. You shall be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord will name.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>You shall also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of your God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You shall no longer be termed Forsaken, nor shall your land any more be termed Desolate; but you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for the Lord delights in you, and your land shall be married.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For as a young man marries a virgin, so shall your sons marry you; and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so shall your God rejoice over you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 60:1-16  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Arise, shine; for your light has come! And the glory of the Lord is risen upon you. </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and deep darkness the people; but the Lord will arise over you, and His glory will be seen upon you.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>The Gentiles shall come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your rising.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“Lift up your eyes all around, and see: They all gather together, they come to you; your sons shall come from afar, and your daughters shall be nursed at your side.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then you shall see and become radiant, and your heart shall swell with joy; because the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, the wealth of the Gentiles shall come to you.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The multitude of camels shall cover your land, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all those from Sheba shall come; they shall bring gold and incense, and they shall proclaim the praises of the Lord. </dd><dt>7</dt><dd>All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; they shall ascend with acceptance on My altar, and I will glorify the house of My glory.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>“Who are these who fly like a cloud, and like doves to their roosts?</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Surely the coastlands shall wait for Me; and the ships of Tarshish will come first, to bring your sons from afar, their silver and their gold with them, to the name of the Lord your God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because He has glorified you.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>“The sons of foreigners shall build up your walls, and their kings shall minister to you; for in My wrath I struck you, but in My favor I have had mercy on you.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Therefore your gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day or night, that men may bring to you the wealth of the Gentiles, and their kings in procession.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the nation and kingdom which will not serve you shall perish, and those nations shall be utterly ruined.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>“The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the cypress, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of My sanctuary; and I will make the place of My feet glorious.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Also the sons of those who afflicted you shall come bowing to you, and all those who despised you shall fall prostrate at the soles of your feet; and they shall call you the City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, so that no one went through you, I will make you an eternal excellence, a joy of many generations.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles, and milk the breast of kings; you shall know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:11-18  (8th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?
