For I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, if first I may enjoy your company for a while.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But now I am going to Jerusalem to minister to the saints.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>For it pleased those from Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are in Jerusalem.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>It pleased them indeed, and they are their debtors. For if the Gentiles have been partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister to them in material things.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Therefore, when I have performed this and have sealed to them this fruit, I shall go by way of you to Spain.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But I know that when I come to you, I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 12:46-13:3  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>46</dt><dd>While He was still talking to the multitudes, behold, His mother and brothers stood outside, seeking to speak with Him.</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Then one said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, seeking to speak with You.”</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>But He answered and said to the one who told Him, “Who is My mother and who are My brothers?”</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>And He stretched out His hand toward His disciples and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>For whoever does the will of My Father in heaven is My brother and sister and mother.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>On the same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And great multitudes were gathered together to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then He spoke many things to them in parables, saying: “Behold, a sower went out to sow.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 16:1-16  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>I commend to you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church in Cenchrea,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>that you may receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints, and assist her in whatever business she has need of you; for indeed she has been a helper of many and of myself also.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>who risked their own necks for my life, to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Greet Mary, who labored much for us.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Greet Andronicus and Junia, my countrymen and my fellow prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Greet Apelles, approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Greet Herodion, my countryman. Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, who have labored in the Lord. Greet the beloved Persis, who labored much in the Lord.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Greet one another with a holy kiss. The churches of Christ greet you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:4-9  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>4</dt><dd>And as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside; and the birds came and devoured them.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Some fell on stony places, where they did not have much earth; and they immediately sprang up because they had no depth of earth.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But when the sun was up they were scorched, and because they had no root they withered away.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up and choked them.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But others fell on good ground and yielded a crop: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 8:14-21  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear, but you received the Spirit of adoption by whom we cry out, “Abba, Father.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>The Spirit Himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>and if children, then heirs – heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ, if indeed we suffer with Him, that we may also be glorified together.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For the earnest expectation of the creation eagerly waits for the revealing of the sons of God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>For the creation was subjected to futility, not willingly, but because of Him who subjected it in hope;</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>because the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 9:9-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” So he arose and followed Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Now it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, that behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>When Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.” </dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:12-35  (5th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Now behold, two of them were traveling that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was seven miles from Jerusalem.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And they talked together of all these things which had happened.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So it was, while they conversed and reasoned, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But their eyes were restrained, so that they did not know Him.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What kind of conversation is this that you have with one another as you walk and are sad?” </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You the only stranger in Jerusalem, and have You not known the things which happened there in these days?”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What things?” So they said to Him, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a Prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death, and crucified Him.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Yes, and certain women of our company, who arrived at the tomb early, astonished us.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>When they did not find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said He was alive.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but Him they did not see.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And beginning at Moses and all the Prophets, He expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then they drew near to the village where they were going, and He indicated that He would have gone farther.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But they constrained Him, saying, “Abide with us, for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.” And He went in to stay with them.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, as He sat at the table with them, that He took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And they said to one another, “Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>So they rose up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And they told about the things that had happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 10:1-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Brethren, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they may be saved.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For I bear them witness that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For Moses writes about the righteousness which is of the law, “The man who does those things shall live by them.” </dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But the righteousness of faith speaks in this way, “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ (that is, to bring Christ down from above)</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>or, ‘Who will descend into the abyss?’” (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart” (that is, the word of faith which we preach):</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 8:28-9:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>When He had come to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two demon-possessed men, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass that way.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, You Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Now a good way off from them there was a herd of many swine feeding.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Go.” So when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and perished in the water.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Then those who kept them fled; and they went away into the city and told everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart from their region.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>So He got into a boat, crossed over, and came to His own city.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 5:15-6:3  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>But the righteous live for ever, and their reward is with the Lord; the Most High takes care of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore they will receive a glorious crown and a beautiful diadem from the hand of the Lord, because with his right hand he will cover them, and with his arm he will shield them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The Lord will take his zeal as his whole armor, and will arm all creation to repel his enemies;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>he will put on righteousness as a breastplate, and wear impartial justice as a helmet;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>he will take holiness as a invincible shield,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and sharpen stern wrath for a sword, and creation will join with him to fight against the madmen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Shafts of lightning will fly with true aim, and will leap to the target as from a well-drawn bow of clouds,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>and hailstones full of wrath will be hurled as from a catapult; the water of the sea will rage against them, and rivers will relentlessly overwhelm them;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>a mighty wind will rise against them, and like a tempest it will winnow them away. Lawlessness will lay waste the whole earth, and evil-doing will overturn the thrones of rulers.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Listen therefore, O kings, and understand; learn, O judges of the ends of the earth.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Give ear, you that rule over multitudes, and boast of many nations.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For your dominion was given you from the Lord, and your sovereignty from the Most High, who will search out your works and inquire into your plans.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 11:27-30  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 5:22-6:2  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 4:25-5:12  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Great multitudes followed Him – from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And seeing the multitudes, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying:</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be filled.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Blessed are you when they revile and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Rejoice and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 16:17-24  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>Now I urge you, brethren, note those who cause divisions and offenses, contrary to the doctrine which you learned, and avoid them.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For those who are such do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly, and by smooth words and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the simple.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For your obedience has become known to all. Therefore I am glad on your behalf; but I want you to be wise in what is good, and simple concerning evil.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my countrymen, greet you.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>I, Tertius, who wrote this epistle, greet you in the Lord.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Gaius, my host and the host of the whole church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, and Quartus, a brother.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:10-23  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>And the disciples came and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He answered and said to them, “Because it has been given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says: ‘Hearing you will hear and shall not understand, and seeing you will see and not perceive;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>for the hearts of this people have grown dull. Their ears are hard of hearing, and their eyes they have closed, lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears, lest they should understand with their hearts and turn, so that I should heal them.’</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But blessed are your eyes for they see, and your ears for they hear;</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>for assuredly, I say to you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Therefore hear the parable of the sower:</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>When anyone hears the word of the kingdom, and does not understand it, then the wicked one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is he who received seed by the wayside.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But he who received the seed on stony places, this is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy;</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>yet he has no root in himself, but endures only for a while. For when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Now he who received seed among the thorns is he who hears the word, and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 1:1-9  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>to the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all who in every place call on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I thank my God always concerning you for the grace of God which was given to you by Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>that you were enriched in everything by Him in all utterance and all knowledge,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>so that you come short in no gift, eagerly waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>who will also confirm you to the end, that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>God is faithful, by whom you were called into the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:24-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field;</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went his way.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the grain had sprouted and produced a crop, then the tares also appeared.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>So the servants of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?’</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants said to him, ‘Do you want us then to go and gather them up?’</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But he said, ‘No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Let both grow together until the harvest, and at the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.”’”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 2:9-3:8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>But, as it is written: “What no eye has seen, nor ear heard, nor the heart of man conceived, what God has prepared for those who love Him,”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>But God has revealed them to us through His Spirit. For the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For what man knows the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? Even so no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, that we might know the things that have been freely given to us by God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>These things we also speak, not in words which man’s wisdom teaches but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; nor can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But he who is spiritual judges all things, yet he himself is rightly judged by no one.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For “who has known the mind of the LORD that he may instruct Him?” But we have the mind of Christ.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual people but as to carnal, as to babes in Christ.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>I fed you with milk and not with solid food; for until now you were not able to receive it, and even now you are still not able;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>for you are still carnal. For where there are envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not carnal and behaving like mere men?</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For when one says, “I am of Paul,” and another, “I am of Apollos,” are you not carnal?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers through whom you believed, as the Lord gave to each one?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>I planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Now he who plants and he who waters are one, and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:31-36  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field,</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>which indeed is the least of all the seeds; but when it is grown it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Another parable He spoke to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till it was all leavened.”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>All these things Jesus spoke to the multitude in parables; and without a parable He did not speak to them,</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying: “I will open My mouth in parables; I will utter things kept secret from the foundation of the world.” </dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 3:18-23  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>Let no one deceive himself. If anyone among you seems to be wise in this age, let him become a fool that he may become wise.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, “He catches the wise in their own craftiness”;</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and again, “The LORD knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are futile.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Therefore let no one boast in men. For all things are yours:</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas, or the world or life or death, or things present or things to come – all are yours.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:36-43  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>36</dt><dd>Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>He answered and said to them: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>The field is the world, the good seeds are the sons of the kingdom, but the tares are the sons of the wicked one.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who practice lawlessness,</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:5-8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each one’s praise will come from God.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now these things, brethren, I have figuratively transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes, that you may learn in us not to think beyond what is written, that none of you may be puffed up on behalf of one against the other.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For who makes you differ from another? And what do you have that you did not receive? Now if you did indeed receive it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>You are already full! You are already rich! You have reigned as kings without us – and indeed I could wish you did reign, that we also might reign with you!</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:44-54  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>44</dt><dd>Again, the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and hid; and for joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking beautiful pearls,</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some of every kind,</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>which, when it was full, they drew to shore; and they sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but threw the bad away.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth, separate the wicked from among the just,</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>and cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “Have you understood all these things?” They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.” </dd><dt>52</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “Therefore every scribe instructed concerning the kingdom of heaven is like a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old.”</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there.</dd><dt>54</dt><dd>When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?</dd></dl>

readings.title: 3[1] Kings 8:22-23 27-30  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven; </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>and he said: “Lord God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You, who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts. </dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built! </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O Lord my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today: </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place. </dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 61:10-62:5  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation, He has covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decks himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For as the earth brings forth its bud, as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth, so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>For Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness goes forth as brightness, and her salvation as a lamp that burns. </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>The Gentiles shall see your righteousness, and all kings your glory. You shall be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord will name.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>You shall also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of your God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You shall no longer be termed Forsaken, nor shall your land any more be termed Desolate; but you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for the Lord delights in you, and your land shall be married.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For as a young man marries a virgin, so shall your sons marry you; and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so shall your God rejoice over you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 60:1-16  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Arise, shine; for your light has come! And the glory of the Lord is risen upon you. </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and deep darkness the people; but the Lord will arise over you, and His glory will be seen upon you.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>The Gentiles shall come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your rising.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“Lift up your eyes all around, and see: They all gather together, they come to you; your sons shall come from afar, and your daughters shall be nursed at your side.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then you shall see and become radiant, and your heart shall swell with joy; because the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, the wealth of the Gentiles shall come to you.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The multitude of camels shall cover your land, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all those from Sheba shall come; they shall bring gold and incense, and they shall proclaim the praises of the Lord. </dd><dt>7</dt><dd>All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; they shall ascend with acceptance on My altar, and I will glorify the house of My glory.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>“Who are these who fly like a cloud, and like doves to their roosts?</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Surely the coastlands shall wait for Me; and the ships of Tarshish will come first, to bring your sons from afar, their silver and their gold with them, to the name of the Lord your God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because He has glorified you.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>“The sons of foreigners shall build up your walls, and their kings shall minister to you; for in My wrath I struck you, but in My favor I have had mercy on you.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Therefore your gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day or night, that men may bring to you the wealth of the Gentiles, and their kings in procession.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the nation and kingdom which will not serve you shall perish, and those nations shall be utterly ruined.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>“The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the cypress, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of My sanctuary; and I will make the place of My feet glorious.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Also the sons of those who afflicted you shall come bowing to you, and all those who despised you shall fall prostrate at the soles of your feet; and they shall call you the City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, so that no one went through you, I will make you an eternal excellence, a joy of many generations.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles, and milk the breast of kings; you shall know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:9-16  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 1:11-19  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>But I make known to you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For I neither received it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came through the revelation of Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and tried to destroy it.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb and called me through His grace,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and remained with him fifteen days.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>But I saw none of the other apostles except James, the Lord’s brother.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:1-9  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 9:1-5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>I tell the truth in Christ, I am not lying, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>that I have great sorrow and continual grief in my heart.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my countrymen according to the flesh,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>who are Israelites, to whom pertain the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service of God, and the promises;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>of whom are the fathers and from whom, according to the flesh, Christ came, who is over all, the eternally blessed God. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 9:18-26  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>While He spoke these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped Him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay Your hand on her and she will live.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>So Jesus arose and followed him, and so did His disciples.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For she said to herself, “If only I may touch His garment, I shall be made well.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her He said, “Be of good cheer, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>When Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd wailing,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>He said to them, “Make room, for the girl is not dead, but sleeping.” And they ridiculed Him.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But when the crowd was put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And the report of this went out into all that land.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Genesis 14:14-20  (Vespers 1st  reading Fathers)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>Now when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his three hundred and eighteen trained servants who were born in his own house, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>He divided his forces against them by night, and he and his servants attacked them and pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So he brought back all the goods, and also brought back his brother Lot and his goods, as well as the women and the people.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King’s Valley), after his return from the defeat of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was the priest of God Most High.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And he blessed him and said: “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Possessor of heaven and earth;</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And blessed be God Most High, Who has delivered your enemies into your hand.” And he gave him a tithe of all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Deuteronomy 1:8-11 15-17  (Vespers 2nd  reading Fathers)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>See, I have set the land before you; go in and possess the land which the Lord swore to your fathers – to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob – to give to them and their descendants after them.’ </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And I spoke to you at that time, saying: ‘I alone am not able to bear you.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The Lord your God has multiplied you, and here you are today, as the stars of heaven in multitude. </dd><dt>11</dt><dd>May the Lord God of your fathers make you a thousand times more numerous than you are, and bless you as He has promised you! </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and knowledgeable men, and made them heads over you, leaders of thousands, leaders of hundreds, leaders of fifties, leaders of tens, and officers for your tribes. </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then I commanded your judges at that time, saying, ‘Hear the cases between your brethren, and judge righteously between a man and his brother or the stranger who is with him. </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>You shall not show partiality in judgment; you shall hear the small as well as the great; you shall not be afraid in any man’s presence, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too hard for you, bring to me, and I will hear it.’ </dd></dl>

readings.title: Deuteronomy 10:14-21  (Vespers 3rd  reading Fathers)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>Indeed heaven and the highest heavens belong to the Lord your God, also the earth with all that is in it. </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>The Lord delighted only in your fathers, to love them; and He chose their descendants after them, you above all peoples, as it is this day. </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore circumcise the foreskin of your heart, and be stiff-necked no longer. </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty and awesome, who shows no partiality nor takes a bribe. </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>He administers justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the stranger, giving him food and clothing. </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Therefore love the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt. </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>You shall fear the Lord your God; you shall serve Him, and to Him you shall hold fast, and take oaths in His name. </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>He is your praise, and He is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome things which your eyes have seen. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:36-53  (6th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>36</dt><dd>Now as they said these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them, and said to them, “Peace to you.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>But they were terrified and frightened, and supposed they had seen a spirit.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet. </dd><dt>41</dt><dd>But while they still did not believe for joy, and marveled, He said to them, “Have you any food here?”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>So they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb. </dd><dt>43</dt><dd>And He took it and ate in their presence.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms concerning Me.”</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>And He opened their understanding, that they might comprehend the Scriptures.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>And you are witnesses of these things.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Behold, I send the Promise of My Father upon you; but tarry in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high.”</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, while He blessed them, that He was parted from them and carried up into heaven.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>And they worshiped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 13:7-16  (Epistle Fathers)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd> Remember those who rule over you, who have spoken the word of God to you, whose faith follow, considering the outcome of their conduct.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Do not be carried about with various and strange doctrines. For it is good that the heart be established by grace, not with foods which have not profited those who have been occupied with them.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>We have an altar from which those who serve the tabernacle have no right to eat.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned outside the camp.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore Jesus also, that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered outside the gate.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore let us go forth to Him, outside the camp, bearing His reproach.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For here we have no continuing city, but we seek the one to come.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Therefore by Him let us continually offer the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of our lips, giving thanks to His name.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But do not forget to do good and to share, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 17:1-13  (Gospel Fathers)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Jesus spoke these words, lifted up His eyes to heaven, and said: “Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son also may glorify You,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>as You have given Him authority over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many as You have given Him.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work which You have given Me to do.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And now, O Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world was.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>I have manifested Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Now they have known that all things which You have given Me are from You.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For I have given to them the words which You have given Me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came forth from You; and they have believed that You sent Me.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>I pray for them. I do not pray for the world but for those whom You have given Me, for they are Yours.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And all Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to You. Holy Father, keep through Your name those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. Those whom You gave Me I have kept; and none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But now I come to You, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 12:6-14  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, let us use them: if prophecy, let us prophesy in proportion to our faith;</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>or ministry, let us use it in our ministering; he who teaches, in teaching;</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, with liberality; he who leads, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil. Cling to what is good.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Be kindly affectionate to one another with brotherly love, in honor giving preference to one another;</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>not lagging in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord;</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>rejoicing in hope, patient in tribulation, continuing steadfastly in prayer;</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>distributing to the needs of the saints, given to hospitality.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 9:1-8  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>So He got into a boat, crossed over, and came to His own city.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then behold, they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a bed. When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, be of good cheer; your sins are forgiven you.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And at once some of the scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes!”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins” – then He said to the paralytic, “Arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And he arose and departed to his house.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Now when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such power to men.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 5:9-6:11  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>I wrote to you in my epistle not to keep company with sexually immoral people.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Yet I certainly did not mean with the sexually immoral people of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or idolaters, since then you would need to go out of the world.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But now I have written to you not to keep company with anyone named a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner – not even to eat with such a person.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside?</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But those who are outside God judges. Therefore “put away from yourselves the evil person.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world will be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters?</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Do you not know that we shall judge angels? How much more, things that pertain to this life?</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>If then you have judgments concerning things pertaining to this life, do you appoint those who are least esteemed by the church to judge?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>I say this to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you, not even one, who will be able to judge between his brethren?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But brother goes to law against brother, and that before unbelievers!</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Now therefore, it is already an utter failure for you that you go to law against one another. Why do you not rather accept wrong? Why do you not rather let yourselves be cheated?</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>No, you yourselves do wrong and cheat, and you do these things to your brethren!</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. Neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor homosexuals, nor sodomites,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And such were some of you. But you were washed, but you were sanctified, but you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus and by the Spirit of our God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:54-58  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>54</dt><dd>When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?</dd><dt>55</dt><dd>Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?”</dd><dt>57</dt><dd>So they were offended at Him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country and in his own house.”</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>Now He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 6:20-7:12  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>For you were bought at a price; therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God’s.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now concerning the things of which you wrote to me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Nevertheless, because of sexual immorality, let each man have his own wife, and let each woman have her own husband.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Let the husband render to his wife the affection due her, and likewise also the wife to her husband.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. And likewise the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Do not deprive one another except with consent for a time, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again so that Satan does not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But I say this as a concession, not as a commandment.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For I wish that all men were even as I myself. But each one has his own gift from God, one in this manner and another in that.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But I say to the unmarried and to the widows: It is good for them if they remain even as I am;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but if they cannot exercise self-control, let them marry. For it is better to marry than to burn with passion.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Now to the married I command, yet not I but the Lord: A wife is not to depart from her husband.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But even if she does depart, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband. And a husband is not to divorce his wife.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But to the rest I, not the Lord, say: If any brother has a wife who does not believe, and she is willing to live with him, let him not divorce her.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 14:1-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For Herod had laid hold of John and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Because John had said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And although he wanted to put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But when Herod’s birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So she, having been prompted by her mother, said, “Give me John the Baptist’s head here on a platter.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And the king was sorry; nevertheless, because of the oaths and because of those who sat with him, he commanded it to be given to her.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>So he sent and had John beheaded in prison.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then his disciples came and took away the body and buried it, and went and told Jesus.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>When Jesus heard it, He departed from there by boat to a deserted place by Himself. But when the multitudes heard it, they followed Him on foot from the cities.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 5:15-6:3  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>But the righteous live for ever, and their reward is with the Lord; the Most High takes care of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore they will receive a glorious crown and a beautiful diadem from the hand of the Lord, because with his right hand he will cover them, and with his arm he will shield them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The Lord will take his zeal as his whole armor, and will arm all creation to repel his enemies;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>he will put on righteousness as a breastplate, and wear impartial justice as a helmet;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>he will take holiness as a invincible shield,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and sharpen stern wrath for a sword, and creation will join with him to fight against the madmen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Shafts of lightning will fly with true aim, and will leap to the target as from a well-drawn bow of clouds,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>and hailstones full of wrath will be hurled as from a catapult; the water of the sea will rage against them, and rivers will relentlessly overwhelm them;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>a mighty wind will rise against them, and like a tempest it will winnow them away. Lawlessness will lay waste the whole earth, and evil-doing will overturn the thrones of rulers.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Listen therefore, O kings, and understand; learn, O judges of the ends of the earth.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Give ear, you that rule over multitudes, and boast of many nations.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For your dominion was given you from the Lord, and your sovereignty from the Most High, who will search out your works and inquire into your plans.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 11:27-30  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 5:22-6:2  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:17-23  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude you, and revile you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! For indeed your reward is great in heaven, for in like manner their fathers did to the prophets.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 7:12-24  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But to the rest I, not the Lord, say: If any brother has a wife who does not believe, and she is willing to live with him, let him not divorce her.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And a woman who has a husband who does not believe, if he is willing to live with her, let her not divorce him.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband; otherwise your children would be unclean, but now they are holy.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But if the unbeliever departs, let him depart; a brother or a sister is not under bondage in such cases. But God has called us to peace.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife?</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But as God has distributed to each one, as the Lord has called each one, so let him walk. And so I ordain in all the churches.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Was anyone called while circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Was anyone called while uncircumcised? Let him not be circumcised.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing, but keeping the commandments of God is what matters.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Let each one remain in the same calling in which he was called.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Were you called while a slave? Do not be concerned about it; but if you can be made free, rather use it.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>For he who is called in the Lord while a slave is the Lord’s freedman. Likewise he who is called while free is Christ’s slave.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of men.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Brethren, let each one remain with God in that state in which he was called.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 14:35-15:11  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>35</dt><dd>And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent out into all that surrounding region, brought to Him all who were sick,</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>and begged Him that they might only touch the hem of His garment. And as many as touched it were made perfectly well.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then the scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>“Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>He answered and said to them, “Why do you also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For God commanded, saying, ‘Honor your father and your mother’; and, ‘He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’ </dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is a gift to God” –</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>then he need not honor his father or mother.’ Thus you have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy about you, saying:</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>These people draw near to Me with their mouth, and honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And in vain they worship Me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.” </dd><dt>10</dt><dd>When He had called the multitude to Himself, He said to them, “Hear and understand:</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Not what goes into the mouth defiles a man; but what comes out of the mouth, this defiles a man.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 12 - 3 [1] Kings 17:1-23  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The Word of the Lord came to Elijah, and He said to Ahab, “As the Lord God of Hosts, the God of Israel lives, before Whom I stand this day, there will be neither dew nor rain these years, except by the words of my mouth.”</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the Word of the Lord came to Elijah, saying, “Depart hence eastward, and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, which is before the River Jordan. And there shall be water from the brook, and you shall drink it, and I will command the ravens to feed you there.” And Elijah went and did according to the word of the Lord; and he sat besides the brook Cherith, which is before the Jordan. And the ravens brought him bread in the morning, and meat in the evening, and he drank water from the brook. And it came to pass after some days, that the brook dried up, for there was no rain in the land.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And the Word of the Lord came to Elijah, saying, “Arise, and go to Sarepta of the Sidonians, and dwell there. For behold, I have commanded there a widow-woman to feed you.” And he arose and went to Sarepta of the Sidonians, and came to the gate of the city; and behold, a widow-woman there was gathering sticks. And Elijah called her and said to her, “Bring to me, now, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.” And she went to fetch it. And Elijah called her and said to her, “Bring me also a morsel of bread in your hand, that I may eat.” And the woman said, “As the Lord your God lives, I have not a cake, but only a handful of meal in the pitcher, and a little oil in a cruse; and behold, I am gathering two sticks that I may go in and prepare it for myself and my children, and we shall eat it and die.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And Elijah said to her, “Take courage, go in and do according to your word; but make of it a little cake first and bring it to me; and afterward you shall make some for yourself and your children. For thus says the Lord God of Israel, the pitcher of meal shall not fail and the cruse of oil shall not be diminished, until the day that the Lord gives rain on the earth.” And the woman went and did according to the words of Elijah; and he ate, and she, and her children. And from that day the pitcher of meal did not fail, and the cruse of oil was not diminished, according to the word of the Lord which He spoke by the hand of Elijah. And it came to pass after this that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick and his illness was very grievous, until there was no breath left in him. And she said to Elijah, “What have I do with you, O man of God? Have you come in to me to call to remembrance my unrighteousness, and to slay my son?” And Elijah said to the woman, “Give me your son.” And he took him from her bosom and carried him to the upper chamber where he was lodged, and laid him upon his own bed. And Elijah cried aloud to the Lord and said, “Woe is me, O Lord, the witness of the widow with whom I now abide; Thou hast wrought harm in slaying her son!”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And he blew on the child three times, and called on the Lord and said, “O Lord my God, let the soul of this child return to him.” And it was so. And the child cried out; and he brought him down from the upper chamber into the house, and gave him to his mother. And Elijah said, “See, your son lives.” And the woman said to Elijah, “Behold, I know that you are a man of God, and the word of the Lord in your mouth is true.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 13 - 3 [1] Kings 18 19  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The Word of God came to Elijah the Tishbite in the third year of the reign of Ahab, saying, “Go, and show yourself to Ahab; and I will bring rain upon the face of the earth.” And it came to pass when Ahab saw Elijah, that he said to him, “Are you he that troubles Israel?” And Elijah said “I do not trouble Israel, but it is you and your father’s house, in that you forsook the Lord God, and you followed after Baal. Now therefore send and gather all Israel to me at Mount Carmel, and the four hundred and fifty prophets of shame of Baal, and the four hundred prophets of the groves who eat at Jezebel’s table.”</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And according to the word of Elijah, Ahab sent to all Israel, and gathered all the prophets on Mount Carmel, and brought Elijah before all of them. And Elijah said to them, “How long will you go limping on both feet? If the Lord is God, follow Him; but if Baal, then follow him.” And the people answered him not a word.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And Elijah said to the people, “I, even I only, am left a prophet of the Lord; and the prophets of Baal are four hundred and fifty men, and the prophets of the groves four hundred.” And Elijah said, “Give me two oxen, and let you choose one for yourselves, and cut it in pieces and lay it on the wood, but put no fire to it; and I will prepare the other bullock and lay it on the wood, and put no fire to it. And you call on the name of your gods, and I will call on the Name of the Lord, my God; and the God Who answers by fire, He is God.” And all the people answered and said, “The word that Elijah has spoken is good; let it be so.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And Elijah said to the prophets of shame, “Choose for yourselves one bullock and prepare it first, for you are many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire to it.” And they took the bullock and prepared it; and they called on the name of Baal from morning until noon, and said, “Hear us, O Baal, hear us!” But there was no voice, nor an answer. And they ran about the altar which they had made.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And it was noon, and Elijah the Tishbite mocked them and said, “Call with a loud voice, for your god is (musing), or he has gone to another place, or perhaps is sleeping and you must awake him.” And they cried with a loud voice, and cut themselves with knives and flogged themselves many times with whips, even to the shedding of their own blood. And they prophesied until the evening; and it came to pass that it was the time of the offering of the scarifice, but there was no voice.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And Elijah spoke to the prophets of shame, saying, “Stand by for the present, and I will offer my sacrifice.” And they stood aside and were silent. And Elijah said to the people, “Come near to me”; and all the people came near to him. And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel, as the Lord had said to him, “Israel shall be your name.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And he built up the stones in the name of the Lord, and repaired the altar that had been broken down; and he made a trench for water that would hold two measures of seed round about the altar. And he piled the cleft wood on the altar which he had made, and divided the whole burnt-offering, and laid on the wood and around the altar. And Elijah said, “Fetch me four jars of water and pour it on the whole-burnt-offering, and on the wood.” And they did so. And he said, “Do it a second time”; and they did it a second time. And he said, “Do it a third time”; and they did it a third time. And the water ran round about the altar, and the trench was filled with water.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And Elijah cried aloud to heaven and said, “O Lord, God of Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, hearken unto me, hearken unto me this day by fire, and let all this people know that Thou alone art the Lord God of Israel and that I am Thy servant and that I have done all these things for Thy sake; for Thou hast turned back the hearts of this people to follow Thee.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then fire fell from the Lord out of heaven and devoured the whole-burnt-offering, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and the water that was in the trench; the fire licked up everything. And all the people fell upon their faces, and said, “Truly the Lord God, he is God!” And Elijah said to the people, “Seize the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape.” And they seized them; and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And Elijah said to Ahab, “Behold, there is the sound of the coming of rain; prepare your chariot and go down, lest the rain overtake you.” And Elijah went up on Mount Carmel, and bowed himself down to the ground; and he put his face between his knees and prayed to the Lord.
