And the heavens grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab wept and went to Jezreel. And the hand of the Lord was upon Elijah; and he girded up his loins and ran before Ahab to Jezreel.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had slain the prophets with the sword. And Jezebel sent to Elijah, saying “By this time tomorrow I will make your life as the life of one of them.” And Elijah heard and was afraid; and he rose and departed for his life. And he came to Beersheba, in the land of Judah.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And he left his servant there and went a days journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree; and he asked, concerning his life, that he might die, and said, “ Let it be enough, O Lord; now take away my life from me; for I am no better than my fathers.” And he lay down and slept under the tree. And behold, an angel of the Lord touched him and said to him, “Arise, eat and drink.” And Elijah looked, and behold, at his head there was a cake of barley and cruse of water. And he arose, and ate and drank, and lay down again and slept.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And the angel of the Lord returned a second time, and touched him, and said to him, “Arise, eat and drink, for the journey will be too much for you.” And he arose, and ate and drank. And he went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Mount Horeb.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And he entered there into a cave, and lodged there. And behold, the word of the Lord came to him, and the Lord said to him, “What are you doing here, Elijah?” And Elijah said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord God Almighty, for the sons of Israel have forsaken Thee; they have thrown down Thine altars, and slain Thy prophets with the sword; and I alone am left; and they seek my life to take it.” And the angel said, “Go forth tomorrow, and stand on the mountain before the Lord.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountain, and broke in pieces the rock before the Lord, but the Lord was not in the wind; and after the wind an earthquake; but the Lord was not in the earthquake; and after the earthquake a fire, but the Lord was not in the fire; and after the fire the voice of a gentle breeze, and the Lord was there. And it came to pass when Elijah heard it, he covered his face with his mantle and went out and stood before the cave.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And behold, a voice came to him, and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?” And Elijah said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord God Almighty, for the sons of Israel have forsaken Thy covenant, thrown down Thine altars, and slain Thy prophets with the sword; and I alone am left; and they seek my life to take it.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And the Lord said to him, “Go, return on your way, and you shall come on the way of the wilderness of Damascus; and you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria; and you shall anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi to be king over Israel; and Elisha the son of Shaphat you shall anoint to be prophet in your place.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 14 - 3 [1] Kings 19:19 20 21 4 [2] Kings 2:16-14  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>In those days, Elijah found Elisha the son of Shaphat, and he was plowing with oxen. And Elijah went to him and cast his mantle upon him. And Elisha left the oxen, and ran after Elijah and ministered to him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And it came to pass, when the Lord was about to take Elijah up in a whirlwind, as it were, into heaven, Elijah and Elisha went out from Gilgal. And Elijah said to Elisha, “Tarry here, then, for the Lord has sent me as far as the Jordan.” And Elisha said, “As the Lord lives, and your soul lives, I will not leave you.” And they both went on. And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went also, and they stood opposite afar off; but Elijah and Elisha stood by the Jordan. And Elijah took his mantle, and rolled it up, and smote the water; and the water was parted to the one side and to the other, and they both went over on dry ground.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And it came to pass when they had gone over, that Elijah said to Elisha, “Ask what I shall do for you before I am taken up from you.” And Elisha said, “Let there be, then, a double portion of your spirit upon me.” And Elijah said, ‘You have asked a hard thing. If you shall see me when I am taken up from you, then shall it be so for you; and if you do not see me, it shall not be so.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And it came to pass as they went on and talked. And, behold, a chariot of fire, and horses of fire! And they seperated the two of them. And Elijah was taken up in a whirlwind, as it were, into heaven. And Elisha saw it, and he cried, “Father! Father! The chariot of Israel and its horsemen!” And he saw him no more. And he took hold of his garments and rent them into two pieces.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And Elisha took up the mantle of Elijah that had fallen upon his head. And Elisha went back and stood upon the bank of the Jordan. And Elisha took up the mantle of Elijah that had fallen upon his head, and smote the waters, but they were not parted. And Elisha said, “Where now, is the God of Elijah, He also?” And Elisha smote the waters a second time, and the waters parted; and he went over on dry land.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:22-30  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He said to them, “You will surely say this proverb to Me, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a great famine throughout all the land;</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>but to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then passing through the midst of them, He went His way.</dd></dl>

readings.title: James 5:10-20  (Epistle Prophet)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>My brethren, take the prophets, who spoke in the name of the Lord, as an example of suffering and patience.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Indeed we count them blessed who endure. You have heard of the perseverance of Job and seen the end intended by the Lord – that the Lord is very compassionate and merciful.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But above all, my brethren, do not swear, either by heaven or by earth or with any other oath. But let your “Yes” be “Yes,” and your “No,” “No,” lest you fall into judgment.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Is anyone among you suffering? Let him pray. Is anyone cheerful? Let him sing psalms.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Is anyone among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And the prayer of faith will save the sick, and the Lord will raise him up. And if he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Confess your trespasses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Elijah was a man with a nature like ours, and he prayed earnestly that it would not rain; and it did not rain on the land for three years and six months.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth produced its fruit.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Brethren, if anyone among you wanders from the truth, and someone turns him back,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and cover a multitude of sins.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:22-30  (Gospel Prophet)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He said to them, “You will surely say this proverb to Me, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a great famine throughout all the land;</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>but to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then passing through the midst of them, He went His way.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 7:24-35  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>Brethren, let each one remain with God in that state in which he was called.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now concerning virgins: I have no commandment from the Lord; yet I give judgment as one whom the Lord in His mercy has made trustworthy.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>I suppose therefore that this is good because of the present distress – that it is good for a man to remain as he is:</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Are you bound to a wife? Do not seek to be loosed. Are you loosed from a wife? Do not seek a wife.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But even if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless such will have trouble in the flesh, but I would spare you.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But this I say, brethren, the time is short, so that from now on even those who have wives should be as though they had none,</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>those who weep as though they did not weep, those who rejoice as though they did not rejoice, those who buy as though they did not possess,</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>and those who use this world as not misusing it. For the form of this world is passing away.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>But I want you to be without care. He who is unmarried cares for the things of the Lord – how he may please the Lord.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But he who is married cares about the things of the world – how he may please his wife.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>There is a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the world – how she may please her husband.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And this I say for your own profit, not that I may put a leash on you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 15:12-21  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Then His disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But He answered and said, “Every plant which My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Let them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind leads the blind, both will fall into a ditch.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Then Peter answered and said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So Jesus said, “Are you also still without understanding?</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Do you not yet understand that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and is eliminated?</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile a man.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>These are the things which defile a man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Then Jesus went out from there and departed to the region of Tyre and Sidon.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 7:35-8:7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>35</dt><dd>And this I say for your own profit, not that I may put a leash on you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>But if any man thinks he is behaving improperly toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of youth, and thus it must be, let him do what he wishes. He does not sin; let them marry.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Nevertheless he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own will, and has so determined in his heart that he will keep his virgin, does well.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>So then he who gives her in marriage does well, but he who does not give her in marriage does better.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>A wife is bound by law as long as her husband lives; but if her husband dies, she is at liberty to be married to whom she wishes, only in the Lord.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But she is happier if she remains as she is, according to my judgment – and I think I also have the Spirit of God.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now concerning things offered to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love edifies.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But if anyone loves God, this one is known by Him.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Therefore concerning the eating of things offered to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For even if there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many gods and many lords),</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>yet for us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we for Him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and through whom we live.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>However, there is not in everyone that knowledge; for some, with consciousness of the idol, until now eat it as a thing offered to an idol; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 15:29-31  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>29</dt><dd>Jesus departed from there, skirted the Sea of Galilee, and went up on the mountain and sat down there.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then great multitudes came to Him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others; and they laid them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>So the multitude marveled when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 12:1-3  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 10:37-11:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And he who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And whoever gives one of these little ones only a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, assuredly, I say to you, he shall by no means lose his reward.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:1-10  (7th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and were going to the tomb.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 15:1-7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>We then who are strong ought to bear with the scruples of the weak, and not to please ourselves.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Let each of us please his neighbor for his good, leading to edification.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For even Christ did not please Himself; but as it is written, “The reproaches of those who reproached You fell on Me.” </dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For whatever things were written before were written for our learning, that we through the patience and comfort of the Scriptures might have hope.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now may the God of patience and comfort grant you to be like-minded toward one another, according to Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>that you may with one mind and one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Therefore receive one another, just as Christ also received us, to the glory of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 9:27-35  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>When Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>And when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith let it be to you.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one knows it.”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>But when they had departed, they spread the news about Him in all that country.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>As they went out, behold, they brought to Him a man, mute and demon-possessed.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>And when the demon was cast out, the mute spoke. And the multitudes marveled, saying, “It was never seen like this in Israel!”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons by the ruler of the demons.”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Then Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 43:9-14  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled. Who among them can declare this, and show us former things? Let them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear and say, “It is truth.”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>“You are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “And My servant whom I have chosen, that you may know and believe Me, and understand that I am He. Before Me there was no God formed, nor shall there be after Me.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I, even I, am the Lord, and besides Me there is no savior. </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>I have declared and saved, I have proclaimed, and there was no foreign god among you; therefore you are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “that I am God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Indeed before the day was, I am He; and there is no one who can deliver out of My hand; I work, and who will reverse it?”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon, and bring them all down as fugitives – the Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 21:12-19  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and rulers for My name’s sake.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But it will turn out for you as an occasion for testimony.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Therefore settle it in your hearts not to meditate beforehand on what you will answer;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to contradict or resist.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>You will be betrayed even by parents and brothers, relatives and friends; and they will put some of you to death.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But not a hair of your head shall be lost.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>By your patience possess your souls.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 8:28-39  (Epistle Saints)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>For whom He foreknew, He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son, that He might be the firstborn among many brethren.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these He also justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>He who did not spare His own Son, but delivered Him up for us all, how shall He not with Him also freely give us all things?</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, and furthermore is also risen, who is even at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>As it is written: “For Your sake we are killed all day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.” </dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Yet in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities nor powers, nor things present nor things to come,</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 15:17-16:2  (Gospel Saints)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>These things I command you, that you love one another.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He who hates Me hates My Father also.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’ </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 9:13-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>Do you not know that those who minister the holy things eat of the things of the temple, and those who serve at the altar partake of the offerings of the altar?</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Even so the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should live from the gospel.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But I have used none of these things, nor have I written these things that it should be done so to me; for it would be better for me to die than that anyone should make my boasting void.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For if I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast of, for necessity is laid upon me; yes, woe is me if I do not preach the gospel!</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For if I do this willingly, I have a reward; but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a stewardship.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>What is my reward then? That when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ without charge, that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 16:1-6  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing Him asked that He would show them a sign from heaven.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>He answered and said to them, “When it is evening you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red’;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and in the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the face of the sky, but you cannot discern the signs of the times.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” And He left them and departed.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 4:22-31  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>For it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman, the other by a freewoman.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, and he of the freewoman through promise,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>which things are symbolic. For these are the two covenants: the one from Mount Sinai which gives birth to bondage, which is Hagar – </dd><dt>25</dt><dd>for this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children – </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>but the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>For it is written: “Rejoice, O barren, You who do not bear! Break forth and shout, You who are not in labor! For the desolate has many more children Than she who has a husband.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the bondwoman and her son, for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 8:16-21  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a lampstand, that those who enter may see the light.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and come to light.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Therefore take heed how you hear. For whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he seems to have will be taken from him.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Then His mother and brothers came to Him, and could not approach Him because of the crowd.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And it was told Him by some, who said, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But He answered and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 10:5-12  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>But with most of them God was not well pleased, for their bodies were scattered in the wilderness.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now these things became our examples, to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as they also lusted.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And do not become idolaters as were some of them. As it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Nor let us commit sexual immorality, as some of them did, and in one day twenty-three thousand fell;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>nor let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed by serpents;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>nor complain, as some of them also complained, and were destroyed by the destroyer.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now all these things happened to them as examples, and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages have come.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 16:6-12  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have taken no bread.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But Jesus, being aware of it, said to them, “O you of little faith, why do you reason among yourselves because you have brought no bread? </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Do you not yet understand, or remember the five loaves of the five thousand and how many baskets you took up?</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand and how many large baskets you took up?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>How is it you do not understand that I did not speak to you concerning bread? – but to beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then they understood that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 5:15-6:3  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>But the righteous live for ever, and their reward is with the Lord; the Most High takes care of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore they will receive a glorious crown and a beautiful diadem from the hand of the Lord, because with his right hand he will cover them, and with his arm he will shield them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The Lord will take his zeal as his whole armor, and will arm all creation to repel his enemies;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>he will put on righteousness as a breastplate, and wear impartial justice as a helmet;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>he will take holiness as a invincible shield,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and sharpen stern wrath for a sword, and creation will join with him to fight against the madmen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Shafts of lightning will fly with true aim, and will leap to the target as from a well-drawn bow of clouds,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>and hailstones full of wrath will be hurled as from a catapult; the water of the sea will rage against them, and rivers will relentlessly overwhelm them;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>a mighty wind will rise against them, and like a tempest it will winnow them away. Lawlessness will lay waste the whole earth, and evil-doing will overturn the thrones of rulers.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Listen therefore, O kings, and understand; learn, O judges of the ends of the earth.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Give ear, you that rule over multitudes, and boast of many nations.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For your dominion was given you from the Lord, and your sovereignty from the Most High, who will search out your works and inquire into your plans.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:1-6  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God. And this is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you have heard was coming, and is now already in the world.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>They are of the world. Therefore they speak as of the world, and the world hears them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:20-5:5  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>If someone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And this commandment we have from Him: that he who loves God must love his brother also.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who begot also loves him who is begotten of Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep His commandments.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world – our faith.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:9-16  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Philippians 3:7-14  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Yet indeed I also count all things loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness, which is from the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>that I may know Him and the power of His resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>if, by any means, I may attain to the resurrection from the dead.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Not that I have already attained, or am already perfected; but I press on, that I may lay hold of that for which Christ Jesus has also laid hold of me.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Brethren, I do not count myself to have apprehended; but one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and reaching forward to those things which are ahead,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I press toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 10:29-31 42-45  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>29</dt><dd>So Jesus answered and said, “Assuredly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My sake and the gospel’s,</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>who shall not receive a hundredfold now in this time – houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions – and in the age to come, eternal life.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But Jesus called them to Himself and said to them, “You know that those who are considered rulers over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Yet it shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>And whoever of you desires to be first shall be slave of all.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 10:12-22  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>No temptation has overtaken you except such as is common to man; but God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will also make the way of escape, that you may be able to bear it.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>I speak as to wise men; judge for yourselves what I say.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For we, though many, are one bread and one body; for we all partake of that one bread.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Observe Israel after the flesh: Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>What am I saying then? That an idol is anything, or what is offered to idols is anything?</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Rather, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God, and I do not want you to have fellowship with demons.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the Lord’s table and of the table of demons.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than He?</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 16:20-24  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He commanded His disciples that they should tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>From that time Jesus began to show to His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Far be it from You, Lord; this shall not happen to You!”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are an offense to Me, for you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Timothy 2:1-10  (Epistle St Panteleimon)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>You therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the things that you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit these to faithful men who will be able to teach others also.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>No one engaged in warfare entangles himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who enlisted him as a soldier.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And also if anyone competes in athletics, he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The hardworking farmer must be first to partake of the crops.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Remember that Jesus Christ, of the seed of David, was raised from the dead according to my gospel,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>for which I suffer trouble as an evildoer, even to the point of chains; but the word of God is not chained.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 15:17-16:2  (Gospel St Panteleimon)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>These things I command you, that you love one another.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He who hates Me hates My Father also.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’ </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 10:28-11:7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>But if anyone says to you, “This was offered to idols,” do not eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for conscience’ sake; for “the earth is the LORD’s, and all its fullness.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Conscience, I say, not your own, but that of the other. For why is my liberty judged by another man’s conscience?</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>But if I partake with thanks, why am I evil spoken of for the food over which I give thanks?</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Therefore, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Give no offense, either to the Jews or to the Greeks or to the church of God,</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>just as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Imitate me, just as I also imitate Christ. (2) Now I praise you, brethren, that you remember me in all things and keep the traditions just as I delivered them to you.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ, the head of woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, for that is one and the same as if her head were shaved.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>For if a woman is not covered, let her also be shorn. But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 16:24-28  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>For the Son of Man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He will reward each according to his works.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Assuredly, I say to you, there are some standing here who shall not taste death till they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 11:8-22  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>For man is not from woman, but woman from man.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Nor was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For this reason the woman ought to have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Nevertheless, neither is man independent of woman, nor woman independent of man, in the Lord.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For as woman came from man, even so man also comes through woman; but all things are from God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Judge among yourselves. Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her; for her hair is given to her for a covering.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor do the churches of God.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Now in giving these instructions I do not praise you, since you come together not for the better but for the worse.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For first of all, when you come together as a church, I hear that there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For there must also be factions among you, that those who are approved may be recognized among you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Therefore when you come together in one place, it is not to eat the Lord’s Supper.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For in eating, each one takes his own supper ahead of others; and one is hungry and another is drunk.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>What! Do you not have houses to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you in this? I do not praise you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 17:10-18  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to them, “Indeed, Elijah is coming first and will restore all things.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But I say to you that Elijah has come already, and they did not know him but did to him whatever they wished. Likewise the Son of Man is also about to suffer at their hands.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them of John the Baptist.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And when they had come to the multitude, a man came to Him, kneeling down to Him and saying,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is an epileptic and suffers severely; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not cure him.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him here to Me.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him; and the child was cured from that very hour.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 13:1-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Let every soul be subject to the governing authorities. For there is no authority except from God, and the authorities that exist are appointed by God.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Therefore whoever resists the authority resists the ordinance of God, and those who resist will bring judgment on themselves.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to evil. Do you want to be unafraid of the authority? Do what is good, and you will have praise from the same.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For he is God’s minister to you for good. But if you do evil, be afraid; for he does not bear the sword in vain; for he is God’s minister, an avenger to execute wrath on him who practices evil.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Therefore you must be subject, not only because of wrath but also for conscience’ sake.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>For because of this you also pay taxes, for they are God’s ministers attending continually to this very thing.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Render therefore to all their due: taxes to whom taxes are due, customs to whom customs, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Owe no one anything except to love one another, for he who loves another has fulfilled the law.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For the commandments, “You shall not commit adultery,” “You shall not murder,” “You shall not steal,” “You shall not bear false witness,” “You shall not covet,” and if there is any other commandment, are all summed up in this saying, namely, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Love does no harm to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 12:30-37  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>30</dt><dd>He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters abroad.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Therefore I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, either in this age or in the age to come.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or else make the tree bad and its fruit bad; for a tree is known by its fruit.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Brood of vipers! How can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good things, and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>But I say to you that for every idle word men may speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 20:11-18  (8th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?” She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said to Him, “Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have laid Him, and I will take Him away.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to Him, “Rabboni!” (which is to say, Teacher).</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Jesus said to her, “Do not cling to Me, for I have not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say to them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.’”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things to her.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 1:10-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>Now I plead with you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For it has been declared to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of Chloe’s household, that there are contentions among you.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Now I say this, that each of you says, “I am of Paul,” or “I am of Apollos,” or “I am of Cephas,” or “I am of Christ.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>lest anyone should say that I had baptized in my own name.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Besides, I do not know whether I baptized any other.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of no effect.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 14:14-22  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>And when Jesus went out He saw a great multitude; and He was moved with compassion for them, and healed their sick.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>When it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, “This is a deserted place, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages and buy themselves food.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And they said to Him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>He said, “Bring them here to Me.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Then He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass. And He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke and gave the loaves to the disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitudes.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>So they all ate and were filled, and they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments that remained.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Now those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Immediately Jesus made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, while He sent the multitudes away.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 11:31-12:6  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>For if we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>But when we are judged, we are chastened by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Therefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest you come together for judgment. And the rest I will set in order when I come.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, however you were led.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed, and no one can say that Jesus is Lord except by the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>There are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>There are differences of ministries, but the same Lord.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And there are diversities of activities, but it is the same God who works all in all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 18:1-11  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then Jesus called a little child to Him, set him in the midst of them,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and said, “Assuredly, I say to you, unless you are converted and become as little children, you will by no means enter the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Therefore whoever humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Whoever receives one little child like this in My name receives Me.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were drowned in the depth of the sea.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Woe to the world because of offenses! For offenses must come, but woe to that man by whom the offense comes!</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>If your hand or foot causes you to sin, cut it off and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life lame or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be cast into the everlasting fire.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Take heed that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I say to you that in heaven their angels always see the face of My Father who is in heaven.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost. </dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 1:18-24  (Epistle Cross)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For it is written:</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the disputer of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For since, in the wisdom of God, the world through wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of the message preached to save those who believe.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>For Jews request a sign, and Greeks seek after wisdom;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>but we preach Christ crucified, to the Jews a stumbling block and to the Greeks foolishness,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 19:6-11 13-20 25-28 30-35  (Gospel Cross)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify Him, crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “You take Him and crucify Him, for I find no fault in Him.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and went again into the Praetorium, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to crucify You, and power to release You?”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Jesus answered, “You could have no power at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, “Behold your King!”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But they cried out, “Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away. </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the center.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst!”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>So when Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And bowing His head, He gave up His spirit.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Therefore, because it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And he who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true; and he knows that he is telling the truth, so that you may believe.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 11:33-12:2  (Epistle Martyrs)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>33</dt><dd>who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became valiant in battle, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Women received their dead raised to life again. Others were tortured, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Still others had trial of mockings and scourgings, yes, and of chains and imprisonment.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>They were stoned, they were sawn in two, were tempted, were slain with the sword. They wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, tormented – </dd><dt>38</dt><dd>of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and mountains, in dens and caves of the earth.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And all these, having obtained a good testimony through faith, did not receive the promise,</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>God having provided something better for us, that they should not be made perfect apart from us.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore we also, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which so easily ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>looking unto Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith, who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross, despising the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 10:32-36 11:1  (Gospel Martyrs)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>32</dt><dd>Therefore whoever confesses Me before men, him I will also confess before My Father who is in heaven.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But whoever denies Me before men, him I will also deny before My Father who is in heaven.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Do not think that I came to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace but a sword.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>For I have come to ‘set a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law’;</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>and ‘a man’s enemies will be those of his own household.’ </dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 2:11-18  (Epistle At the Blessing of Waters)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>For both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one, for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brethren,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>saying: “I will declare Your name to My brethren; in the midst of the assembly I will sing praise to You.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And again: “I will put My trust in Him.” And again: “Here am I and the children whom God has given Me.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Inasmuch then as the children have partaken of flesh and blood, He Himself likewise shared in the same, that through death He might destroy him who had the power of death, that is, the devil,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>and release those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For indeed He does not give aid to angels, but He does give aid to the seed of Abraham.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Therefore, in all things He had to be made like His brethren, that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For in that He Himself has suffered, being tempted, He is able to aid those who are tempted.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 5:1-4  (Gospel At the Blessing of Waters)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had. </dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 12:12-26  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>For as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of that one body, being many, are one body, so also is Christ.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body – whether Jews or Greeks, whether slaves or free – and have all been made to drink into one Spirit.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For in fact the body is not one member but many.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>If the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>If the whole body were an eye, where would be the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where would be the smelling?</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body just as He pleased.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And if they were all one member, where would the body be?</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But now indeed there are many members, yet one body.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And the eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you”; nor again the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And those members of the body which we think to be less honorable, on these we bestow greater honor; and our unpresentable parts have greater modesty,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>but our presentable parts have no need. But God composed the body, having given greater honor to that part which lacks it,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>that there should be no schism in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; or if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 18:18-22 19:1-2 13-15  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>Assuredly, I say to you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Again I say to you that if two of you agree on earth concerning anything that they ask, it will be done for them by My Father in heaven.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>For where two or three are gathered together in My name, I am there in the midst of them.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Then Peter came to Him and said, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Up to seven times?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these sayings, that He departed from Galilee and came to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them there.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then little children were brought to Him that He might put His hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of heaven.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And He laid His hands on them and departed from there.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 13:4-14:5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>4</dt><dd>Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth;</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Love never fails. But whether there are prophecies, they will fail; whether there are tongues, they will cease; whether there is knowledge, it will vanish away.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For we know in part and we prophesy in part.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know just as I also am known.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Pursue love, and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For he who speaks in a tongue does not speak to men but to God, for no one understands him; however, in the spirit he speaks mysteries.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But he who prophesies speaks edification and exhortation and comfort to men.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>He who speaks in a tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>I wish you all spoke with tongues, but even more that you prophesied; for he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues, unless indeed he interprets, that the church may receive edification.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 20:1-16  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Now when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>and said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day?’</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right you will receive.’ </dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So when evening had come, the owner of the vineyard said to his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning with the last to the first.’</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And when those came who were hired about the eleventh hour, they each received a denarius.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received each a denarius.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when they had received it, they complained against the landowner,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>saying, ‘These last men have worked only one hour, and you made them equal to us who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.’</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But he answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Take what is yours and go your way. I wish to give to this last man the same as to you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Is it not lawful for me to do what I wish with my own things? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few chosen.’” </dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 14:6-19  (Epistle)
