And they went out to see what it was that had happened.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Then they came to Jesus, and saw the one who had been demon-possessed and had the legion, sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And those who saw it told them how it happened to him who had been demon-possessed, and about the swine.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then they began to plead with Him to depart from their region.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And when He got into the boat, he who had been demon-possessed begged Him that he might be with Him.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>However, Jesus did not permit him, but said to him, “Go home to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how He has had compassion on you.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis all that Jesus had done for him; and all marveled.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Genesis 28:10-17  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>Now Jacob went out from Beersheba and went toward Haran.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set. And he took one of the stones of that place and put it at his head, and he lay down in that place to sleep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then he dreamed, and behold, a ladder was set up on the earth, and its top reached to heaven; and there the angels of God were ascending and descending on it.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And behold, the Lord stood above it and said: “I am the Lord God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac; the land on which you lie I will give to you and your descendants.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>“Also your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread abroad to the west and the east, to the north and the south; and in you and in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have spoken to you.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ezekiel 43:27-44:4  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>‘When these days are over it shall be, on the eighth day and thereafter, that the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar; and I will accept you,’ says the Lord God.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces toward the east, but it was shut.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, because the Lord God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“As for the prince, because he is the prince, he may sit in it to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Also He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple; so I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord; and I fell on my face.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 9:1-11  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars;</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>she has slaughtered her meat, she has mixed her wine, she has also furnished her table.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>She has sent out her maidens, she cries out from the highest places of the city,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>“Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine I have mixed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Forsake foolishness and live, and go in the way of understanding.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, and he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For by me your days will be multiplied, and years of life will be added to you.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 1:39-49 56  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>39</dt><dd>Now Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, to a city of Judah,</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>and entered the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And it happened, when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, that the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Then she spoke out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>For indeed, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord.”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And Mary said: “My soul magnifies the Lord,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>For He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant; for behold, henceforth all generations will call me blessed.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>For He who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is His name.</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>And Mary remained with her about three months, and returned to her house.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 2:6-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>But from those who seemed to be something – whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows personal favoritism to no man – for those who seemed to be something added nothing to me.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But on the contrary, when they saw that the gospel for the uncircumcised had been committed to me, as the gospel for the circumcised was to Peter</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>(for He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised also worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles),</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that had been given to me, they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>They desired only that we should remember the poor, the very thing which I also was eager to do.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 5:22-24 35-6:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>And behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue came, Jairus by name. And when he saw Him, he fell at His feet</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>and begged Him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter lies at the point of death. Come and lay Your hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live.”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>So Jesus went with him, and a great multitude followed Him and thronged Him.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>While He was still speaking, some came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house who said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not be afraid; only believe.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>And He permitted no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Then He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw a tumult and those who wept and wailed loudly.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>When He came in, He said to them, “Why make this commotion and weep? The child is not dead, but sleeping.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>And they ridiculed Him. But when He had put them all outside, He took the father and the mother of the child, and those who were with Him, and entered where the child was lying.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>Then He took the child by the hand, and said to her, “Talitha, cumi,” which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Immediately the girl arose and walked, for she was twelve years of age. And they were overcome with great amazement.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>But He commanded them strictly that no one should know it, and said that something should be given her to eat.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He went out from there and came to His own country, and His disciples followed Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Philippians 2:5-11  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>who, being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>but made Himself of no reputation, taking the form of a bondservant, and coming in the likeness of men.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to the point of death, even the death of the cross.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him the name which is above every name,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 2:6-9  (Epistle Saturday Before)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>However, we speak wisdom among those who are mature, yet not the wisdom of this age, nor of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, the hidden wisdom which God ordained before the ages for our glory,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>which none of the rulers of this age knew; for had they known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But, as it is written: “What no eye has seen, nor ear heard, nor the heart of man conceived, what God has prepared for those who love Him,”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 10:37-11:1  (Gospel Saturday Before)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And he who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And whoever gives one of these little ones only a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, assuredly, I say to you, he shall by no means lose his reward.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:1-5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Let a man so consider us, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Moreover it is required in stewards that one be found faithful.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by a human court. In fact, I do not even judge myself.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For I know of nothing against myself, yet I am not justified by this; but He who judges me is the Lord.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each one’s praise will come from God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 23:1-12  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to His disciples,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Therefore whatever they tell you to observe, that observe and do, but do not do according to their works; for they say, and do not do.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For they bind heavy burdens, hard to bear, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad and enlarge the borders of their garments.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>They love the best places at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called by men, ‘Rabbi, Rabbi.’</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But you, do not be called ‘Rabbi’; for One is your Teacher, the Christ, and you are all brethren.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Do not call anyone on earth your father; for One is your Father, He who is in heaven.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And do not be called teachers; for One is your Teacher, the Christ.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But he who is greatest among you shall be your servant.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 16:9-20  (3rd  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>Now when He rose early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>She went and told those who had been with Him, as they mourned and wept.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>After that, He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Later He appeared to the eleven as they sat at the table; and He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who does not believe will be condemned.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And these signs will follow those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>they will take up serpents; and if they drink anything deadly, it will by no means hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>So then, after the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And they went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the accompanying signs. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 6:11-18  (Epistle Sunday Before)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these would compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creation.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 3:13-17  (Gospel Sunday Before)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>No one has ascended to heaven but He who came down from heaven, that is, the Son of Man who is in heaven. </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 1:21-2:4  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Moreover I call God as witness against my soul, that to spare you I came no more to Corinth.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are fellow workers for your joy; for by faith you stand.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow over those from whom I ought to have joy, having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 22:1-14  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and spoke to them again by parables and said:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>“The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who arranged a marriage for his son,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding; and they were not willing to come.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Again, he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “See, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and fatted cattle are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the wedding.”’</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his business.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And the rest seized his servants, treated them spitefully, and killed them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But when the king heard about it, he was furious. And he sent out his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Therefore go into the highways, and as many as you find, invite to the wedding.’</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>So those servants went out into the highways and gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good. And the wedding hall was filled with guests.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who did not have on a wedding garment.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here without a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and cast him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For many are called, but few are chosen.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 2:11-16  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Now when Peter had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed;</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>for before certain men came from James, he would eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And the rest of the Jews also played the hypocrite with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, “If you, being a Jew, live in the manner of Gentiles and not as the Jews, why do you compel Gentiles to live as Jews?</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by faith in Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 5:24-34  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>So Jesus went with him, and a great multitude followed Him and thronged Him.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now a certain woman had a flow of blood for twelve years,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>and had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was no better, but rather grew worse.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>When she heard about Jesus, she came behind Him in the crowd and touched His garment.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For she said, “If only I may touch His clothes, I shall be made well.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Immediately the fountain of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And Jesus, immediately knowing in Himself that power had gone out of Him, turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My clothes?”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>But His disciples said to Him, “You see the multitude thronging You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’”</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And He looked around to see her who had done this thing.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Philippians 2:5-11  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>who, being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>but made Himself of no reputation, taking the form of a bondservant, and coming in the likeness of men.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to the point of death, even the death of the cross.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him the name which is above every name,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 2:21-3:7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>I do not set aside the grace of God; for if righteousness comes through the law, then Christ died in vain.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you that you should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed among you as crucified?</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>This only I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now being made perfect by the flesh?</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Have you suffered so many things in vain – if indeed it was in vain?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Therefore He who supplies the Spirit to you and works miracles among you, does He do it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith? – </dd><dt>6</dt><dd>just as Abraham “believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Therefore know that only those who are of faith are sons of Abraham.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 6:1-7  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He went out from there and came to His own country, and His disciples followed Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And when the Sabbath had come, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, “Where did this Man get these things? And what wisdom is this which is given to Him, that such mighty works are performed by His hands!</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And are not His sisters here with us?” So they were offended at Him.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country, among his own relatives, and in his own house.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now He could do no mighty work there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And He marveled because of their unbelief. Then He went about the villages in a circuit, teaching.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And He called the twelve to Himself, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 3[1] Kings 8:22-23 27-30  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven; </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>and he said: “Lord God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You, who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts. </dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built! </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O Lord my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today: </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place. </dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 3:19-34  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>The Lord by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding He established the heavens;</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>by His knowledge the depths were broken up, and clouds drop down the dew.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>My son, let them not depart from your eyes – keep sound wisdom and discretion;</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>So they will be life to your soul and grace to your neck.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then you will walk safely in your way, and your foot will not stumble.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>When you lie down, you will not be afraid; yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Do not be afraid of sudden terror, nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>For the Lord will be your confidence, and will keep your foot from being caught.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do so.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back, and tomorrow I will give it,” when you have it with you. </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Do not devise evil against your neighbor, for he dwells by you for safety’s sake.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Do not strive with a man without cause, if he has done you no harm.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Do not envy the oppressor, and choose none of his ways;</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>for the perverse person is an abomination to the Lord, but His secret counsel is with the upright.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked, but He blesses the home of the just. </dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Surely He scorns the scornful, but gives grace to the humble.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 9:1-11  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars;</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>she has slaughtered her meat, she has mixed her wine, she has also furnished her table.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>She has sent out her maidens, she cries out from the highest places of the city,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>“Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine I have mixed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Forsake foolishness and live, and go in the way of understanding.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, and he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For by me your days will be multiplied, and years of life will be added to you.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 3:1-4  (Epistle Church)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>who was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses also was faithful in all His house.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this One has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as He who built the house has more honor than the house.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For every house is built by someone, but He who built all things is God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 16:13-18  (Gospel Church)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>So they said, “Some say John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Simon Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build My church, and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 3:15-22  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>Brethren, I speak in the manner of men: Though it is only a man’s covenant, yet if it is confirmed, no one annuls or adds to it.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Now to Abraham and his Seed were the promises made. He does not say, “And to seeds,” as of many, but as of one, “And to your Seed,” who is Christ.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And this I say, that the law, which was four hundred and thirty years later, cannot annul the covenant that was confirmed before by God in Christ, that it should make the promise of no effect.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no longer of promise; but God gave it to Abraham by promise.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>What purpose then does the law serve? It was added because of transgressions, till the Seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was appointed through angels by the hand of a mediator.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Now a mediator does not mediate for one only, but God is one.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Is the law then against the promises of God? Certainly not! For if there had been a law given which could have given life, truly righteousness would have been by the law.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>But the Scripture has confined all under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 6:7-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>And He called the twelve to Himself, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>He commanded them to take nothing for the journey except a staff – no bag, no bread, no copper in their money belts – </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but to wear sandals, and not to put on two tunics.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Also He said to them, “In whatever place you enter a house, stay there till you depart from that place.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And whoever will not receive you nor hear you, when you depart from there, shake off the dust under your feet as a testimony against them. Assuredly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So they went out and preached that people should repent.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many who were sick, and healed them.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Exodus 15:22-16:1  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>So Moses brought Israel from the Red Sea; then they went out into the Wilderness of Shur. And they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Now when they came to Marah, they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter. Therefore the name of it was called Marah.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And the people complained against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>So he cried out to the Lord, and the Lord showed him a tree. When he cast it into the waters, the waters were made sweet. There He made a statute and an ordinance for them, and there He tested them,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>and said, “If you diligently heed the voice of the Lord your God and do what is right in His sight, give ear to His commandments and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you which I have brought on the Egyptians. For I am the Lord who heals you.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees; so they camped there by the waters.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And they journeyed from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the Wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they departed from the land of Egypt.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 3:11-18  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>My son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord, nor detest His correction;</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>for whom the Lord loves He corrects, just as a father the son in whom he delights.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Happy is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who gains understanding;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for her proceeds are better than the profits of silver, and her gain than fine gold.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>She is more precious than rubies, and all the things you may desire cannot compare with her.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Length of days is in her right hand, in her left hand riches and honor.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her, and happy are all who retain her.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 60:11-16  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Therefore your gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day or night, that men may bring to you the wealth of the Gentiles, and their kings in procession.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the nation and kingdom which will not serve you shall perish, and those nations shall be utterly ruined.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>“The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the cypress, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of My sanctuary; and I will make the place of My feet glorious.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Also the sons of those who afflicted you shall come bowing to you, and all those who despised you shall fall prostrate at the soles of your feet; and they shall call you the City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, so that no one went through you, I will make you an eternal excellence, a joy of many generations.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles, and milk the breast of kings; you shall know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 12:28-36  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>Father, glorify Your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Therefore the people who stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said, “This voice did not come because of Me, but for your sake.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be cast out.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all peoples to Myself.”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>This He said, signifying by what death He would die.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>The people answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever; and how can You say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “A little while longer the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you; he who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become sons of light.” These things Jesus spoke, and departed, and was hidden from them.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 3:23-4:5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>23</dt><dd>But before faith came, we were kept under guard by the law, kept for the faith which would afterward be revealed.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Therefore the law was our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But after faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And if you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now I say that the heir, as long as he is a child, does not differ at all from a slave, though he is master of all,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>but is under guardians and stewards until the time appointed by the father.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But when the fullness of the time had come, God sent forth His Son, born of a woman, born under the law,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 6:30-45  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>30</dt><dd>Then the apostles gathered to Jesus and told Him all things, both what they had done and what they had taught.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Come aside by yourselves to a deserted place and rest a while.” For there were many coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>So they departed to a deserted place in the boat by themselves.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But the multitudes saw them departing, and many knew Him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to Him.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And Jesus, when He came out, saw a great multitude and was moved with compassion for them, because they were like sheep not having a shepherd. So He began to teach them many things.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>When the day was now far spent, His disciples came to Him and said, “This is a deserted place, and already the hour is late.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages and buy themselves bread; for they have nothing to eat.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>But He answered and said to them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said to Him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>But He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” And when they found out they said, “Five, and two fish.”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Then He commanded them to make them all sit down in groups on the green grass.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>So they sat down in ranks, in hundreds and in fifties.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And when He had taken the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven, blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to His disciples to set before them; and the two fish He divided among them all.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>So they all ate and were filled.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>And they took up twelve baskets full of fragments and of the fish.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Now those who had eaten the loaves were about five thousand men.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the multitude away.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 1:18-24  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For it is written:</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the disputer of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For since, in the wisdom of God, the world through wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of the message preached to save those who believe.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>For Jews request a sign, and Greeks seek after wisdom;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>but we preach Christ crucified, to the Jews a stumbling block and to the Greeks foolishness,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 19:6-11 13-20 25-28 30-35  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify Him, crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “You take Him and crucify Him, for I find no fault in Him.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and went again into the Praetorium, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Then Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to crucify You, and power to release You?”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Jesus answered, “You could have no power at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, “Behold your King!”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But they cried out, “Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away. </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the center.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst!”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>So when Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And bowing His head, He gave up His spirit.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Therefore, because it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And he who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true; and he knows that he is telling the truth, so that you may believe.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 4:8-21  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage?</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>You observe days and months and seasons and years.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I am afraid for you, lest I have labored for you in vain.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Brethren, I urge you to become like me, for I became like you. You have not injured me at all.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>You know that because of physical infirmity I preached the gospel to you at the first.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And my trial which was in my flesh you did not despise or reject, but you received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>What then was the blessing you enjoyed? For I bear you witness that, if possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>They zealously court you, but for no good; yes, they want to exclude you, that you may be zealous for them.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But it is good to be zealous in a good thing always, and not only when I am present with you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>My little children, for whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>I would like to be present with you now and to change my tone; for I have doubts about you.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law?</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 6:45-53  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>45</dt><dd>Immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the multitude away.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And when He had sent them away, He departed to the mountain to pray.</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Now when evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea; and He was alone on the land.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>Then He saw them straining at rowing, for the wind was against them. Now about the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea, and would have passed them by.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>And when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed it was a ghost, and cried out;</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>for they all saw Him and were troubled. But immediately He talked with them and said to them, “Be of good cheer! It is I; do not be afraid.”</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Then He went up into the boat to them, and the wind ceased. And they were greatly amazed in themselves beyond measure, and marveled.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>For they had not understood about the loaves, because their heart was hardened.</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and anchored there.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 1:26-29  (Epistle Saturday After)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>26</dt><dd>For you see your calling, brethren, that not many wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, are called.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to put to shame the wise, and God has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the things which are mighty;</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>and the base things of the world and the things which are despised God has chosen, and the things which are not, to bring to nothing the things that are,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>that no flesh should glory in His presence.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 8:21-30  (Gospel Saturday After)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sin. Where I go you cannot come.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself, because He says, ‘Where I go you cannot come’?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And He said to them, “You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then they said to Him, “Who are You?” And Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father taught Me, I speak these things.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:17-5:5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>For this reason I have sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful son in the Lord, who will remind you of my ways in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every church.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Now some are puffed up, as though I were not coming to you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord wills, and I will know, not the word of those who are puffed up, but the power.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>For the kingdom of God is not in word but in power.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>What do you want? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and a spirit of gentleness?</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles – that a man has his father’s wife!</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And you are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he who has done this deed might be taken away from among you.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For I indeed, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged (as though I were present) him who has so done this deed.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together, along with my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 24:1-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came up to show Him the buildings of the temple.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And Jesus said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Assuredly, I say to you, not one stone shall be left here upon another, that shall not be thrown down.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to them: “Take heed that no one deceives you.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will deceive many.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled; for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines, pestilences, and earthquakes in various places.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>All these are the beginning of sorrows.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then they will deliver you up to tribulation and kill you, and you will be hated by all nations for My name’s sake.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And then many will be offended, will betray one another, and will hate one another.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Then many false prophets will rise up and deceive many.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And because lawlessness will abound, the love of many will grow cold.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But he who endures to the end shall be saved.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:1-12  (4th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain other women with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then they went in and did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that behold, two men stood by them in shining garments.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the earth, they said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.’”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And they remembered His words.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then they returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them, who told these things to the apostles.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And their words seemed to them like idle tales, and they did not believe them.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 2:16-20  (Epistle Sunday After)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by faith in Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore a minister of sin? Certainly not!</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For if I build again those things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For I through the law died to the law that I might live to God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 8:34-9:1  (Gospel Sunday After)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>34</dt><dd>When He had called the people to Himself, with His disciples also, He said to them, “Whoever desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake and the gospel’s will save it.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul?</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him the Son of Man also will be ashamed when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you that there are some standing here who will not taste death till they see the kingdom of God present with power.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 4:6-15  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>For it is the God who commanded light to shine out of darkness, who has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed – </dd><dt>10</dt><dd>always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So then death is working in us, but life in you.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And since we have the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, “I believed and therefore I spoke,” we also believe and therefore speak,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>knowing that He who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up with Jesus, and will present us with you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For all things are for your sakes, that grace, having spread through the many, may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 22:35-46  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>35</dt><dd>Then one of them, a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him, and saying,</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>“Teacher, which is the great commandment in the law?”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “’You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’ </dd><dt>38</dt><dd>This is the first and great commandment.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ </dd><dt>40</dt><dd>On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose Son is He?” They said to Him, “The Son of David.”</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying:</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>‘The LORD said to my Lord, sit at My right hand, till I make Your enemies Your footstool’? </dd><dt>45</dt><dd>If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his Son?”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare question Him anymore.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 4:28-5:10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the bondwoman and her son, for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Stand fast therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and do not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Indeed I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a debtor to keep the whole law.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You have become estranged from Christ, you who attempt to be justified by law; you have fallen from grace.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For we through the Spirit eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith working through love.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>You ran well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>A little leaven leavens the whole lump.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>I have confidence in you, in the Lord, that you will have no other mind; but he who troubles you shall bear his judgment, whoever he is.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 3:19-22  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>But Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him concerning Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>also added this, above all, that he shut John up in prison.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>When all the people were baptized, it came to pass that Jesus also was baptized; and while He prayed, the heaven was opened.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And the Holy Spirit descended in bodily form like a dove upon Him, and a voice came from heaven which said, “You are My beloved Son; in You I am well pleased.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 5:11-21  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>And I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>I could wish that those who trouble you would even cut themselves off!</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For you, brethren, have been called to liberty; only do not use liberty as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But if you bite and devour one another, beware lest you be consumed by one another!</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these are contrary to one another, so that you do not do the things that you wish.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lewdness,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>idolatry, sorcery, hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions, heresies,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>envy, murders, drunkenness, revelries, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 3:23-4:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>23</dt><dd>Now Jesus Himself began His ministry at about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, the son of Heli,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Janna, the son of Joseph,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>the son of Mattathiah, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>the son of Maath, the son of Mattathiah, the son of Semei, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>the son of Joannas, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattathah, the son of Nathan, the son of David,</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Cainan,</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 6:2-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For each one shall bear his own load.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And let us not grow weary while doing good, for in due season we shall reap if we do not lose heart.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who are of the household of faith.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:1-15  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>being tempted for forty days by the devil. And in those days He ate nothing, and afterward, when they had ended, He was hungry.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And the devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then the devil, taking Him up on a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And the devil said to Him, “All this authority I will give You, and their glory; for this has been delivered to me, and I give it to whomever I wish.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Therefore, if You will worship before me, all will be Yours.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to him, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only you shall serve.’” </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then he brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For it is written: ‘He shall give His angels charge over you, to keep you,’</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and, ‘In their hands they shall bear you up, lest you dash your foot against a stone.’” </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the LORD your God.’” </dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Now when the devil had ended every temptation, he departed from Him until an opportune time.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and news of Him went out through all the surrounding region.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 1:1-9  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus, and faithful in Christ Jesus:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>just as He chose us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before Him in love,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>having predestined us to adoption as sons by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>to the praise of the glory of His grace, by which He made us accepted in the Beloved.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>which He made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>having made known to us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He purposed in Himself,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:16-22  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>So He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He was handed the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written:</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>“The Spirit of the LORD is upon Me, because He has anointed Me to preach the gospel to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>to proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD.” </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He closed the book, and gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of all who were in the synagogue were fixed on Him.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 1:7-17  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>which He made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>having made known to us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He purposed in Himself,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>that in the dispensation of the fullness of the times He might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are on earth – in Him.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>In Him also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestined according to the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His will,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>that we who first trusted in Christ should be to the praise of His glory.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>In Him you also trusted, after you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation; in whom also, having believed, you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>who is the guarantee of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, to the praise of His glory.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Therefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>do not cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers:</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:22-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He said to them, “You will surely say this proverb to Me, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Then He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a great famine throughout all the land;</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>but to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then passing through the midst of them, He went His way.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 4:22-31  (Epistle Forerunner)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>For it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman, the other by a freewoman.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, and he of the freewoman through promise,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>which things are symbolic. For these are the two covenants: the one from Mount Sinai which gives birth to bondage, which is Hagar – </dd><dt>25</dt><dd>for this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children – </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>but the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>For it is written: “Rejoice, O barren, You who do not bear! Break forth and shout, You who are not in labor! For the desolate has many more children Than she who has a husband.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the bondwoman and her son, for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.”</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 1:5-25  (Gospel Forerunner)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>5</dt><dd>There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah.
