His wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both well advanced in years.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So it was, that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And the whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of incense.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zacharias, for your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink. He will also be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Zacharias said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and bring you these glad tidings.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day these things take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And the people waited for Zacharias, and marveled that he lingered so long in the temple.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>But when he came out, he could not speak to them; and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, for he beckoned to them and remained speechless.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>So it was, as soon as the days of his service were completed, that he departed to his own house.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived; and she hid herself five months, saying,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>“Thus the Lord has dealt with me, in the days when He looked on me, to take away my reproach among people.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 10:23-28  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>23</dt><dd>All things are lawful for me, but not all things are helpful; all things are lawful for me, but not all things edify.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Let no one seek his own, but each one the other’s well-being.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Eat whatever is sold in the meat market, asking no questions for conscience’ sake;</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>for “the earth is the LORD’s, and all its fullness.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>If any of those who do not believe invites you to dinner, and you desire to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question for conscience’ sake.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But if anyone says to you, “This was offered to idols,” do not eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for conscience’ sake; for “the earth is the LORD’s, and all its fullness.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:31-36  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>Then He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbaths.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And they were astonished at His teaching, for His word was with authority.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Now in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon. And he cried out with a loud voice,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>saying, “Let us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know who You are – the Holy One of God!”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him in their midst, it came out of him and did not hurt him.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Then they were all amazed and spoke among themselves, saying, “What a word this is! For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits, and they come out.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 43:9-14  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled. Who among them can declare this, and show us former things? Let them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear and say, “It is truth.”</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>“You are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “And My servant whom I have chosen, that you may know and believe Me, and understand that I am He. Before Me there was no God formed, nor shall there be after Me.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I, even I, am the Lord, and besides Me there is no savior. </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>I have declared and saved, I have proclaimed, and there was no foreign god among you; therefore you are My witnesses,” says the Lord, “that I am God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Indeed before the day was, I am He; and there is no one who can deliver out of My hand; I work, and who will reverse it?”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon, and bring them all down as fugitives – the Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 5:15-6:3  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>But the righteous live for ever, and their reward is with the Lord; the Most High takes care of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore they will receive a glorious crown and a beautiful diadem from the hand of the Lord, because with his right hand he will cover them, and with his arm he will shield them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The Lord will take his zeal as his whole armor, and will arm all creation to repel his enemies;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>he will put on righteousness as a breastplate, and wear impartial justice as a helmet;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>he will take holiness as a invincible shield,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and sharpen stern wrath for a sword, and creation will join with him to fight against the madmen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Shafts of lightning will fly with true aim, and will leap to the target as from a well-drawn bow of clouds,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>and hailstones full of wrath will be hurled as from a catapult; the water of the sea will rage against them, and rivers will relentlessly overwhelm them;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>a mighty wind will rise against them, and like a tempest it will winnow them away. Lawlessness will lay waste the whole earth, and evil-doing will overturn the thrones of rulers.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Listen therefore, O kings, and understand; learn, O judges of the ends of the earth.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Give ear, you that rule over multitudes, and boast of many nations.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For your dominion was given you from the Lord, and your sovereignty from the Most High, who will search out your works and inquire into your plans.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:12-35  (5th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Now behold, two of them were traveling that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was seven miles from Jerusalem.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And they talked together of all these things which had happened.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So it was, while they conversed and reasoned, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But their eyes were restrained, so that they did not know Him.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What kind of conversation is this that you have with one another as you walk and are sad?” </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You the only stranger in Jerusalem, and have You not known the things which happened there in these days?”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And He said to them, “What things?” So they said to Him, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a Prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death, and crucified Him.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Yes, and certain women of our company, who arrived at the tomb early, astonished us.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>When they did not find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said He was alive.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but Him they did not see.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And beginning at Moses and all the Prophets, He expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then they drew near to the village where they were going, and He indicated that He would have gone farther.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But they constrained Him, saying, “Abide with us, for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.” And He went in to stay with them.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, as He sat at the table with them, that He took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And they said to one another, “Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>So they rose up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together,</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>And they told about the things that had happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Romans 8:28-39  (Epistle New Martyrs)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>28</dt><dd>And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>For whom He foreknew, He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son, that He might be the firstborn among many brethren.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these He also justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>He who did not spare His own Son, but delivered Him up for us all, how shall He not with Him also freely give us all things?</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, and furthermore is also risen, who is even at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>As it is written: “For Your sake we are killed all day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.” </dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Yet in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities nor powers, nor things present nor things to come,</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 21:12-19  (Gospel New Martyrs)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and rulers for My name’s sake.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But it will turn out for you as an occasion for testimony.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Therefore settle it in your hearts not to meditate beforehand on what you will answer;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to contradict or resist.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>You will be betrayed even by parents and brothers, relatives and friends; and they will put some of you to death.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But not a hair of your head shall be lost.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>By your patience possess your souls.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 6:1-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>We then, as workers together with Him also plead with you not to receive the grace of God in vain.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For He says: “In an acceptable time I have heard You, and in the day of salvation I have helped You.” Behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>We give no offense in anything, that our ministry may not be blamed.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But in all things we commend ourselves as ministers of God: in much patience, in tribulations, in needs, in distresses,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labors, in sleeplessness, in fastings;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>by purity, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by sincere love,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold we live; as chastened, and yet not killed;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 5:1-11  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>So it was, as the multitude pressed about Him to hear the word of God, that He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>and saw two boats standing by the lake; but the fishermen had gone from them and were washing their nets.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>When He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But Simon answered and said to Him, “Master, we have toiled all night and caught nothing; nevertheless at Your word I will let down the net.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And when they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was breaking.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord!”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid. From now on you will catch men.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>So when they had brought their boats to land, they forsook all and followed Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 2 - Proverbs 10 3 8  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The memory of the righteous is with praise and the blessing of the Lord is upon his head. Blessed is the man who has found wisdom and the mortal who has understanding. For it is better to purchase her than treasuries of gold and silver. She is more precious than precious stones and all that is precious is unworthy of her. For length of days and years of life are in her right hand; and in her left hand are riches and glory. Out of her mouth proceeds righteousness and she bears law and mercy upon her tongue.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Hear me, O child, for I will speak noble things. Blessed is the man who keeps my ways, for my ways are the ways of life, and in them is prepared favor from the Lord. Therefore, I pray thee, and utter my voice to the sons of men: For I, wisdom, have dwelt with counsel and knowledge and I have called upon understanding. Counsel and safety are mine, understanding and strength are mine. I love those who love me and those seeking me shall find grace.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Understand craftiness, O you who are simple, and imbibe knowledge, you who are untaught. Hear me again, for I will speak noble things: I will open my mouth and from my lips shall come what is right. For my throat shall meditate truth; false lips are an abomination before me. All the words of my mouth are righteous; there is nothing in them that is twisted or perverse. They are all straight to him who understands and right to those who find knowledge.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I shall instruct you in truth, so that your hope will be in the Lord and you shall be filled with the Spirit.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 10:31-11:12  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut out.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Dishonest scales are an abomination to the Lord, but a just weight is His delight.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>When pride comes, then comes shame; but with the humble is wisdom.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>The integrity of the upright will guide them, but the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, but the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish, and the hope of the unjust perishes.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>The righteous is delivered from trouble, and it comes to the wicked instead.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices; and when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, but a man of understanding holds his peace.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 11:27-30  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 5:22-6:2  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:17-23  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude you, and revile you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! For indeed your reward is great in heaven, for in like manner their fathers did to the prophets.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 1:22-2:3  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>And He put all things under His feet, and gave Him to be head over all things to the church,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And you He made alive, who were dead in trespasses and sins,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the sons of disobedience,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>among whom also we all once conducted ourselves in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, just as the others.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 4:37-44  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>And the report about Him went out into every place in the surrounding region.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Now He arose from the synagogue and entered Simon’s house. But Simon’s wife’s mother was sick with a high fever, and they made request of Him concerning her.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and served them.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>When the sun was setting, all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And demons also came out of many, crying out and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” And He, rebuking them, did not allow them to speak, for they knew that He was the Christ.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Now when it was day, He departed and went into a deserted place. And the crowd sought Him and came to Him, and tried to keep Him from leaving them;</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>but He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to the other cities also, because for this purpose I have been sent.”</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>And He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee. </dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 3:21-4:6  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, we have confidence toward God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do those things that are pleasing in His sight.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as He gave us commandment.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Now he who keeps His commandments abides in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God. And this is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you have heard was coming, and is now already in the world.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>They are of the world. Therefore they speak as of the world, and the world hears them.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:11-16  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>Beloved, if God so loved us, we also ought to love one another.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abides in us, and His love has been perfected in us.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>By this we know that we abide in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as Savior of the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And we have known and believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:20-5:5  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>If someone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And this commandment we have from Him: that he who loves God must love his brother also.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who begot also loves him who is begotten of Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep His commandments.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world – our faith.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:15-25  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 John 4:12-19  (Epistle St John)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abides in us, and His love has been perfected in us.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>By this we know that we abide in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as Savior of the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And we have known and believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Love has been perfected among us in this: that we may have boldness in the day of judgment; because as He is, so are we in this world.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear involves torment. But he who fears has not been made perfect in love.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>We love Him because He first loved us.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 19:25-27 21:24-25  (Gospel St John)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 2:19-3:7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>in whom the whole building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God in the Spirit.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus for you Gentiles – </dd><dt>2</dt><dd>if indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given to me for you,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>how that by revelation He made known to me the mystery (as I have briefly written already,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>by which, when you read, you may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ),</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>which in other ages was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets:</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>that the Gentiles should be fellow heirs, of the same body, and partakers of His promise in Christ through the gospel,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>of which I became a minister according to the gift of the grace of God given to me by the effective working of His power.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 5:12-16  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>And it happened when He was in a certain city, that behold, a man who was full of leprosy saw Jesus; and he fell on his face and implored Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Then He put out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” Immediately the leprosy left him.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And He charged him to tell no one, “But go and show yourself to the priest, and make an offering for your cleansing, as a testimony to them, just as Moses commanded.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>However, the report went around concerning Him all the more; and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by Him of their infirmities.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So He Himself often withdrew into the wilderness and prayed.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 3:8-21  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>To me, who am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>and to make all see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the ages has been hidden in God who created all things through Jesus Christ;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>to the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>according to the eternal purpose which He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>in whom we have boldness and access with confidence through faith in Him.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore I ask that you do not lose heart at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For this reason I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>from whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with might through His Spirit in the inner man,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; that you, being rooted and grounded in love,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and depth and height – </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>to know the love of Christ which passes knowledge; that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>to Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus to all generations, forever and ever. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 5:33-39  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>33</dt><dd>Then they said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and likewise those of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast in those days.”</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Then He spoke a parable to them: “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old one; otherwise the new makes a tear, and also the piece that was taken out of the new does not match the old.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>But new wine must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved. </dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And no one, having drunk old wine, immediately desires new; for he says, ‘The old is better.’”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 5:15-6:3  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>But the righteous live for ever, and their reward is with the Lord; the Most High takes care of them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore they will receive a glorious crown and a beautiful diadem from the hand of the Lord, because with his right hand he will cover them, and with his arm he will shield them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The Lord will take his zeal as his whole armor, and will arm all creation to repel his enemies;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>he will put on righteousness as a breastplate, and wear impartial justice as a helmet;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>he will take holiness as a invincible shield,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and sharpen stern wrath for a sword, and creation will join with him to fight against the madmen.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Shafts of lightning will fly with true aim, and will leap to the target as from a well-drawn bow of clouds,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>and hailstones full of wrath will be hurled as from a catapult; the water of the sea will rage against them, and rivers will relentlessly overwhelm them;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>a mighty wind will rise against them, and like a tempest it will winnow them away. Lawlessness will lay waste the whole earth, and evil-doing will overturn the thrones of rulers.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Listen therefore, O kings, and understand; learn, O judges of the ends of the earth.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Give ear, you that rule over multitudes, and boast of many nations.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For your dominion was given you from the Lord, and your sovereignty from the Most High, who will search out your works and inquire into your plans.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 3:1-9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and no torment will ever touch them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>In the eyes of the foolish they seemed to have died, and their departure was thought to be affliction,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and their going from us to be their destruction; but they are at peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For though in the sight of men they were punished, their hope is full of immortality.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Having been disciplined a little, they will receive great good, because God tested them and found them worthy of himself;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>like gold in the furnace he tried them, and like a sacrificial burnt offering he accepted them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>In the time of their visitation they will shine forth, and will run like sparks through the stubble.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>They will govern nations and rule over peoples, and the Lord will reign over them for ever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Those who trust in him will understand truth, and the faithful will abide with him in love, because grace and mercy are upon his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 4:25-5:12  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Great multitudes followed Him – from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>And seeing the multitudes, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying:</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be filled.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Blessed are you when they revile and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Rejoice and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 4:6-15  (Epistle Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>For it is the God who commanded light to shine out of darkness, who has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed – </dd><dt>10</dt><dd>always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>So then death is working in us, but life in you.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And since we have the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, “I believed and therefore I spoke,” we also believe and therefore speak,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>knowing that He who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up with Jesus, and will present us with you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For all things are for your sakes, that grace, having spread through the many, may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:17-23  (Gospel Saint)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude you, and revile you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! For indeed your reward is great in heaven, for in like manner their fathers did to the prophets.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 4:14-19  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>that we should no longer be children, tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in the cunning craftiness of deceitful plotting,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>but, speaking the truth in love, may grow up in all things into Him who is the head – Christ – </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>from whom the whole body, joined and knit together by what every joint supplies, according to the effective working by which every part does its share, causes growth of the body for the edifying of itself in love.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>This I say, therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the futility of their mind,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>having their understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>who, being past feeling, have given themselves over to lewdness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:12-19  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Now it came to pass in those days that He went out to the mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And when it was day, He called His disciples to Himself; and from them He chose twelve whom He also named apostles:</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot;</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot who also became a traitor.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 4:17-25  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>This I say, therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the futility of their mind,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>having their understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>who, being past feeling, have given themselves over to lewdness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But you have not so learned Christ,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>if indeed you have heard Him and have been taught by Him, as the truth is in Jesus:</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>that you put off, concerning your former conduct, the old man which grows corrupt according to the deceitful lusts,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>and be renewed in the spirit of your mind,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>and that you put on the new man which was created according to God, in true righteousness and holiness.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Therefore, putting away lying, “Let each one of you speak truth with his neighbor,” for we are members of one another.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:17-23  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude you, and revile you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! For indeed your reward is great in heaven, for in like manner their fathers did to the prophets.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 14:20-25  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>Brethren, do not be children in understanding; however, in malice be babes, but in understanding be mature.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>In the law it is written: “With men of other tongues and other lips I will speak to this people; and yet, for all that, they will not hear Me,” says the Lord.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Therefore tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe but to unbelievers; but prophesying is not for unbelievers but for those who believe.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Therefore if the whole church comes together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those who are uninformed or unbelievers, will they not say that you are out of your mind?</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or an uninformed person comes in, he is convinced by all, he is convicted by all.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed; and so, falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 5:17-26  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>Now it happened on a certain day, as He was teaching, that there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every town of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal them. </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then behold, men brought on a bed a man who was paralyzed, whom they sought to bring in and lay before Him.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And when they could not find how they might bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the housetop and let him down with his bed through the tiling into the midst before Jesus.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>When He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answered and said to them, “Why are you reasoning in your hearts?</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise up and walk’?</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins” – He said to the man who was paralyzed, “I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Immediately he rose up before them, took up what he had been lying on, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Genesis 28:10-17  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>Now Jacob went out from Beersheba and went toward Haran.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set. And he took one of the stones of that place and put it at his head, and he lay down in that place to sleep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Then he dreamed, and behold, a ladder was set up on the earth, and its top reached to heaven; and there the angels of God were ascending and descending on it.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And behold, the Lord stood above it and said: “I am the Lord God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac; the land on which you lie I will give to you and your descendants.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>“Also your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread abroad to the west and the east, to the north and the south; and in you and in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>“Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have spoken to you.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ezekiel 43:27-44:4  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>‘When these days are over it shall be, on the eighth day and thereafter, that the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar; and I will accept you,’ says the Lord God.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces toward the east, but it was shut.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, because the Lord God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“As for the prince, because he is the prince, he may sit in it to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Also He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple; so I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord; and I fell on my face.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Proverbs 9:1-11  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars;</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>she has slaughtered her meat, she has mixed her wine, she has also furnished her table.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>She has sent out her maidens, she cries out from the highest places of the city,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>“Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine I have mixed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Forsake foolishness and live, and go in the way of understanding.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, and he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; </dd><dt>9</dt><dd>give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For by me your days will be multiplied, and years of life will be added to you.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 24:36-53  (6th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>36</dt><dd>Now as they said these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them, and said to them, “Peace to you.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>But they were terrified and frightened, and supposed they had seen a spirit.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet. </dd><dt>41</dt><dd>But while they still did not believe for joy, and marveled, He said to them, “Have you any food here?”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>So they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb. </dd><dt>43</dt><dd>And He took it and ate in their presence.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms concerning Me.”</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>And He opened their understanding, that they might comprehend the Scriptures.</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>Then He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>And you are witnesses of these things.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Behold, I send the Promise of My Father upon you; but tarry in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high.”</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Now it came to pass, while He blessed them, that He was parted from them and carried up into heaven.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>And they worshiped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 9:1-7  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then indeed, even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot now speak in detail.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now when these things had been thus prepared, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But into the second part the high priest went alone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the people’s sins committed in ignorance;</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 6:16-7:1  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>And what agreement has the temple of God with idols? For you are the temple of the living God. As God has said: “I will dwell in them and walk among them. I will be their God, and they shall be My people.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Therefore “Come out from among them and be separate, says the Lord. Do not touch what is unclean, and I will receive you.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>“I will be a Father to you, and you shall be My sons and daughters, says the LORD Almighty.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, having these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:31-36  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>And just as you want men to do to you, you also do to them likewise.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>But if you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive back, what credit is that to you? For even sinners lend to sinners to receive as much back.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>But love your enemies, do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High. For He is kind to the unthankful and evil.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Therefore be merciful, just as your Father also is merciful.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 4:25-32  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Therefore, putting away lying, “Let each one of you speak truth with his neighbor,” for we are members of one another.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Be angry, and do not sin: do not let the sun go down on your wrath,</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>nor give place to the devil.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Let him who stole steal no longer, but rather let him labor, working with his hands what is good, that he may have something to give him who has need.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification, that it may impart grace to the hearers.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God in Christ forgave you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:24-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your consolation.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Woe to you who are full, for you shall hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, for you shall mourn and weep.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for so did their fathers to the false prophets.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>To him who strikes you on the one cheek, offer the other also. And from him who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic either.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Give to everyone who asks of you. And from him who takes away your goods do not ask them back.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 5:20-26  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>giving thanks always for all things to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>submitting to one another in the fear of God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Wives, submit to your own husbands, as to the Lord.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>For the husband is head of the wife, as also Christ is head of the church; and He is the Savior of the body.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Therefore, just as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in everything.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for her,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>that He might sanctify and cleanse her with the washing of water by the word,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:37-45  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>Judge not, and you shall not be judged. Condemn not, and you shall not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will be put into your bosom. For with the same measure that you use, it will be measured back to you.”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And He spoke a parable to them: “Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into the ditch?</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is perfectly trained will be like his teacher.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not perceive the plank in your own eye?</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the plank that is in your own eye? Hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>For a good tree does not bear bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>For every tree is known by its own fruit. For men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 5:25-33  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for her,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>that He might sanctify and cleanse her with the washing of water by the word,</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>that He might present her to Himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she should be holy and without blemish.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>So husbands ought to love their own wives as their own bodies; he who loves his wife loves himself.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>For no one ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, just as the Lord does the church.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For we are members of His body, of His flesh and of His bones.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>This is a great mystery, but I speak concerning Christ and the church.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Nevertheless let each one of you in particular so love his own wife as himself, and let the wife see that she respects her husband.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 6:46-7:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>46</dt><dd>But why do you call Me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and not do the things which I say?</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Whoever comes to Me, and hears My sayings and does them, I will show you whom he is like:</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>He is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on the rock. And when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently against that house, and could not shake it, for it was founded on the rock. </dd><dt>49</dt><dd>But he who heard and did nothing is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream beat vehemently; and immediately it fell. And the ruin of that house was great.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now when He concluded all His sayings in the hearing of the people, He entered Capernaum.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 5:33-6:9  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>33</dt><dd>Nevertheless let each one of you in particular so love his own wife as himself, and let the wife see that she respects her husband.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Honor your father and mother, which is the first commandment with promise:</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>that it may be well with you and you may live long on the earth.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And you, fathers, do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the training and admonition of the Lord.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Bondservants, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in sincerity of heart, as to Christ;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>not with eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but as bondservants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>with goodwill doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>knowing that whatever good anyone does, he will receive the same from the Lord, whether he is a slave or free.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And you, masters, do the same things to them, giving up threatening, knowing that your own Master also is in heaven, and there is no partiality with Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 7:17-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And this report about Him went throughout all Judea and all the surrounding region.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Then the disciples of John reported to him concerning all these things.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And John, calling two of his disciples to him, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>When the men had come to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?’”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And that very hour He cured many of infirmities, afflictions, and evil spirits; and to many blind He gave sight.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and tell John the things you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have the gospel preached to them.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>When the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the multitudes concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Indeed those who are gorgeously appareled and live in luxury are in kings’ courts.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>This is he of whom it is written: ‘Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, Who will prepare Your way before You.’ </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For I say to you, among those born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And when all the people heard Him, even the tax collectors justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the will of God for themselves, not having been baptized by him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 2 - Proverbs 10 3 8  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The memory of the righteous is with praise and the blessing of the Lord is upon his head. Blessed is the man who has found wisdom and the mortal who has understanding. For it is better to purchase her than treasuries of gold and silver. She is more precious than precious stones and all that is precious is unworthy of her. For length of days and years of life are in her right hand; and in her left hand are riches and glory. Out of her mouth proceeds righteousness and she bears law and mercy upon her tongue.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Hear me, O child, for I will speak noble things. Blessed is the man who keeps my ways, for my ways are the ways of life, and in them is prepared favor from the Lord. Therefore, I pray thee, and utter my voice to the sons of men: For I, wisdom, have dwelt with counsel and knowledge and I have called upon understanding. Counsel and safety are mine, understanding and strength are mine. I love those who love me and those seeking me shall find grace.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Understand craftiness, O you who are simple, and imbibe knowledge, you who are untaught. Hear me again, for I will speak noble things: I will open my mouth and from my lips shall come what is right. For my throat shall meditate truth; false lips are an abomination before me. All the words of my mouth are righteous; there is nothing in them that is twisted or perverse. They are all straight to him who understands and right to those who find knowledge.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I shall instruct you in truth, so that your hope will be in the Lord and you shall be filled with the Spirit.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 3 - Wisdom of Solomon 4 5  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest. The righteous man who has died will judge the ungodly who are living. For they will see the end of the righteous, and will not understand what was said about him; for the Lord will cast down the ungodly speechless to the ground and shake them from the foundations; they shall become desolate to the end; they will be in sorrows, and their memory will perish. For they will come with fear at the thought of their sins, and their iniquities shall stand against them to convict them.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Then the righteous man will stand with great boldness before those who have afflicted him, and those who have made of no account his labors. Having seen it, they shall be troubled with much fear and they will be amazed at his most-glorious salvation. They will say within themselves in repentance, in anguish of spirit they will groan and say: “This was he whom we had sometimes in derision and a proverb of reproach – we fools! We accounted his life as madness, and his end to be without honor. How is he numbered among the sons of God? And why is his lot among the Saints?</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“Therefore, we have erred from the way of truth, and the light of righteousness did not illumine us, nor did the sun shine on us. We took our fill of the paths of lawlessness and destruction, and we walked impassable pathways, but the way of the Lord we have not known.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 4 - Proverbs 10 Wisdom of Solomon 6 7 8 9  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The mouth of the righteous bringeth forth wisdom; the lips of the wise man know grace. The mouth of the wise speaketh wisdom, and the truth delivereth them from death. If a righteous man dies, hope doth not, for the son of the righteous is born to life, and in his own good things he acquireth the fruit of righteousness. There is always light for the righteous and they obtain grace and glory from the Lord. The tongue of the wise is a good sister-in-law, and in their hearts resteth wisdom. The Lord loveth the hearts of the holy, and acceptable to Him are all the undefiled in the way.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>The wisdom of the Lord illumineth the faces of the wise. For she takes hold of those desiring her by making herself first known to them. She is easily seen by those who love her. He who rises early to seek her shall have no difficulty, and those keeping vigil for the sake of her shall quickly be without sorrows. For she goeth about seeking those worthy of her, and graciously revealeth herself in the pathways. Against wisdom evil doth not prevail.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Therefore I was a lover of her beauty; I loved her and sought her out from my youth. I desired to make her my bride, and even the Master of All loved her. For she is an initiate in the knowledge of God, and a discoverer of His works. Her labors are virtues, for she teaches temperance and prudence, justice and courage; nothing in life is more necessary for men than these. And if anyone desireth much knowledge, she knoweth the things of old, and beholdeth things to come; she understandeth turns of speech and the solution of riddles; she has foreknowledge of signs and wonders and the outcome of times and seasons. She is a mediator of good things for all, for immortality is in her, and glory in the company of her words.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Therefore I appealed to the Lord and prayed to Him, and said to Him with all my heart: “O God of my fathers and Lord of mercy, Who hast made all things by Thy word, and by Thy wisdom hast fashioned man that he should have dominion over the creatures made by Thee, that he should rule the world in holiness and righteousness: Give me wisdom that sits by Thy throne, and cast me not away from among Thy children, for I am Thy servant and the son of Thy handmaid. Send her forth from the heavens, from Thy holy abode, and from the throne of Thy glory, that she may be with me, and instruct me in what is pleasing to Thee. And she shall guide me in understanding, and preserve me in her glory. For the thoughts of mortals are miserable, and their intentions likely to fail.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:1-9  (Matins Gospel)
