readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>And He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He may have the preeminence.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For it pleased the Father that in Him all the fullness should dwell,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>and by Him to reconcile all things to Himself, by Him, whether things on earth or things in heaven, having made peace through the blood of His cross.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>And you, who once were alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now He has reconciled</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy, and blameless, and above reproach in His sight – </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>if indeed you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and are not moved away from the hope of the gospel which you heard, which was preached to every creature under heaven, of which I, Paul, became a minister.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:9-13  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>If a son asks for bread from any father among you, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent instead of a fish?</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Or if he asks for an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 16 - Isaiah 63:15-64:5 8-9  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Turn, O Lord, from heaven, and look from Thy holy habitation and Thy glory. Where are Thy zeal and Thy strength? Where is the multitude of Thy mercies and Thy compassions that Thou hast endured for us? For Thou art our Father, because Abraham has not known us, nor has Israel known us. But do Thou, O Lord, our Father, deliver us; from the beginning Thy name has been on us. Why hast Thou turned us aside, O Lord, from Thy ways, and made hard our hearts that we should not fear Thee? Return for the sake of Thy servants, for the sake of the tribes of Thine inheritance, that, at least, we may inherit a small part of Thy holy mountain. Our adversaries have trodden down Thy sanctuary. We have become as at the beginning when Thou didst not rule over us, and Thy name was not called upon us.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>If Thou wouldst open the heavens, trembling would take hold of the mountains from Thee, and they would melt; like wax melts before the fire. And fire shall burn up the enemies, and Thy name shall be made manifest to Thine adversaries; the nations shall be troubled at Thy presence. When Thou shalt do glorious things, trembling shall take hold of the mountains from Thee. From the ages we have not heard, nor have our eyes seen a God beside Thee, or Thy works which Thou shalt perform for them that wait for mercy. For mercy joins them that work righteousness, and they shall remember Thy ways.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And now, O Lord, Thou art our Father, and we are clay; Thou art our Fashioner and all of us are the work of Thy hands. Be not very angry with us, O Lord, and remember not our sins for ever; but now look on us, for we are all Thy people.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Jeremiah 2:2-12  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>“Go and cry in the hearing of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “ I remember you, the kindness of your youth, the love of your betrothal, when you went after Me in the wilderness, in a land not sown.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Israel was holiness to the LORD, the firstfruits of His increase. All that devour him will offend; disaster will come upon them,” says the LORD.’”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Hear the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob and all the families of the house of Israel.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Thus says the LORD: “ What injustice have your fathers found in Me, that they have gone far from Me, have followed idols, and have become idolaters?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Neither did they say, ‘Where is the LORD, Who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, Who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and pits, through a land of drought and the shadow of death, through a land that no one crossed and where no one dwelt?</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>I brought you into a bountiful country, to eat its fruit and its goodness. But when you entered, you defiled My land and made My heritage an abomination.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>The priests did not say, ‘Where is the LORD?’ And those who handle the law did not know Me; the rulers also transgressed against Me; the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>“ Therefore I will yet bring charges against you,” says the LORD, “ And against your children’s children I will bring charges.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For pass beyond the coasts of Cyprus and see, send to Kedar and consider diligently, and see if there has been such a thing.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Has a nation changed its gods, which are not gods? But My people have changed their Glory for what does not profit.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Be astonished, O heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid; be very desolate,” says the LORD.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Wisdom of Solomon 4:7-15  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>But the righteous man, though he die early, will be at rest.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For old age is not honored for length of time, nor measured by number of years;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>but understanding is gray hair for men, and a blameless life is ripe old age.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>There was one who pleased God and was loved by him,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>He was caught up lest evil change his understanding or guile deceive his soul.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the fascination of wickedness obscures what is good, and roving desire perverts the innocent mind.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Being perfected in a short time, he fulfilled long years;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>for his soul was pleasing to the Lord, therefore he took him quickly from the midst of wickedness.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet the peoples saw and did not understand, nor take such a thing to heart, that God’s grace and mercy are with his elect, and he watches over his holy ones.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 10:16-22  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and harmless as doves.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to councils and scourge you in their synagogues.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>You will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>But when they deliver you up, do not worry about how or what you should speak. For it will be given to you in that hour what you should speak;</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>for it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Now brother will deliver up brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end will be saved.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 12:6-13 25-27  (Epistle Earthquake)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>for whom the LORD loves He chastens, and scourges every son whom He receives.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>If you endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; for what son is there whom a father does not chasten?</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But if you are without chastening, of which all have become partakers, then you are illegitimate and not sons.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Furthermore, we have had human fathers who corrected us, and we paid them respect. Shall we not much more readily be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live?</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed best to them, but He for our profit, that we may be partakers of His holiness.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now no chastening seems to be joyful for the present, but painful; nevertheless, afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore strengthen the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be dislocated, but rather be healed.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>See that you do not refuse Him who speaks. For if they did not escape who refused Him who spoke on earth, much more shall we not escape if we turn away from Him who speaks from heaven,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>whose voice then shook the earth; but now He has promised, saying, “Yet once more I shake not only the earth, but also heaven.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Now this, “Yet once more,” indicates the removal of those things that are being shaken, as of things that are made, that the things which cannot be shaken may remain.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 8:23-27  (Gospel Earthquake)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>23</dt><dd>Now when He got into a boat, His disciples followed Him.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And suddenly a great tempest arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Then His disciples came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>So the men marveled, saying, “Who can this be, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Timothy 2:1-10  (Epistle St Demetrius)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>You therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the things that you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit these to faithful men who will be able to teach others also.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>No one engaged in warfare entangles himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who enlisted him as a soldier.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And also if anyone competes in athletics, he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>The hardworking farmer must be first to partake of the crops.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Remember that Jesus Christ, of the seed of David, was raised from the dead according to my gospel,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>for which I suffer trouble as an evildoer, even to the point of chains; but the word of God is not chained.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 15:17-16:2  (Gospel St Demetrius)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>These things I command you, that you love one another.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He who hates Me hates My Father also.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’ </dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 1:24-29  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ, for the sake of His body, which is the church,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>of which I became a minister according to the stewardship from God which was given to me for you, to fulfill the word of God,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but now has been revealed to His saints.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>To them God willed to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles: which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>To this end I also labor, striving according to His working which works in me mightily.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:14-23  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>And He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. So it was, when the demon had gone out, that the mute spoke; and the multitudes marveled.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Others, testing Him, sought from Him a sign from heaven.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But He, knowing their thoughts, said to them: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and a house divided against a house falls.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? Because you say I cast out demons by Beelzebub.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But if I cast out demons with the finger of God, surely the kingdom of God has come upon you.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are in peace.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>But when a stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes from him all his armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 2:1-7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>For I want you to know what a great conflict I have for you and those in Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>that their hearts may be encouraged, being knit together in love, and attaining to all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the knowledge of the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Now this I say lest anyone should deceive you with persuasive words.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing to see your good order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>As you therefore have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith, as you have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:23-26  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>23</dt><dd>He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And when he comes, he finds it swept and put in order.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 3:12-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore, since we have such hope, we use great boldness of speech – </dd><dt>13</dt><dd>unlike Moses, who put a veil over his face so that the children of Israel could not look steadily at the end of what was passing away.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But their minds were blinded. For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament, because the veil is taken away in Christ.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>But even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Nevertheless when one turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Now the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>But we all, with unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 8:16-21  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a lampstand, that those who enter may see the light.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>For nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and come to light.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Therefore take heed how you hear. For whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he seems to have will be taken from him.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Then His mother and brothers came to Him, and could not approach Him because of the crowd.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And it was told Him by some, who said, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>But He answered and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:1-14  (10th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way He showed Himself:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” They said to him, “We are going with you also.” They went out and immediately got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore; yet the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them, “Children, have you any food?” They answered Him, “No.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they cast, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the multitude of fish.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment (for he had removed it), and plunged into the sea.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fish.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Then, as soon as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Simon Peter went up and dragged the net to land, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty-three; and although there were so many, the net was not broken.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” Yet none of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who are You?” – knowing that it was the Lord.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>This is now the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was raised from the dead.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 2:16-20  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by faith in Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore a minister of sin? Certainly not!</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For if I build again those things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For I through the law died to the law that I might live to God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 8:26-39  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>26</dt><dd>Then they sailed to the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And when He stepped out on the land, there met Him a certain man from the city who had demons for a long time. And he wore no clothes, nor did he live in a house but in the tombs.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have I to do with You, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me!”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For it had often seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles; and he broke the bonds and was driven by the demon into the wilderness.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Jesus asked him, saying, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>And they begged Him that He would not command them to go out into the abyss.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Now a herd of many swine was feeding there on the mountain. So they begged Him that He would permit them to enter them. And He permitted them.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the lake and drowned.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>They also who had seen it told them by what means he who had been demon-possessed was healed.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Then the whole multitude of the surrounding region of the Gadarenes asked Him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. And He got into the boat and returned.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Now the man from whom the demons had departed begged Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>“Return to your own house, and tell what great things God has done for you.” And he went his way and proclaimed throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 2:13-20  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>And you, being dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He has made alive together with Him, having forgiven you all trespasses,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>having wiped out the handwriting of requirements that was against us, which was contrary to us. And He has taken it out of the way, having nailed it to the cross.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Having disarmed principalities and powers, He made a public spectacle of them, triumphing over them in it.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So let no one judge you in food or in drink, or regarding a festival or a new moon or sabbaths,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>which are a shadow of things to come, but the substance is of Christ.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Let no one cheat you of your reward, taking delight in false humility and worship of angels, intruding into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>and not holding fast to the Head, from whom all the body, nourished and knit together by joints and ligaments, grows with the increase that is from God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Therefore, if you died with Christ from the basic principles of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to regulations – </dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:29-33  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>29</dt><dd>And while the crowds were thickly gathered together, He began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet. </dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also the Son of Man will be to this generation.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>The queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and indeed a greater than Solomon is here.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and indeed a greater than Jonah is here.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a secret place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, that those who come in may see the light.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 13:7-16  (Epistle St John Kochurov)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd> Remember those who rule over you, who have spoken the word of God to you, whose faith follow, considering the outcome of their conduct.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Do not be carried about with various and strange doctrines. For it is good that the heart be established by grace, not with foods which have not profited those who have been occupied with them.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>We have an altar from which those who serve the tabernacle have no right to eat.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned outside the camp.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore Jesus also, that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered outside the gate.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore let us go forth to Him, outside the camp, bearing His reproach.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For here we have no continuing city, but we seek the one to come.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Therefore by Him let us continually offer the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of our lips, giving thanks to His name.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But do not forget to do good and to share, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:32-40  (Gospel St John Kochurov)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>32</dt><dd>Do not fear, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Sell what you have and give alms; provide yourselves money bags which do not grow old, a treasure in the heavens that does not fail, where no thief approaches nor moth destroys.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Let your waist be girded and your lamps burning;</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>and you yourselves be like men who wait for their master, when he will return from the wedding, that when he comes and knocks they may open to him immediately.</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>Blessed are those servants whom the master, when he comes, will find watching. Assuredly, I say to you that he will gird himself and have them sit down to eat, and will come and serve them.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>And if he should come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Therefore you also be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:9-16  (Gospel St John Kochurov)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 2:20-3:3  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>Therefore, if you died with Christ from the basic principles of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to regulations – </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Do not touch, do not taste, do not handle,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>which all concern things which perish with the using – according to the commandments and doctrines of men?</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>These things indeed have an appearance of wisdom in self-imposed religion, false humility, and neglect of the body, but are of no value against the indulgence of the flesh.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>If then you were raised with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ is, sitting at the right hand of God.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Set your mind on things above, not on things on the earth.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:34-41  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>34</dt><dd>The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore, when your eye is good, your whole body also is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your body also is full of darkness.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Therefore take heed that the light which is in you is not darkness.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>If then your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, the whole body will be full of light, as when the bright shining of a lamp gives you light.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>And as He spoke, a certain Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. So He went in and sat down to eat.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>Then the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees make the outside of the cup and dish clean, but your inward part is full of greed and wickedness.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Foolish ones! Did not He who made the outside make the inside also?</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>But rather give alms of such things as you have; then indeed all things are clean to you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 3:17-4:1  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>17</dt><dd>And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Wives, submit to your own husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Husbands, love your wives and do not be bitter toward them.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing to the Lord.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Bondservants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not with eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but in sincerity of heart, fearing God.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not to men,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But he who does wrong will be repaid for what he has done, and there is no partiality.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Masters, give your bondservants what is just and fair, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:42-46  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>42</dt><dd>But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass by justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like graves which are not seen, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them.”</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Then one of the lawyers answered and said to Him, “Teacher, by saying these things You reproach us also.”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And He said, “Woe to you also, lawyers! For you load men with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 4:2-9  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>Continue earnestly in prayer, being vigilant in it with thanksgiving;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>meanwhile praying also for us, that God would open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in chains,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Tychicus, a beloved brother, faithful minister, and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things which are happening here.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 11:47-12:1  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>47</dt><dd>Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>In fact, you bear witness that you approve the deeds of your fathers; for they indeed killed them, and you build their tombs.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Therefore the wisdom of God also said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>that the blood of all the prophets which was shed from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation,</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah who perished between the altar and the temple. Yes, I say to you, it shall be required of this generation.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in you hindered.”</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>And as He said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to assail Him vehemently, and to cross-examine Him about many things,</dd><dt>54</dt><dd>lying in wait for Him, and seeking to catch Him in something He might say, that they might accuse Him. </dd><dt>1</dt><dd>In the meantime, when an innumerable multitude of people had gathered together, so that they trampled one another, He began to say to His disciples first of all, “Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Colossians 4:10-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with Mark the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instructions: if he comes to you, welcome him),</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are of the circumcision; they have proved to be a comfort to me.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Epaphras, who is one of you, a bondservant of Christ, greets you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For I bear him witness that he has a great zeal for you, and those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Luke the beloved physician and Demas greet you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Greet the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas and the church that is in his house.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Now when this epistle is read among you, see that it is read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and that you likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And say to Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you may fulfill it.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>This salutation by my own hand – Paul. Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:2-12  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Therefore whatever you have spoken in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear Him who, after He has killed, has power to cast into hell; yes, I say to you, fear Him!</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Are not five sparrows sold for two copper coins? And not one of them is forgotten before God.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Also I say to you, whoever confesses Me before men, him the Son of Man also will confess before the angels of God.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>And anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but to him who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now when they bring you to the synagogues and magistrates and authorities, do not worry about how or what you should answer, or what you should say.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>For the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 5:1-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>For we know that if our earthly house, this tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>if indeed, having been clothed, we shall not be found naked.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we want to be unclothed, but further clothed, that mortality may be swallowed up by life.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now He who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who also has given us the Spirit as a guarantee.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>So we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For we walk by faith, not by sight.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>We are confident, yes, well pleased rather to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Therefore we make it our aim, whether present or absent, to be well pleasing to Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 9:1-6  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Take nothing for the journey, neither staffs nor bag nor bread nor money; and do not have two tunics apiece.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there depart.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>So they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:15-25  (11th  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 6:11-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>11</dt><dd>See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these would compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creation.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 8:41-56  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>41</dt><dd>And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged Him to come to his house,</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as He went, the multitudes thronged Him.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Now a woman, having a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her livelihood on physicians and could not be healed by any,</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>came from behind and touched the border of His garment. And immediately her flow of blood stopped.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>And Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes throng and press You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’” </dd><dt>46</dt><dd>But Jesus said, “Somebody touched Me, for I perceived power going out from Me.”</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before Him, she declared to Him in the presence of all the people the reason she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>And He said to her, “Daughter, be of good cheer; your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>While He was still speaking, someone came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher.” </dd><dt>50</dt><dd>But when Jesus heard it, He answered him, saying, “Do not be afraid; only believe, and she will be made well.”</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>When He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, James, and John, and the father and mother of the girl.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>Now all wept and mourned for her; but He said, “Do not weep; she is not dead, but sleeping.”</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>And they ridiculed Him, knowing that she was dead.</dd><dt>54</dt><dd>But He put them all outside, took her by the hand and called, saying, “Little girl, arise.”</dd><dt>55</dt><dd>Then her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He commanded that she be given something to eat.</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>And her parents were astonished, but He charged them to tell no one what had happened.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 1:1-5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>remembering without ceasing your work of faith, labor of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the sight of our God and Father,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>knowing, beloved brethren, your election by God.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For our gospel did not come to you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit and in much assurance, as you know what kind of men we were among you for your sake.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:13-15 22-31  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>Then one from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But He said to him, “Man, who made Me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Take heed and beware of covetousness, for one’s life does not consist in the abundance of the things he possesses.”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then He said to His disciples, “Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; nor about the body, what you will put on.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>Consider the ravens, for they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor barn; and God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds?</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>If you then are not able to do the least, why are you anxious for the rest?</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin; and yet I say to you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>If then God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>And do not seek what you should eat or what you should drink, nor have an anxious mind.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For all these things the nations of the world seek after, and your Father knows that you need these things.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>But seek the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added to you.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 1:6-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>And you became followers of us and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>so that you became examples to all in Macedonia and Achaia who believe.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For from you the word of the Lord has sounded forth, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place. Your faith toward God has gone out, so that we do not need to say anything.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>For they themselves declare concerning us what manner of entry we had to you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>and to wait for His Son from heaven, whom He raised from the dead, even Jesus who delivers us from the wrath to come.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:42-48  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>42</dt><dd>And the Lord said, “Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his master will make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of food in due season?</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Truly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all that he has.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master is delaying his coming,’ and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and be drunk,</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in two and appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>And that servant who knew his master’s will, and did not prepare himself or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>But he who did not know, yet committed things deserving of stripes, shall be beaten with few. For everyone to whom much is given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been committed, of him they will ask the more.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Joshua 5:13-15  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, a Man stood opposite him with His sword drawn in His hand. And Joshua went to Him and said to Him, “Are You for us or for our adversaries?” </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>So He said, “No, but as Commander of the army of the Lord I have now come.” And Joshua fell on his face to the earth and worshiped, and said to Him, “What does my Lord say to His servant?” </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Then the Commander of the Lord’s army said to Joshua, “Take your sandal off your foot, for the place where you stand is holy.” And Joshua did so. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Judges 6:2 7 11-24  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>and the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel. Because of the Midianites, the children of Israel made for themselves the dens, the caves, and the strongholds which are in the mountains. </dd><dt>7</dt><dd>And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried out to the Lord because of the Midianites, </dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now the Angel of the Lord came and sat under the terebinth tree which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, while his son Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress, in order to hide it from the Midianites. </dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him, and said to him, “The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor!” </dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Gideon said to Him, “O my lord, if the Lord is with us, why then has all this happened to us? And where are all His miracles which our fathers told us about, saying, ‘Did not the Lord bring us up from Egypt?’ But now the Lord has forsaken us and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.” </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Then the Lord turned to him and said, “Go in this might of yours, and you shall save Israel from the hand of the Midianites. Have I not sent you?” </dd><dt>15</dt><dd>So he said to Him, “O my Lord, how can I save Israel? Indeed my clan is the weakest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father’s house.” </dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And the Lord said to him, “Surely I will be with you, and you shall defeat the Midianites as one man.” </dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then he said to Him, “If now I have found favor in Your sight, then show me a sign that it is You who talk with me. </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Do not depart from here, I pray, until I come to You and bring out my offering and set it before You.” And He said, “I will wait until you come back.” </dd><dt>19</dt><dd>So Gideon went in and prepared a young goat, and unleavened bread from an ephah of flour. The meat he put in a basket, and he put the broth in a pot; and he brought them out to Him under the terebinth tree and presented them. </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>The Angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened bread and lay them on this rock, and pour out the broth.” And he did so. </dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Then the Angel of the Lord put out the end of the staff that was in His hand, and touched the meat and the unleavened bread; and fire rose out of the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. And the Angel of the Lord departed out of his sight. </dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Now Gideon perceived that He was the Angel of the Lord. So Gideon said, “Alas, O Lord God! For I have seen the Angel of the Lord face to face.” </dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then the Lord said to him, “Peace be with you; do not fear, you shall not die.” </dd><dt>24</dt><dd>So Gideon built an altar there to the Lord, and called it The-Lord-Is-Peace. To this day it is still in Ophrah of the Abiezrites. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Isaiah 14:7-20  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>7</dt><dd>The whole earth is at rest and quiet; they break forth into singing.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Indeed the cypress trees rejoice over you, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, ‘Since you were cut down, no woodsman has come up against us.’</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>“Hell from beneath is excited about you, to meet you at your coming; it stirs up the dead for you, all the chief ones of the earth; it has raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>They all shall speak and say to you: ‘Have you also become as weak as we? Have you become like us?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, and the sound of your stringed instruments; the maggot is spread under you, and worms cover you.’</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>“How you are fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! How you are cut down to the ground, you who weakened the nations!</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For you have said in your heart: ‘I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will also sit on the mount of the congregation on the farthest sides of the north; </dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High.’</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the lowest depths of the Pit.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>“Those who see you will gaze at you, and consider you, saying: ‘Is this the man who made the earth tremble, who shook kingdoms,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>who made the world as a wilderness and destroyed its cities, who did not open the house of his prisoners?’ </dd><dt>18</dt><dd>“All the kings of the nations, all of them, sleep in glory, everyone in his own house;</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>but you are cast out of your grave like an abominable branch, like the garment of those who are slain, thrust through with a sword, who go down to the stones of the pit, like a corpse trodden underfoot. </dd><dt>20</dt><dd>You will not be joined with them in burial, because you have destroyed your land and slain your people. The brood of evildoers shall never be named. </dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 13:24-30 36-43  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>24</dt><dd>Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field;</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went his way.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>But when the grain had sprouted and produced a crop, then the tares also appeared.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>So the servants of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?’</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants said to him, ‘Do you want us then to go and gather them up?’</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But he said, ‘No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Let both grow together until the harvest, and at the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.”’”</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>He answered and said to them: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>The field is the world, the good seeds are the sons of the kingdom, but the tares are the sons of the wicked one.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who practice lawlessness,</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 2:2-10  (Epistle Angels)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>2</dt><dd>For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just reward,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation, which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed to us by those who heard Him,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>God also bearing witness both with signs and wonders, with various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to His own will?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For He has not put the world to come, of which we speak, in subjection to angels.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But one testified in a certain place, saying: “What is man that You are mindful of him, or the son of man that You take care of him?</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>You have made him a little lower than the angels; You have crowned him with glory and honor, and set him over the works of Your hands.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>You have put all things in subjection under his feet.” For in that He put all in subjection under him, He left nothing that is not put under him. But now we do not yet see all things put under him.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, for the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that He, by the grace of God, might taste death for everyone.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For it was fitting for Him, for whom are all things and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:16-21  (Gospel Angels)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>He who hears you hears Me, he who rejects you rejects Me, and he who rejects Me rejects Him who sent Me.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Then the seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in Your name.”</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And He said to them, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Behold, I give you the authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall by any means hurt you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Nevertheless do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice because your names are written in heaven.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>In that hour Jesus rejoiced in the Spirit and said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and revealed them to babes. Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 2:1-8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>For you yourselves know, brethren, that our coming to you was not in vain.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But even after we had suffered before and were spitefully treated at Philippi, as you know, we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God in much conflict.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For our exhortation did not come from error or uncleanness, nor was it in deceit.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, even so we speak, not as pleasing men, but God who tests our hearts.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For neither at any time did we use flattering words, as you know, nor a cloak for covetousness – God is witness.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Nor did we seek glory from men, either from you or from others, when we might have made demands as apostles of Christ.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But we were gentle among you, just as a nursing mother cherishes her own children.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So, affectionately longing for you, we were well pleased to impart to you not only the gospel of God, but also our own lives, because you had become dear to us.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:48-59  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>48</dt><dd>But he who did not know, yet committed things deserving of stripes, shall be beaten with few. For everyone to whom much is given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been committed, of him they will ask the more.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>I came to send fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am till it is accomplished!</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>Do you suppose that I came to give peace on earth? I tell you, not at all, but rather division.</dd><dt>52</dt><dd>For from now on five in one house will be divided: three against two, and two against three.</dd><dt>53</dt><dd>Father will be divided against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”</dd><dt>54</dt><dd>Then He also said to the multitudes, “Whenever you see a cloud rising out of the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming’; and so it is.</dd><dt>55</dt><dd>And when you see the south wind blow, you say, ‘There will be hot weather’; and there is.</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>Hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky and of the earth, but how is it you do not discern this time?</dd><dt>57</dt><dd>Yes, and why, even of yourselves, do you not judge what is right?</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, make every effort along the way to settle with him, lest he drag you to the judge, the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.</dd><dt>59</dt><dd>I tell you, you shall not depart from there till you have paid the very last mite.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 2:9-14  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For you remember, brethren, our labor and toil; for laboring night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you, we preached to you the gospel of God.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>You are witnesses, and God also, how devoutly and justly and blamelessly we behaved ourselves among you who believe;</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>as you know how we exhorted, and comforted, and charged every one of you, as a father does his own children,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>that you would walk worthy of God who calls you into His own kingdom and glory.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For this reason we also thank God without ceasing, because when you received the word of God which you heard from us, you welcomed it not as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which also effectively works in you who believe.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>For you, brethren, became imitators of the churches of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus. For you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen, just as they did from the Judeans,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 13:1-9  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>There were present at that season some who told Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to them, “Do you suppose that these Galileans were worse sinners than all other Galileans, because they suffered such things?</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, do you think that they were worse sinners than all other men who dwelt in Jerusalem?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>He also spoke this parable: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it and found none.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then he said to the keeper of his vineyard, ‘Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree and find none. Cut it down; why does it use up the ground?’</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But he answered and said to him, ‘Sir, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And if it bears fruit, well. But if not, after that you can cut it down.’”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 2:14-19  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>For you, brethren, became imitators of the churches of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus. For you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen, just as they did from the Judeans,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they do not please God and are contrary to all men,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved, so as always to fill up the measure of their sins; but wrath has come upon them to the uttermost.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>But we, brethren, having been taken away from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavored more eagerly to see your face with great desire.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Therefore we wanted to come to you – even I, Paul, time and again – but Satan hindered us.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Is it not even you in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His coming?</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 13:31-35  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>On that very day some Pharisees came, saying to Him, “Get out and depart from here, for Herod wants to kill You.”</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Go, tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.’</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Nevertheless I must journey today, tomorrow, and the day following; for it cannot be that a prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, but you were not willing!</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>See! Your house is left to you desolate; and assuredly, I say to you, you shall not see Me until the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 8:1-5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Moreover, brethren, we make known to you the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded in the riches of their liberality.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For I bear witness that according to their ability, yes, and beyond their ability, they were freely willing,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>imploring us with much urgency that we would receive the gift and the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And not only as we had hoped, but they first gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 9:37-43  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>Now it happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met Him.</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>Suddenly a man from the multitude cried out, saying, “Teacher, I implore You, look on my son, for he is my only child.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out; it convulses him so that he foams at the mouth; and it departs from him with great difficulty, bruising him.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>So I implored Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>And as he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. Then Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the child, and gave him back to his father.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>And they were all amazed at the majesty of God. But while everyone marveled at all the things which Jesus did, He said to His disciples,</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 28:16-20  (1st  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age. Amen.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 2:4-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>4</dt><dd>But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>even when we were dead in trespasses, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved),</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>and raised us up together, and made us sit together in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>that in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>not of works, lest anyone should boast.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand that we should walk in them.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:25-37  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>And behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested Him, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>He said to him, “What is written in the law? What is your reading of it?”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>So he answered and said, “’You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind,’ and ‘your neighbor as yourself.’” </dd><dt>28</dt><dd>And He said to him, “You have answered rightly; do this and you will live.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>But he, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Then Jesus answered and said: “A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, who stripped him of his clothing, wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Now by chance a certain priest came down that road. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Likewise a Levite, when he arrived at the place, came and looked, and passed by on the other side.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was. And when he saw him, he had compassion.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>So he went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine; and he set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, gave them to the innkeeper, and said to him, ‘Take care of him; and whatever more you spend, when I come again, I will repay you.’</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>So which of these three do you think was neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?”</dd><dt>37</dt><dd>And he said, “He who showed mercy on him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 2 - Proverbs 10 3 8  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The memory of the righteous is with praise and the blessing of the Lord is upon his head. Blessed is the man who has found wisdom and the mortal who has understanding. For it is better to purchase her than treasuries of gold and silver. She is more precious than precious stones and all that is precious is unworthy of her. For length of days and years of life are in her right hand; and in her left hand are riches and glory. Out of her mouth proceeds righteousness and she bears law and mercy upon her tongue.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Hear me, O child, for I will speak noble things. Blessed is the man who keeps my ways, for my ways are the ways of life, and in them is prepared favor from the Lord. Therefore, I pray thee, and utter my voice to the sons of men: For I, wisdom, have dwelt with counsel and knowledge and I have called upon understanding. Counsel and safety are mine, understanding and strength are mine. I love those who love me and those seeking me shall find grace.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Understand craftiness, O you who are simple, and imbibe knowledge, you who are untaught. Hear me again, for I will speak noble things: I will open my mouth and from my lips shall come what is right. For my throat shall meditate truth; false lips are an abomination before me. All the words of my mouth are righteous; there is nothing in them that is twisted or perverse. They are all straight to him who understands and right to those who find knowledge.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I shall instruct you in truth, so that your hope will be in the Lord and you shall be filled with the Spirit.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 4 - Proverbs 10 Wisdom of Solomon 6 7 8 9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The mouth of the righteous bringeth forth wisdom; the lips of the wise man know grace. The mouth of the wise speaketh wisdom, and the truth delivereth them from death. If a righteous man dies, hope doth not, for the son of the righteous is born to life, and in his own good things he acquireth the fruit of righteousness. There is always light for the righteous and they obtain grace and glory from the Lord. The tongue of the wise is a good sister-in-law, and in their hearts resteth wisdom. The Lord loveth the hearts of the holy, and acceptable to Him are all the undefiled in the way.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>The wisdom of the Lord illumineth the faces of the wise. For she takes hold of those desiring her by making herself first known to them. She is easily seen by those who love her. He who rises early to seek her shall have no difficulty, and those keeping vigil for the sake of her shall quickly be without sorrows. For she goeth about seeking those worthy of her, and graciously revealeth herself in the pathways. Against wisdom evil doth not prevail.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Therefore I was a lover of her beauty; I loved her and sought her out from my youth. I desired to make her my bride, and even the Master of All loved her. For she is an initiate in the knowledge of God, and a discoverer of His works. Her labors are virtues, for she teaches temperance and prudence, justice and courage; nothing in life is more necessary for men than these. And if anyone desireth much knowledge, she knoweth the things of old, and beholdeth things to come; she understandeth turns of speech and the solution of riddles; she has foreknowledge of signs and wonders and the outcome of times and seasons. She is a mediator of good things for all, for immortality is in her, and glory in the company of her words.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Therefore I appealed to the Lord and prayed to Him, and said to Him with all my heart: “O God of my fathers and Lord of mercy, Who hast made all things by Thy word, and by Thy wisdom hast fashioned man that he should have dominion over the creatures made by Thee, that he should rule the world in holiness and righteousness: Give me wisdom that sits by Thy throne, and cast me not away from among Thy children, for I am Thy servant and the son of Thy handmaid. Send her forth from the heavens, from Thy holy abode, and from the throne of Thy glory, that she may be with me, and instruct me in what is pleasing to Thee. And she shall guide me in understanding, and preserve me in her glory. For the thoughts of mortals are miserable, and their intentions likely to fail.”</dd></dl>
