readings.title: Composite 5 - Wisdom of Solomon 4 6 7 2  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>When the righteous is praised, the people rejoice: For his memory is immortality, since it is known both by the Lord and by men, for his soul was pleasing to the Lord. Therefore love wisdom, O men, and live. Desire her and be instructed: For her beginning is love and the keeping of her laws. Honor wisdom that you may reign forever.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>I will tell you and not hide the mysteries of God from you. For He is the Guide of wisdom, the Corrector of the wise and the Artisan of all thoughts and deeds. Wisdom will teach with all understanding: For in her is a Spirit, intelligent and holy, the Radiance of the Everlasting Light and the Image of the Grace of God.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>She fashions friends of God and prophets. For she is more beautiful than the sun and above all the order of the stars. Compared with the light she is found to be first. She delivered from infirmities those pleasing her and guided them on the paths of righteousness. She gave to them understanding to be holy and to preserve them from those who would ensnare them, and she granted them strength in struggles, so that all might understand that the most powerful of all is piety, and that evil might not prevail against wisdom, nor judgment pass away without convicting the wicked.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Having reasoned unrighteously, they said to themselves, “Let us oppress the righteous man and not spare his venerableness, nor let us be ashamed of the gray hairs of the old man of many years. But let our might be our law and let us seize the righteous, because he is inconvenient to us and is opposed to our deeds; he reproaches us for apostasy against the law and divulges the sins of our training.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>“He declares to us to have knowledge of God and calls himself a child of the Lord. He became to us a reproof of our thoughts; the very sight of him is a burden to us, because his life is unlike that of others, and his ways are very different. We are considered by him to be an insult, and he avoids our ways as unclean; he calls the end of the righteous blessed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>“Let us see if his words are true; let us test him to see what will happen to him. Let us torment him with revilement and tortures, that we may understand his meekness and test his guilelessness. Let us condemn him to a shameful death, for, according to his own words, he shall be respected.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Thus they reasoned, but were deceived, for their wickedness blinded them. They did not know the mysteries of God, nor did they discern that Thou alone art God, having the power of life and death: Who savest in times of affliction and deliverest from every evil; Who art compassionate and merciful, granting Grace to His venerable ones, and opposing the proud with His arm.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:1-9  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 7:26-8:2  (Epistle St John Chrysostom)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>26</dt><dd>For such a High Priest was fitting for us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and has become higher than the heavens;</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>who does not need daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for his own sins and then for the people’s, for this He did once for all when He offered up Himself.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For the law appoints as high priests men who have weakness, but the word of the oath, which came after the law, appoints the Son who has been perfected forever.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now this is the main point of the things we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord erected, and not man.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 10:9-16  (Gospel St John Chrysostom)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 2:20-3:8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>For you are our glory and joy.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, when we could no longer endure it, we thought it good to be left in Athens alone,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>and sent Timothy, our brother and minister of God, and our fellow laborer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you and encourage you concerning your faith,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>that no one should be shaken by these afflictions; for you yourselves know that we are appointed to this.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For, in fact, we told you before when we were with you that we would suffer tribulation, just as it happened, and you know.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For this reason, when I could no longer endure it, I sent him to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor might be in vain.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But now that Timothy has come to us from you, and brought us good news of your faith and love, and that you always have good remembrance of us, greatly desiring to see us, as we also to see you – </dd><dt>7</dt><dd>therefore, brethren, in all our affliction and distress we were comforted concerning you by your faith.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 14:12-15  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Then He also said to him who invited Him, “When you give a dinner or a supper, do not ask your friends, your brothers, your relatives, nor rich neighbors, lest they also invite you back, and you be repaid.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But when you give a feast, invite the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you; for you shall be repaid at the resurrection of the just.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Now when one of those who sat at the table with Him heard these things, he said to Him, “Blessed is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:9-16  (Epistle Apostle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men condemned to death; for we have been made a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to men.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are distinguished, but we are dishonored!</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and we are poorly clothed, and beaten, and homeless.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And we labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we endure;</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>being defamed, we entreat. We have been made as the filth of the world, the offscouring of all things until now.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved children I warn you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For though you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore I urge you, imitate me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 1:43-51  (Gospel Apostle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>43</dt><dd>The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, and also the prophets, wrote – Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>Nathanael answered and said to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”</dd><dt>50</dt><dd>Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”</dd><dt>51</dt><dd>And He said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 3:9-13  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For what thanks can we render to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sake before our God,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face and perfect what is lacking in your faith?</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Now may our God and Father Himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And may the Lord make you increase and abound in love to one another and to all, just as we do to you,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>so that He may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 14:25-35  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>25</dt><dd>Now great multitudes went with Him. And He turned and said to them,</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>“If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he cannot be My disciple.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And whoever does not bear his cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>For which of you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down first and count the cost, whether he has enough to finish it – </dd><dt>29</dt><dd>lest, after he has laid the foundation, and is not able to finish, all who see it begin to mock him,</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>Or what king, going to make war against another king, does not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Or else, while the other is still a great way off, he sends a delegation and asks conditions of peace.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>So likewise, whoever of you does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>Salt is good; but if the salt has lost its flavor, how shall it be seasoned?</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>It is neither fit for the land nor for the dunghill, but men throw it out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 4:1-12  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Finally then, brethren, we urge and exhort in the Lord Jesus that you should abound more and more, just as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God;</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>for you know what commandments we gave you through the Lord Jesus.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you should abstain from sexual immorality;</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>that each of you should know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honor,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>not in passion of lust, like the Gentiles who do not know God;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>that no one should take advantage of and defraud his brother in this matter, because the Lord is the avenger of all such, as we also forewarned you and testified.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For God did not call us to uncleanness, but in holiness.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Therefore he who rejects this does not reject man, but God, who has also given us His Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>But concerning brotherly love you have no need that I should write to you, for you yourselves are taught by God to love one another;</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>and indeed you do so toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brethren, that you increase more and more;</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>that you also aspire to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>that you may walk properly toward those who are outside, and that you may lack nothing.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 15:1-10  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then all the tax collectors and the sinners drew near to Him to hear Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the Pharisees and scribes complained, saying, “This Man receives sinners and eats with them.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>So He spoke this parable to them, saying:</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>“What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he loses one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>I say to you that likewise there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine just persons who need no repentance.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Or what woman, having ten silver coins, if she loses one coin, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search carefully until she finds it?</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And when she has found it, she calls her friends and neighbors together, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the piece which I lost!’</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Likewise, I say to you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Peter 1:1-2:6  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the pilgrims of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit, for obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>to an inheritance incorruptible and undefiled and that does not fade away, reserved in heaven for you,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>who are kept by the power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been grieved by various trials,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>that the genuineness of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perishes, though it is tested by fire, may be found to praise, honor, and glory at the revelation of Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>whom having not seen you love. Though now you do not see Him, yet believing, you rejoice with joy inexpressible and full of glory,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>receiving the end of your faith – the salvation of your souls.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Of this salvation the prophets have inquired and searched carefully, who prophesied of the grace that would come to you,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>searching what, or what manner of time, the Spirit of Christ who was in them was indicating when He testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ and the glories that would follow.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>To them it was revealed that, not to themselves, but to us they were ministering the things which now have been reported to you through those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven – things which angels desire to look into.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and rest your hope fully upon the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>as obedient children, not conforming yourselves to the former lusts, as in your ignorance;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>but as He who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>because it is written, “Be holy, for I am holy.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And if you call on the Father, who without partiality judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves throughout the time of your stay here in fear;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, like silver or gold, from your aimless conduct received by tradition from your fathers,</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>He indeed was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>who through Him believe in God, who raised Him from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Since you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit in sincere love of the brethren, love one another fervently with a pure heart,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>having been born again, not of corruptible seed but incorruptible, through the word of God which lives and abides forever,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>because “All flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls away,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>but the word of the LORD endures forever.” Now this is the word which by the gospel was preached to you.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, laying aside all malice, all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>as newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is gracious.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Coming to Him as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>you also, as living stones, are being built up a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore it is also contained in the Scripture, “Behold, I lay in Zion a chief cornerstone, elect, precious, and he who believes on Him will by no means be put to shame.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Peter 2:21-3:9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>For to this you were called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>“Who committed no sin, nor was deceit found in His mouth”;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>who, when He was reviled, did not revile in return; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but committed Himself to Him who judges righteously;</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>who Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live for righteousness – by whose stripes you were healed.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>For you were like sheep going astray, but have now returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Wives, likewise, be submissive to your own husbands, that even if some do not obey the word, they, without a word, may be won by the conduct of their wives,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>when they observe your chaste conduct accompanied by fear.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Do not let your adornment be merely outward – arranging the hair, wearing gold, or putting on fine apparel – </dd><dt>4</dt><dd>rather let it be the hidden person of the heart, with the incorruptible beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For in this manner, in former times, the holy women who trusted in God also adorned themselves, being submissive to their own husbands,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose daughters you are if you do good and are not afraid with any terror.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Husbands, likewise, dwell with them with understanding, giving honor to the wife, as to the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>Finally, all of you be of one mind, having compassion for one another; love as brothers, be tenderhearted, be courteous;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>not returning evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary blessing, knowing that you were called to this, that you may inherit a blessing.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Peter 4:1-11  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, since Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same mind, for he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh for the lusts of men, but for the will of God.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For we have spent enough of our past lifetime in doing the will of the Gentiles – when we walked in lewdness, lusts, drunkenness, revelries, drinking parties, and abominable idolatries.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>In regard to these, they think it strange that you do not run with them in the same flood of dissipation, speaking evil of you.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>They will give an account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>For this reason the gospel was preached also to those who are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But the end of all things is at hand; therefore be serious and watchful in your prayers.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And above all things have fervent love for one another, for “love will cover a multitude of sins.”</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>As each one has received a gift, minister it to one another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.</dd></dl>

readings.title: John 21:15-25  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Corinthians 4:9-16  (Epistle Apostle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men condemned to death; for we have been made a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to men.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are distinguished, but we are dishonored!</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and we are poorly clothed, and beaten, and homeless.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And we labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we endure;</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>being defamed, we entreat. We have been made as the filth of the world, the offscouring of all things until now.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved children I warn you.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>For though you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Therefore I urge you, imitate me.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 9:9-13  (Gospel Apostle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” So he arose and followed Him.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Now it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, that behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>When Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.” </dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 5:1-8  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, you have no need that I should write to you.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For you yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so comes as a thief in the night.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>For when they say, “Peace and safety!” then sudden destruction comes upon them, as labor pains upon a pregnant woman. And they shall not escape.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But you, brethren, are not in darkness, so that this Day should overtake you as a thief.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>You are all sons of light and sons of the day. We are not of the night nor of darkness.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore let us not sleep, as others do, but let us watch and be sober.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk are drunk at night.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But let us who are of the day be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet the hope of salvation.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 16:1-9  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>He also said to His disciples: “There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and an accusation was brought to him that this man was wasting his goods.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>So he called him and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your stewardship, for you can no longer be steward.’</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Then the steward said within himself, ‘What shall I do? For my master is taking the stewardship away from me. I cannot dig; I am ashamed to beg.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>I have resolved what to do, that when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.’</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>So he called every one of his master’s debtors to him, and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And he said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ So he said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ So he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ And he said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So the master commended the unjust steward because he had dealt shrewdly. For the sons of this world are more shrewd in their generation than the sons of light.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>And I say to you, make friends for yourselves by unrighteous mammon, that when you fail, they may receive you into an everlasting home.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Thessalonians 5:9-13 24-28  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>For God did not appoint us to wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>who died for us, that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with Him.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Therefore comfort each other and edify one another, just as you also are doing.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And we urge you, brethren, to recognize those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord and admonish you,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>and to esteem them very highly in love for their work’s sake. Be at peace among yourselves.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>He who calls you is faithful, who also will do it.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>Brethren, pray for us.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read to all the holy brethren.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 16:15-18 17:1-4  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>And He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For what is highly esteemed among men is an abomination in the sight of God.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>The law and the prophets were until John. Since that time the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is pressing into it.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tittle of the law to fail.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is divorced from her husband commits adultery.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no offenses should come, but woe to him through whom they do come!</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Take heed to yourselves. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day returns to you, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Corinthians 11:1-6  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Oh, that you would bear with me in a little folly – and indeed you do bear with me.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For I am jealous for you with godly jealousy. For I have betrothed you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But I fear, lest somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>For if he who comes preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a different gospel which you have not accepted – you may well put up with it!</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>For I consider that I am not at all inferior to the most eminent apostles.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Even though I am untrained in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. But we have been thoroughly manifested among you in all things.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 9:57-62  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>57</dt><dd>Now it happened as they journeyed on the road, that someone said to Him, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”</dd><dt>58</dt><dd>And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”</dd><dt>59</dt><dd>Then He said to another, “Follow Me.” But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”</dd><dt>60</dt><dd>Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and preach the kingdom of God.”</dd><dt>61</dt><dd>And another also said, “Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go and bid them farewell who are at my house.”</dd><dt>62</dt><dd>But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 16:1-8  (2nd  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint Him.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And they said among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>But when they looked up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away – for it was very large.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And entering the tomb, they saw a young man clothed in a long white robe sitting on the right side; and they were alarmed.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But go, tell His disciples – and Peter – that He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him, as He said to you.”</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>So they went out quickly and fled from the tomb, for they trembled and were amazed. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 2:14-22  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>14</dt><dd>For He Himself is our peace, who has made both one, and has broken down the middle wall of separation,</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to create in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>and that He might reconcile them both to God in one body through the cross, thereby putting to death the enmity.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And He came and preached peace to you who were afar off and to those who were near.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>For through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone,</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>in whom the whole building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord,</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God in the Spirit.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 12:16-21  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>16</dt><dd>Then He spoke a parable to them, saying: “The ground of a certain rich man yielded plentifully.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And he thought within himself, saying, ‘What shall I do, since I have no room to store my crops?’</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>So he said, ‘I will do this: I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there I will store all my crops and my goods.</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>‘And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years; take your ease; eat, drink, and be merry.”’</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>But God said to him, ‘Fool! This night your soul will be required of you; then whose will those things be which you have provided?’</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Thessalonians 1:1-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is fitting, because your faith grows exceedingly, and the love of every one of you all abounds toward each other,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>so that we ourselves boast of you among the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that you endure,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>which is manifest evidence of the righteous judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you also suffer;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>since it is a righteous thing with God to repay with tribulation those who trouble you,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>and to give you who are troubled rest with us when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with His mighty angels,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who do not know God, and on those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>These shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of His power,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>when He comes, in that Day, to be glorified in His saints and to be admired among all those who believe, because our testimony among you was believed.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 17:20-25  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>20</dt><dd>Now when He was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them and said, “The kingdom of God does not come with observation;</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>nor will they say, ‘See here!’ or ‘See there!’ For indeed, the kingdom of God is within you.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Then He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>And they will say to you, ‘Look here!’ or ‘Look there!’ Do not go after them or follow them.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>For as the lightning that flashes out of one part under heaven shines to the other part under heaven, so also the Son of Man will be in His day.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 17 - Exodus 40  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>The Lord spoke to Moses, saying: “On the first day of the first month you shall set up the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and you shall put in it the Ark and cover it with the veil. You shall bring in the table and the lampstand; and you shall set there a golden altar to burn incense before the Ark of the Testimony. And you shall put a covering on the door of the tabernacle of the Testimony.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>“Then you shall take the oil of anointing and anoint the Tabernacle and all that is in it, and consecrate it and all its vessels; and it shall be holy. And you shall consecrate the Altar of Burnt Offerings; it shall be most holy.”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And Moses did all that the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel had commanded him. And a cloud covered the Tabernacle of the Testimony and the glory of the Lord filled the Tabernacle. Moses was not able to enter the Tabernacle of the Testimony, because the cloud overshadowed it, and the glory of the Lord filled the Tabernacle.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Composite 18 - 3 [1] Kings 7 8  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>And it came to pass when Solomon had finished building the House of the Lord, he assembled all the elders of Israel in Zion, to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord out of the City of David, which is Zion. And the priests took up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tabernacle of the Testimony.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the King and all Israel went before the Ark. And the priests brought the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord to its place, into the Oracle of the Temple, into the Holy of Holies, under the wings of the cherubim. For the cherubim spread out their wings over the place of the Ark so that the cherubim made a covering above the Ark and its holy things above. There was nothing in the Ark except the two tablets of the Covenant which Moses put there at Horeb, when the Lord had made a Covenant.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>And when the priests came out from the holy place, a cloud filled the house. And the priests were unable to stand to minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord God Almighty filled the house.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ezekiel 43:27-44:4  (Vespers 3rd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>‘When these days are over it shall be, on the eighth day and thereafter, that the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar; and I will accept you,’ says the Lord God.”</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces toward the east, but it was shut.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>And the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, because the Lord God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>“As for the prince, because he is the prince, he may sit in it to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.”</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Also He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple; so I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord; and I fell on my face.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 1:39-49 56  (Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>39</dt><dd>Now Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, to a city of Judah,</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>and entered the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And it happened, when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, that the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>Then she spoke out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>For indeed, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.</dd><dt>45</dt><dd>Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord.”</dd><dt>46</dt><dd>And Mary said: “My soul magnifies the Lord,</dd><dt>47</dt><dd>and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>For He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant; for behold, henceforth all generations will call me blessed.</dd><dt>49</dt><dd>For He who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is His name.</dd><dt>56</dt><dd>And Mary remained with her about three months, and returned to her house.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Thessalonians 1:10-2:2  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>when He comes, in that Day, to be glorified in His saints and to be admired among all those who believe, because our testimony among you was believed.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Therefore we also pray always for you that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfill all the good pleasure of His goodness and the work of faith with power,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and you in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Now, brethren, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to Him, we ask you,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>not to be soon shaken in mind or troubled, either by spirit or by word or by letter, as if from us, as though the day of Christ had come.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 17:26-37  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>26</dt><dd>And as it was in the days of Noah, so it will be also in the days of the Son of Man:</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>They ate, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Likewise as it was also in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>but on the day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed them all.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>Even so will it be in the day when the Son of Man is revealed.</dd><dt>31</dt><dd>In that day, he who is on the housetop, and his goods are in the house, let him not come down to take them away. And likewise the one who is in the field, let him not turn back.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>Remember Lot’s wife.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>I tell you, in that night there will be two men in one bed: the one will be taken and the other will be left.</dd><dt>35</dt><dd>Two women will be grinding together: the one will be taken and the other left.</dd><dt>36</dt><dd>Two men will be in the field: the one will be taken and the other left. </dd><dt>37</dt><dd>And they answered and said to Him, “Where, Lord?” So He said to them, “Wherever the body is, there the eagles will be gathered together.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 9:1-7  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then indeed, even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot now speak in detail.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now when these things had been thus prepared, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But into the second part the high priest went alone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the people’s sins committed in ignorance;</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Thessalonians 2:1-12  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now, brethren, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to Him, we ask you,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>not to be soon shaken in mind or troubled, either by spirit or by word or by letter, as if from us, as though the day of Christ had come.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Let no one deceive you by any means; for that Day will not come unless the falling away comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of perdition,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God or that is worshiped, so that he sits as God in the temple of God, showing himself that he is God.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Do you not remember that when I was still with you I told you these things?</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>And now you know what is restraining, that he may be revealed in his own time.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work; only He who now restrains will do so until He is taken out of the way.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will consume with the breath of His mouth and destroy with the brightness of His coming.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>The coming of the lawless one is according to the working of Satan, with all power, signs, and lying wonders,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>and with all unrighteous deception among those who perish, because they did not receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And for this reason God will send them strong delusion, that they should believe the lie,</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>that they all may be condemned who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 18:15-17 26-30  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>15</dt><dd>Then they also brought infants to Him that He might touch them; but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>But Jesus called them to Him and said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of God.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>Assuredly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it.”</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>And those who heard it said, “Who then can be saved?”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But He said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Then Peter said, “See, we have left all and followed You.”</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>So He said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or parents or brothers or wife or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God,</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>who shall not receive many times more in this present time, and in the age to come eternal life.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 5:22-6:2  (Epistle St Alexander)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>22</dt><dd>But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Matthew 11:27-30  (Gospel St Alexander)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>27</dt><dd>All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.</dd><dt>29</dt><dd>Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.</dd><dt>30</dt><dd>For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Thessalonians 2:13-3:5  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>13</dt><dd>But we are bound to give thanks to God always for you, brethren beloved by the Lord, because God from the beginning chose you for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and belief in the truth,</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>to which He called you by our gospel, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Therefore, brethren, stand fast and hold the traditions which you were taught, whether by word or our epistle.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself, and our God and Father, who has loved us and given us everlasting consolation and good hope by grace,</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>comfort your hearts and establish you in every good word and work.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may run swiftly and be glorified, just as it is with you,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men; for not all have faith.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you and guard you from the evil one.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>And we have confidence in the Lord concerning you, both that you do and will do the things we command you.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the patience of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 18:31-34  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>31</dt><dd>Then He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished.</dd><dt>32</dt><dd>For He will be delivered to the Gentiles and will be mocked and insulted and spit upon.</dd><dt>33</dt><dd>They will scourge Him and kill Him. And the third day He will rise again.”</dd><dt>34</dt><dd>But they understood none of these things; this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know the things which were spoken.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 2 Thessalonians 3:6-18  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>6</dt><dd>But we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw from every brother who walks disorderly and not according to the tradition which he received from us.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>For you yourselves know how you ought to follow us, for we were not disorderly among you;</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>nor did we eat anyone’s bread free of charge, but worked with labor and toil night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>not because we do not have authority, but to make ourselves an example of how you should follow us.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For even when we were with you, we commanded you this: If anyone will not work, neither shall he eat.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>For we hear that there are some who walk among you in a disorderly manner, not working at all, but are busybodies.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>Now those who are such we command and exhort through our Lord Jesus Christ that they work in quietness and eat their own bread.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>But as for you, brethren, do not grow weary in doing good.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And if anyone does not obey our word in this epistle, note that person and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Yet do not count him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Now may the Lord of peace Himself give you peace always in every way. The Lord be with you all.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>The salutation of Paul with my own hand, which is a sign in every epistle; so I write.</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 19:12-28  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>12</dt><dd>Therefore He said: “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>So he called ten of his servants, delivered to them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Do business till I come.’</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But his citizens hated him, and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We will not have this man to reign over us.’</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And so it was that when he returned, having received the kingdom, he then commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>Then came the first, saying, ‘Master, your mina has earned ten minas.’</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And he said to him, ‘Well done, good servant; because you were faithful in a very little, have authority over ten cities.’</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>And the second came, saying, ‘Master, your mina has earned five minas.’</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>Likewise he said to him, ‘You also be over five cities.’</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Then another came, saying, ‘Master, here is your mina, which I have kept put away in a handkerchief.</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>For I feared you, because you are an austere man. You collect what you did not deposit, and reap what you did not sow.’</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>And he said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth I will judge you, you wicked servant. You knew that I was an austere man, collecting what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>Why then did you not put my money in the bank, that at my coming I might have collected it with interest?’</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>And he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to him who has ten minas.’</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>(But they said to him, ‘Master, he has ten minas.’)</dd><dt>26</dt><dd>‘For I say to you, that to everyone who has will be given; and from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>But bring here those enemies of mine, who did not want me to reign over them, and slay them before me.’”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>When He had said this, He went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Hebrews 9:1-7  (Epistle Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Then indeed, even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary.</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>For a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary;</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot now speak in detail.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Now when these things had been thus prepared, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services.</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>But into the second part the high priest went alone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the people’s sins committed in ignorance;</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:38-42 11:27-28  (Gospel Theotokos)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>38</dt><dd>Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”</dd><dt>27</dt><dd>And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”</dd><dt>28</dt><dd>But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”</dd></dl>

readings.title: Galatians 1:3-10  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>3</dt><dd>Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ, to a different gospel,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed.</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>For do I now persuade men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? For if I still pleased men, I would not be a bondservant of Christ.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 10:19-21  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>19</dt><dd>Behold, I give you the authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall by any means hurt you.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>Nevertheless do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice because your names are written in heaven.”</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>In that hour Jesus rejoiced in the Spirit and said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and revealed them to babes. Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Mark 16:9-20  (3rd  Matins Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>9</dt><dd>Now when He rose early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>She went and told those who had been with Him, as they mourned and wept.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>After that, He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>Later He appeared to the eleven as they sat at the table; and He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>And He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who does not believe will be condemned.</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And these signs will follow those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>they will take up serpents; and if they drink anything deadly, it will by no means hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>So then, after the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>And they went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the accompanying signs. Amen.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Ephesians 4:1-6  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>I, therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you to walk worthy of the calling with which you were called,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>with all lowliness and gentleness, with longsuffering, bearing with one another in love,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>endeavoring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>There is one body and one Spirit, just as you were called in one hope of your calling;</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>one Lord, one faith, one baptism;</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>one God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 13:10-17  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>10</dt><dd>Now He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bent over and could in no way raise herself up.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>But when Jesus saw her, He called her to Him and said to her, “Woman, you are loosed from your infirmity.”</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>And He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>But the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath; and he said to the crowd, “There are six days on which men ought to work; therefore come and be healed on them, and not on the Sabbath day.”</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>The Lord then answered him and said, “Hypocrite! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath loose his ox or donkey from the stall, and lead it away to water it?</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>So ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound – think of it – for eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath?”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And when He said these things, all His adversaries were put to shame; and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Timothy 1:1-7  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the commandment of God our Savior and the Lord Jesus Christ, our hope,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>to Timothy, a true son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>As I urged you when I went into Macedonia – remain in Ephesus that you may charge some that they teach no other doctrine,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>nor give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which cause disputes rather than godly edification which is in faith.</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>Now the purpose of the commandment is love from a pure heart, from a good conscience, and from sincere faith,</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>from which some, having strayed, have turned aside to idle talk,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>desiring to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say nor the things which they affirm.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 19:37-44  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>37</dt><dd>Then, as He was now drawing near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen,</dd><dt>38</dt><dd>saying: “‘Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the LORD!’ Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”</dd><dt>39</dt><dd>And some of the Pharisees called to Him from the crowd, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”</dd><dt>40</dt><dd>But He answered and said to them, “I tell you that if these should keep silent, the stones would immediately cry out.”</dd><dt>41</dt><dd>Now as He drew near, He saw the city and wept over it,</dd><dt>42</dt><dd>saying, “If you had known, even you, especially in this your day, the things that make for your peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.</dd><dt>43</dt><dd>For days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you, surround you and close you in on every side,</dd><dt>44</dt><dd>and level you, and your children within you, to the ground; and they will not leave in you one stone upon another, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Timothy 1:8-14  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>8</dt><dd>But we know that the law is good if one uses it lawfully,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>knowing this: that the law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and insubordinate, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>for fornicators, for sodomites, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjurers, and if there is any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God which was committed to my trust.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord who has enabled me, because He counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry,</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>although I was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and an insolent man; but I obtained mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And the grace of our Lord was exceedingly abundant, with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 19:45-48  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>45</dt><dd>Then He went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it, </dd><dt>46</dt><dd>saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’” </dd><dt>47</dt><dd>And He was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people sought to destroy Him,</dd><dt>48</dt><dd>and were unable to do anything; for all the people were very attentive to hear Him.</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Timothy 1:18-20 2:8-15  (Epistle)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>18</dt><dd>This charge I commit to you, son Timothy, according to the prophecies previously made concerning you, that by them you may wage the good warfare,</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>having faith and a good conscience, which some having rejected, concerning the faith have suffered shipwreck,</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I delivered to Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>I desire therefore that the men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting;</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>in like manner also, that the women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with propriety and moderation, not with braided hair or gold or pearls or costly clothing,</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>but, which is proper for women professing godliness, with good works.</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>Let a woman learn in silence with all submission.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>And I do not permit a woman to teach or to have authority over a man, but to be in silence.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>For Adam was formed first, then Eve.</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived, fell into transgression.</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>Nevertheless she will be saved in childbearing if they continue in faith, love, and holiness, with self-control.</dd></dl>

readings.title: Luke 20:1-8  (Gospel)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Now it happened on one of those days, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, that the chief priests and the scribes, together with the elders, confronted Him</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>and spoke to Him, saying, “Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Or who is he who gave You this authority?”</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>But He answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing, and answer Me:</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>The baptism of John – was it from heaven or from men?”</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>So they answered that they did not know where it was from.</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Peter 1:1-2:6  (Vespers 1st  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>1</dt><dd>Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the pilgrims of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit, for obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>to an inheritance incorruptible and undefiled and that does not fade away, reserved in heaven for you,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>who are kept by the power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been grieved by various trials,</dd><dt>7</dt><dd>that the genuineness of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perishes, though it is tested by fire, may be found to praise, honor, and glory at the revelation of Jesus Christ,</dd><dt>8</dt><dd>whom having not seen you love. Though now you do not see Him, yet believing, you rejoice with joy inexpressible and full of glory,</dd><dt>9</dt><dd>receiving the end of your faith – the salvation of your souls.</dd><dt>10</dt><dd>Of this salvation the prophets have inquired and searched carefully, who prophesied of the grace that would come to you,</dd><dt>11</dt><dd>searching what, or what manner of time, the Spirit of Christ who was in them was indicating when He testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ and the glories that would follow.</dd><dt>12</dt><dd>To them it was revealed that, not to themselves, but to us they were ministering the things which now have been reported to you through those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven – things which angels desire to look into.</dd><dt>13</dt><dd>Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and rest your hope fully upon the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;</dd><dt>14</dt><dd>as obedient children, not conforming yourselves to the former lusts, as in your ignorance;</dd><dt>15</dt><dd>but as He who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct,</dd><dt>16</dt><dd>because it is written, “Be holy, for I am holy.”</dd><dt>17</dt><dd>And if you call on the Father, who without partiality judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves throughout the time of your stay here in fear;</dd><dt>18</dt><dd>knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, like silver or gold, from your aimless conduct received by tradition from your fathers,</dd><dt>19</dt><dd>but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.</dd><dt>20</dt><dd>He indeed was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you</dd><dt>21</dt><dd>who through Him believe in God, who raised Him from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>Since you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit in sincere love of the brethren, love one another fervently with a pure heart,</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>having been born again, not of corruptible seed but incorruptible, through the word of God which lives and abides forever,</dd><dt>24</dt><dd>because “All flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls away,</dd><dt>25</dt><dd>but the word of the LORD endures forever.” Now this is the word which by the gospel was preached to you.</dd><dt>1</dt><dd>Therefore, laying aside all malice, all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking,</dd><dt>2</dt><dd>as newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby,</dd><dt>3</dt><dd>if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is gracious.</dd><dt>4</dt><dd>Coming to Him as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious,</dd><dt>5</dt><dd>you also, as living stones, are being built up a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.</dd><dt>6</dt><dd>Therefore it is also contained in the Scripture, “Behold, I lay in Zion a chief cornerstone, elect, precious, and he who believes on Him will by no means be put to shame.”</dd></dl>

readings.title: 1 Peter 2:21-3:9  (Vespers 2nd  reading)
readings.contents: <dl class="reading"><dt>21</dt><dd>For to this you were called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:</dd><dt>22</dt><dd>“Who committed no sin, nor was deceit found in His mouth”;</dd><dt>23</dt><dd>who, when He was reviled, did not revile in return;
